description:
"I'll be back"

Coconut Chicken Curry: Nice Large, tender chicken chunks, great flavor, sauce made perfect dipping sauce for the Naan. 

Onion Kulcha: great consistency and flavor.

Rice Pilou: typical Indian rice, but I did notice the sweetness of the raisins much more than I've noticed them in the past, tasted great. 

Cherry Naan: never thought to try this before but I will be ordering this every time going forward. Loved the subtle flavor of cherry even though I would've assumed the Bright red, thick cherry spread would have been too much cherry, but it was perfectly executed.

Saag Chana: my friend actually really liked it, I thought the flavor was a bit bland. 

Fast delivery, hot when it arrives. Delivery bag packed perfect, no leaks/spills, which I've had many times in the past from other places.
author: Gage S.

description:
There are two things I love about this restaurant: the samosa, which is really good and the lamb coconut curry, which is to die for. I have ordered other items in the past and they were not as tasty. Also, their level of spiciness is all messed up. Sometimes, I order medium spice and it is not spicy at all and sometimes it burns your stomach for days.
Overall it is a decent Indian restaurant. 
I just don't think I will ever try other items.
author: Ashish N.

description:
Star India has gone downhill over the past decade. The manager was really vague about who was running the place now and didn't want to give up the names of the owners (shady). 

I'm really grossed out by the fact that they spray Windex in the dining area where people are eating (instead of just using a rag soaked in antiseptic solution). The manager confirmed that the spray they use is indeed Windex and didn't seem to think chemicals wafting into diners' food was a big deal. He also mentioned off hand that the Health Department was in there "all the time" - as if this was supposed to justify their use of the spray. Out of curiosity, I looked up their score online (he DID mention the Health Department was there "all the time") and was disgusted to find that they had a few instances of "high risk vermin infestation" (https://101g-xnet.sfdph.org:8443/ords/eeopn/f?p=132:2:::NO::P2_LOCATIONID:19076). It seems to have improved in recent months - but still. The bathroom is dirty, the buffet food usually tastes two days old, and apparently spraying chemicals near food while people are eating is okay with them. This no longer seems like a restaurant with a commitment to food safety practices. I think it's time to take my business elsewhere.
author: L D.

description: Star India is hands down one of my favorite Indian and small business in SF. They are really on top of their business, always answer the phone, and deliver on time. The food is very reasonably priced (example: a hearty portion of all white meat chicken tandoori will only run you about $12.95 and it comes with some peppers and onions as well). Their Aloo Gobi is delicious, as is their naan. They don't deliver all over SF, so you have to venture away from downtown or closer to their shop, but it's worth seeking out. Would happily cater company meals from them if they ever opened that option. The food is great quality and they are very pleasant to interact with on a frequent basis. Try out their Indian pizzas, they have a variety for all dietary restrictions from carnivores to vegetarians and even vegans. Delicious twist on Indian flavor, definitely check those pies out.
author: Alison A.

description:
These three cubes of cheese wouldn't stop bad mouthing the pizza's mom. Hegga rude, str8 bebe's kids. It went on for a minute till the pizza lost its shzz and started swinging on them. It punched one or two of the cheeses in the face. But the third cheese jumped on the pizza's back. They busted out the restaurant, all outta pocket on the sidewalk n shzz... I videoed the whole thing on my phone and posted it to WORLD STAR INDIA HIP HOP. jk

My very first slice had a produce sticker not on it but IN it, like between the slices as I pulled them apart. That was the only weird thing.

The PIZZA itself was hearty, kinda thicc, generous cheese, could've been more chicken though. #thatswhatshesaid #nobromo The PANEER was great for pouring onto the pizza. Everything showed up piping hot.

Hot like these streets son! The lunch is hot the lunch is hot!
author: Dan B.

description: I was not a big fan of Star India. I ordered the Lamb Tikka Masala with Basmati rice. I asked for Mild spicy and my dinner was the opposite of spicy. There did not seem to even be any flavor to the Lamb Tikka Masala as all you tasted was your taste buds on fire. I have had spicy Lamb Tikka before and I could still taste the flavors through the spicyness. The rice did not have much flavor either and tasted kind of plain. I also usually experience that the lamb falls apart when you go to eat it which is awesome because of the way it was cooked yet the lamb from here did not fall apart and was just a kind of block you had to chew through. We also ordered garlic naan and I want to believe that they just messed up the order and sent us regular naan because nothing about that naan tasted garlicky.
author: Yochabel U.

description:
star india was not as i thought it would be the service was awesome and great ambience. but the food was wonderful alothou it was late a little and i thought they should of bought all the food at once instead of 3 times .
i like my food to be all put down at once so apart from that all in all it was a great meal ,
author: Tony B.

description: Really good customer service and good food. Price very reasonable and the place is cozy and nice.
author: Laura H.

description:
Great food. Consistent flavors and texture. Only drawback was....some dude cut in front of me in the line to pay, and the restaurant gave him his bill first even though I had been waiting for 15 minutes. 

The meal was good. The lack of service was disappointing. Wonder if they're short staffed?
author: Michelle T.

description: Just had the yellow chicken curry with rice and it was delicious! Also got a complimentary scoop of mango ice cream with Yelp check-in. Thank you Star India!
author: David W.

description: The lunch buffet is a GREAT deal especially for San Francisco! Whenever I'm in town, I always come here to eat. Definitely 5 stars for the budget factor. It's a small buffet but there's options for both vegetarians and meat eaters. The gulab jamun and keer is a sweet way to finish off the meal. So tasty that I have to have a second serving of those!
author: Ray M.

description:
BLESSINGS OF RAO TO YOU!
This is most warm and comfortable Indian Food Restaurant in West San Francisco!

$ Fair Price for a all you can eat buffet and amazing Mango Lassie  

Wonderful Staff. LGBTQIAA Friendly.
All are Welcome Here!
author: Shawn S.

description: First time stopping by and Im very impressed with the customer service. Very professional, welcoming and the prices are very reasonable. Plus they offer a full buffet with all my indian favorites including but not limited to Tikka Masala, saag, and basmati rice. A new favorite spot
author: Cacedra G.

description:
I absolutely love this place. The staff is amazingly sweet and always helpful. If you go try the buffet 10/10. Get the Samosas and the Channa Masala. 
Will be coming back here for sure!!
author: Anthony F.

description: Everybody liked everything including the lassi. The food was very fresh and had a great balance of both vegetarian and meat options. Additionally, it was nice to try their HOUSE MADE ice cream. Makes the experience all the more authentic.
author: Ahlea-Mae C.

description: Had lamb biryani and mango lassi here and both were upto mark. The biryani was spicy which i really liked.
author: Sharad B.

description:
We had a big weeknight project and decided to get some food to go.  On the online menu there is a "vegetarian meal for 2" and a "non- vegetarian meal for 2".

We opted for the latter  We went in to order and the guy working the cash register just could not figure out what we were ordering (we showed him the online option on my phone, he looked confused, then he asked us what was in it - we read that off and he rang it up (of course as single menu items they come out to more money. My husband found a real take out menu and pointed it out to the guy and finally he figured it out. 

It actually was a fairly good deal, 2 samosas, a huge garlic Nan, chicken tikka, lamb korma, and it also included raita (a yogurt sauce and 2 sauces for the samosas. I believe it was about $27. There were plenty of leftovers.

The samosa were pretty good. The chicken and the lamb were a little tough, though the korma sauce was quite good.
author: Amy W.

description: Greatest Indian restaurant on Geary! nice service and great food. The the buffet is so cheap and nice, only like 12 bucks with many foods being provided
author: Shiyan W.

description:
I work in the area and I love Indian food. I usually do the buffet so it's all I can speak on. I agree with other reviews it seems they're pinching pennies by reheating old food at the buffet cause some dishes are just bad.

Chicken tandoori is my favorite Indian dish but here one day it was mushy and so old I could not believe they had it out to serve. Almost ruined my favorite dish for me honestly. Their naan is excellent and the spinach saag and chicken tikka are tasty.

Alas, the kicker was the roach I saw under the sugar for the tea earlier this week. My stomach turned and I just can't go back now. Ughh.
author: Beaky L.

description:
This is worst Indian restaurant I have ever visited in Bay area .
I guess they are not serving the fresh food.
I tasted rice . The rice seems to be not good. I told a guy over there but he ignored.
Gulab jamun it's awful.
All the curries taste wiered.
They are serving buffet but they don't even serve fried rice or biryani.
Seems like this is only one Indian restaurant near SF downtown.
I guess this is the reason it is still surviving.
When we compressor with the restuarants in sanjose and Sunnyvale , this is the more worse.
author: Tej Ah K.

description:
This is by farrrr the best Indian food I've had in the city! And for an excellent price!!! 
Everything was fresh, hot, and tasty.
author: Kim G.

description: Amazing indian cuisine buffet! It's a tradition now to visit this place once a month for the buffet! Great service!!
author: Ashish R.

description:
I ordered take out Chicken Tikka Masala, onion naan, pulao rice, a side of raita and Saag with prawns. The naan was excellent, the rice fine but bland. I'm most upset about the entrees that cost $12-14 each. They were overcooked watery bland soup. The yogurt raita and Tikka Masala sauce poured out like water with no flavor at all. The Saag with prawns looked like baby food and had a bad fishy smell coming from the container when I opened it, I was unsure if it was safe to eat.

I get these dishes all the time at other restaurants and this by far was the worst I've ever seen or been served. For a $50 food order I was very very disappointed with the food quality.
author: Heather B.

description:
Stays above the pack of similar places by seeking a balance to serve everyone...  Star India is a balance of great food experience that is:
+ Not too spicy but still authentic flavors
+ Not too expensy but still adds value to your experience
+ Not a nosy or pushy service but a customer service that cares to personalize your visit

If you are on the health bandwagon and dont want to lower your standards, they serve greeny lettuce/salad that can use to make your own salad with Indian entrees (vegetarian/chickenetarian). The buffets are an easy bet unless you want to get little adventurous.   Free wifi is an added benefit :)
author: Arun J.

description: Went back after my last review, and my opinion has definitely changed. I still wouldn't recommend the buffet for anyone who likes traditional Indian food; but I ordered off the menu and I was impressed.
author: Lucas T.

description: This is such a cute Indian restaurant. It's really a big bang for your buck and if you don't go here because of the bad reviews you are making a mistake. You really can't beat $11.00, plus they have unlimited chai included in the buffet! The people are so nice here and make you feel so warm and welcome. All I'm saying is...$11.00 people and for a college student this is so prime, don't miss out!
author: Lily T.

description: Every time I come here, I am met with attentive waiters, great music, and amazing food! It's a cute little place, perfect for dining with the family or a dateThe buffet has a variety of yummy Indian food at your fingertips; I always go back for seconds. Great place if you are craving all of your favorite Indian foods. 5 stars all the way!
author: Alexa B.

description:
I was near the Indian consulate and had to pass my time waiting for some documents.
That's When I bumped into this restaurant.

Very close by to the consulate. I had a feast when I was there, the vibes are great, the people are absolutely warm and welcoming.

The food is amazing! Both vegetarian and Non -vegetarian options on the menu. I opted for the buffet. My personal favourite was the lamb, nicely cooked soft lamb with thick mild spicy gravy along with naan, it was absolutely divine.

There was paneer saag, tandoori chicken, and chicken pakora too. Desserts had Gulab jamun which were just fine. They would be great if they had to be softer. To end the meal they had Tea. All and all I came out with my stomach growing little bigger.
author: Pratik S.

description:
Delicious as ALWAYS! Their buffet does not disappoint! As well as excellent service! 
Definitely recommend this place!
author: Luis M.

description:
Great Food!!! You won't go wrong. The service is amazing!
Sandra the manager is great, sweet and knows how to handle her business. Come support and try the buffet as well amazing!
author: Sarah A.

description: On Thursday I had the buffet around 1:30. Everything was delicious and every dish tasted good with every other one. I went with my family. I think it's the fourth or fifth time we've eaten from this place. We all love the food here so much. I highly recommend it.
author: Naomi D.

description: Decent Indian lunch buffet. Limited varieties but good quality compared to other near by  Indian restaurants. Worth giving it a try.
author: Devan K.

description: I went with my family for the first time in this restaurant. This restaurant is worth trying guy's. Amazing food with authentic indian flavours. Buffet with endless varities. Naan was so soft. Great service. The main makhan cook really good food. Economical range. Give it a try when u pass by.
author: Binod Y.

description: This is probably one of the worst Indian restaurants in the Bay Area. Not worth the money. Tasteless food and not to mention stale and COLD food. Disappointed especially considering that so many Indians live out in the Bay Area that would know how to bring some culture to the place. Good naan but other than that I would not recommend this place.
author: Divya A.

description:
Sue was great! Amazing food and plenty options.
Nice ambiance! Would definitely recommend.
author: Alex B.

description:
Great food! Love that they have paneer on the buffet, it's hard to find. The naan was really good as well 

The atmosphere is mellow and clean.
author: Stephanie M.

description: Friendly staff and nice lunch buffet! The food choices are various and they provide delicious tea which I love most! Naan was really good!
author: Di L.

description:
My first time trying Indian food and it was delicious! Such a good deal too, $10.99 for all you can eat Monday-thurs, it's a little more pricey on the weekends but still a good deal. The customer service was excellent as well, they're very friendly. 
There was also free chai tea which was delicious. Also if you if check in yelp you get free mango ice cream!
author: Sarah T.

description: Awesome garlic naan, creamy eggplant, mouth-watering lamb curry. All at a fantastic price.
author: William W.

description: This place is bomb.com. Great prices and the food is delicious. I always go for the buffet they have lamb curry, chicken tandoori, byryani rice, naan and some vegan options. The customer service is great too. I like to order al la carte as well you can choose your spice level. My favorite is the Began Baratha it's a vegan dish just delicious! Ooh yah the mango lassi is heaven sooo good!
author: Nina M.

description: Dominic did a very great job in providing excellent customer service! He is very nice! The buffet was really good and I look forward to coming back again!!
author: Jay C.

description:
The Revenue Death Spiral of Star India?

I have been eating here for more than twenty years. And, this may be the end.

A 30% raise in prices, at a time where attendance has been down, and an inconsistent quality of service asks, 

Is Star India in is last days?

If I like a restaurant, it must end.

Maybe, if you miss it, you might want to run by to visit one last time.
author: BigJohnS F.

description: All you can eat Indian buffet with a nice selection and great service at a reasonable price. The restaurant is centrally located in the inner Richmond. Parking was not an issue, even a weekends. My favorite dish was the chicken korma. The chicken tikka masala was also delicious! The free chai was a nice touch. I would definitely come back here!!
author: Johnny L.

description: This is my absolute favorite Indian restaurant in SF. Their buffet service is always on point, and consistently delicious. I love that they have a LUNCH and DINNER buffet. Also the service is highly attentive and friendly. Sue was very sweet and accommodative. The whole atmosphere is a positive experience.  Highly recommend!!
author: Helena M.

description: Went on lunch with friends with this place. I am very satisfied with the service, the food was delicious, my favorite is the chicken masala and fish curry. Their na-an was awesome too.  For $12.99, it's worth it! Plus check in on yelp and review, you get a free dessert. How awesome is that.
author: Michael S.

description: Really bad food, nothing like Indian food. Forget about Indian, this is probably the worst food I have had in a long time . Sorry to leave such a review but please don't waste your time going there. We had to kill sometime before we could pick up documents from the Indian Consulate and made the mistake of coming here. Staff was attentive, tea was perhaps the only think just okay.
author: Rups M.

description: Good Service and Excellent Food! Willing to come back! Wanting more food but got full very quick! Best host talks!
author: Michelle K.

description: Great food! Fantastic service! There was no wait and the staff was very helpful. Highly recommend if youre in the area. Kudos!
author: Bobbie A.

description:
Yummy :-) 
Good food all you can eat and not SF prices (Thank god)
author: David Z.

description:
If there were half stars, I'd give this 3.5.
Initially started ordering delivery from this spot, which was not bad at all. They always got the order correct. The only thing about this spot that I knocked a star off was for a time when they were 1 hour past their delivery time and were not willing to compensate for it. 
For the food, the price is definitely awesome for the quality they provide. A few dishes to name that I order frequently: Lamb Vindaloo, Saag paneer, Tandori chicken, Butter chicken and Garlic Naan. I have never been disappointed with these orders. One thing I recently discovered was that they have a lunch and dinner buffet everyday! Again, for the price, it's hard to knock it at $10.99. I'm a happy customer here and will continue to dine/order from this place. I would recommend this spot to anyone looking for quality Indian food at a great price.
author: Chris D.

description: Good selection of dishes, and the food is great. Glad to have this place in the neighborhood.
author: Eli F.

description:
Affordable, Good, Filling, Enjoyable Northern Indian Food for your buck.

-Service is good
-Saag Paneer and Butter Chicken was comforting
-Mango Lassi was excellent
-Dessert was good
-The buffet is worth $10.99

Recommend it to college students and local eaters
author: Brandon D.

description: It was good for the price and the service was pretty good considering it was buffet. But overall good food.
author: Angel F.

description: My favorite neighborhood restaurant with lots of veggie options and buffet style for both lunch and dinner. Affordable, authentic, and delicious! You have to try their home brewed chai immediately
author: Abbey D.

description: This is such a good Indian restaurant, the food is absolutely delacious and the prices are so reasonable!! The chai is addicting and is unlimited!! I highly recommend to anyone in SF area!
author: Victoria R.

description:
3.5 Vishnus

Please dont call Child protective services....but...

Is it bad that I tested the cleanliness of Star India Restaurant ( I mean if you check their health score 76/100....last time I was in school that was not a good score....ahem well maybe common core has changed that) on my offspring???

Welp nobody threw up or has mentioned any " discomfort".....so far.

Food looked and smelled delicious. Prices are not cheap...unless you go for the buffet at the restaurant. 

I am somewhat confused,bemused, and perplexed that they serve pizza here. 
Ethopian soft serve ice cream anyone???

Prices for delivery are more expensive than just picking it up...cmon you could use the exercise anyway.
author: David G.

description: Horrible naan service.  My food is getting cold as I wait for my naan.  I asked for a double order and he brings 1.  Hello!!! Unless you want me to keep getting a fresh serving of warm food, keep the naan coming or at least come and ask if we want more naan.  Four pieces of naan for 4 people every 10 minutes is ridiculous!!!
author: Mel B.

description: Food and service are good.  Mainly posting here because I thought it was weird they automatically add gratuity even for table of 3.  It was fine, but gotta say that was weird.  Check your bill...
author: James Y.

description:
Awesome food and great service. Free Mango ice cream ... yay!

Ordered Palak Paneer, lentil soup and Chilli Chicken.

All are good!
author: Sai Raghav P.

description:
Very good food and very good qulity food 
We went some place but it isn't good enough 
Also this place is super awesome
We order shawn curry and nan and gulic nan 
And chicken todori very very good
Taste very similar indian food in indian
author: Sea S.

description: My go-to pre-gig meal. Not many Indian places offer dinner buffets, but Star does and it's inexpensive and delicious. Plus, chai and soup are part of the deal'
author: Autumn R.

description: Food was great, service was awsome and very friendly environment and staff, I've been visiting this place regularly.
author: Solaris S.

description: The service was fast and friendly. The wait for the food to come out was less than 6 minutes. I've eaten many curries at many different places and I can confidently say that their food is not salty. We ordered the chicken tiki masala and the saag allu. My most favorite part was the garlic naan.
author: Brian Z.

description:
Place is cheap, around $11 for the buffet. Good amount of vegetarian/non vegetarian courses, appetizers, rice, naan, soup, and salad. Like most Indian buffets, there are sadly no samosas hiding in the buffet- but the chutney is still there to tease you... 

I thought the standout dishes from the buffet were the butter chicken and saag paneer respectively. Notice, one vegetarian and one non vegetarian course are stand outs- very convenient. Everything else was /okay/, I ended up trying everything but the lamb dish so cannot speak on its behalf. Usually not crowded, so really easy to get seated. It's nice if you want a quick, warm meal. 

I wouldn't go here if I was trying to be extremely picky, I go here for convenience/when I don't want to wait to eat. Parking can be hit or miss, try going on Arguello if you don't see anything on Geary.
author: Arezou A.

description: I was in the area .. and I was craving Indian food .. so we walked in and met this lovely women . We got the menu. And we ordered some drinks after that we asked if they made Gobi Manchuria .. and they requested to the chef if they can and they agree to make it .. and I was impressed . Great quality food .. will be back soon ..
author: Shikha A.

description: This is my favorite Indian restaurant! The food, the service and the ambiance of this place is splendid. My boyfriend and I are both SF natives and we've never ate here before in its 26 years in SF. So one night we finally decided to give it to a go & I'm so glad we did. My favorite dish is the vegetable samosas and chicken tiki masala. If you love Indian/Paki food I would highly recommended coming here! Not over priced and very delicious!
author: Indra E.

description:
Star India is one of my favorite indian restaurant ever.
The food is amazing, I've been coming here for almost 9 years.
author: Andre M.

description:
This place is pretty cheap, I believe it was $10.99 for their buffet. There's about maybe 8 different curry/entree choices(or maybe 10 can't really remember), a salad bar and soup. There is also all you can drink chai! I'm not a super big fan of chai, but if you are, this may be the place for you! 

I really enjoyed the butter chicken and their fresh made naan brought out to you on your table. I am not a super huge fan of Indian cuisine, but this place is not bad, especially for the price you're paying. You can also check-in for free mango ice cream, but it doesn't apply if you're choosing to do the buffet option, so keep that in mind! ;)
author: Bailey L.

description: Really good Indian food! Good price for eating as much as you want to, the mango icecream is also sooooo good! The workers were very kind and polite, you should come here!
author: Melda O.

description:
It was horrible. I ordered their tandoori chicken and their tandoori platter. Believe me or not, it worst the worst food I had. The meat had a terrible rotten smell, and so the veggies. I am an Indian and a cook myself and I can tell how rotten the peppers are, that were used. The prawns needed at least 20 minutes of more cooking as I could smell the raw garlic C paste that were still raw on it. The lamb tasted ( since it was so overcooked and bad) like plastic and the sheesh kebab I keep rubber. 
It was terrible. I spent $25 over this shitty foo DC and I want it back. The quality of the food was not even worth giving or serving at all. They are using really cheap , raw and unhealthy food. Some people can have a serious infection if they don't spit the rotteness of the food.
author: Madhubanti B.

description: I came here on a Saturday afternoon for the buffet,firstly I loved the ambiance of the place very warm n cozy,the food was really good, service was perfect,the naan,tandoori chicken&biryani rice Was the thing I liked the most so if ur looking just to spend ur afternoon sumwer cozy this is the place too be
author: Shannon F.

description: Good buffet with some decent quality food at a reasonable price. Very limited variety. They didn't have any of the indian desserts I usually see (carrot halwa, Ras malai) so I was a little disappointed. They also ran out of tandoori chicken because they only make a few pieces at a time. Service was attentive, though!
author: Chloe C.

description:
Very reasonably priced, the dishes are very tasty. 
I really crave the "are you can eat" buffet once every few months :-)
The stuff is kind, and the only else's nice. Colorful Indian paintings on the wall. 
I also often order the onion pizza, because I deliver.
I can recommend it.
author: Gabriele H.

description: Great food, do a good job getting the spiciness level perfect. Also have great service :)
author: Brook F.

description: Been coming here for years. But lately, it seems like their all you can eat banquet food has gotten a lot better. So, some Flying Horse beer and a couple rounds of food is always a great meal.
author: L D.

description: Good buffet and attentive service. This is a place to frequent on a weekend without a crowd. This is a gem that always has folks coming in and out. Good prices and solid food.
author: Maria B.

description: Best buffet in the area. Service was amazing and there were alot of delcious veggie options. Best Naan ive had and they were very generous
author: Nadeem R.

description: This place is amazing! Great food and wonderful service. Dominic is very helpful and hospitable and it is always a please to eat at Star India. Thanks!
author: Ali C.

description:
Best Indian Buffet  the chicken and rice was 
perfectly cooked. The nan bread was crispy and was not overdone. The sweet  dessert balls were very good as well.
author: Ashley M.

description: Our first time at Star India. Good cultural atmosphere.  Service was excellent and our food was delicious. Drop in if you are hungry and in the neighborhood.
author: Richard A.

description:
Note to self: NEVER ORDER FROM HERE AGAIN. The chicken tikka masala and malai kofta were basically water with some coloring. Absolutely no flavor and the chicken in the tikka masala was incredibly dry. Samosas were undercooked and a little doughy still, but were edible. Chili cheese naan was amazing and delicious, as always, but kind of a waste without anything else delicious to eat with it.

We've ordered from here a bunch of times and it's usually really good, but this is just ridiculous. They obviously took too many orders before close and their solution was to water everything down rather than reach out to customers to say they didn't have enough. Completely unacceptable.
author: Colleen M.

description:
If i could give this over rated restaurant and zero I would. Attitude sucks and you are the customer. Food is OK. There are better India food. ...Small portion and I will never go back. Too many other restaurants in SF to choose from.  Don't go here!!!! 

Look at their recent health violation of the restaurant.. and you want to eat here.... yuck....
author: Mimi W.

description: Cheap, but good wine. Hot food, but missing tea and samosa's. Food was great, but could also be spicer.
author: Jay M.

description: Excellent chicken Biriyani and very good service by Domany and Sukh is very friendly .Thankyousomuch
author: Royal Event R.

description: Very good authentic Indian food with real recent price also you can eat till you feel fall. The service is excellent.
author: Imad E.

description:
Often come here. Friendly personal and good food. 

Side note: if you're not used to spicy food - clarify it with waiter, they'd gladly prepare your order as you want.
author: Anastasiia P.

description: Their selection is good and price is affordable. Great location too. Very friendly attentive staff. Their food is awesome and I would recommend this restaurant as a must try if you are in San Francisco area.
author: Mary G.

description: It was pretty good until it gave me food poisoning... on New Years Eve. I haven't had food poisoning before in 7 years.
author: Warren P.

description: Great food and great people. My friend took me here and I was like, this place is amazing! Totally recommend anybody who loves Indian food!
author: Eric Z.

description: Very Great Options For HaLAL FOOD , The Vindaloo Chicken & Garlic Naan Was All The Way On Point. Shrimp Biriyani Was Very Tasty . Very Blessed Food. Halal Is The Key ! AlHAMDULiLLAH ..! 10 Stars I Will Definitely Go Back Soon ! I Recommend This Spot If You Love HALAL FOOD.  !
author: Ummah H.

description:
This is my absolute go-to neighborhood favorite. The buffet is affordable, but I do love the continence of delivery sometimes... which is what I did tonight. The lamb is always good, and I usually go with the chicken Karahi. Being able to dictate the spice level is nice too! I have always found the people working there to be attentive and accommodating without being overbearing. 

If you don't know a lot about Indian food, the buffet is a good place to start to get some ideas. But you can always order off the menu instead. 

Overall- love it!!
author: Sunny D.

description: Awful place! Bad food! Unfortunately I have to give a min of 1 Star. The place is not worth even that! Food was bland and tasteless. Pakoda was cold. Gulab jamun was stale. Please do yourself a favor and avoid this place.
author: Anuradha K.

description:
Very pleasantly surprised! I just ordered delivery from them, and I felt like a monster doing it, because it was 16 minutes before they closed! Lol!

But my order was accepted, and about 45 minutes later a very kindly man called me and I hustled outside to pick up my food.

The Daal was extremely watery, but very spicy, and I liked it, although I would have preferred more substance and ingredients. 

The chicken tikka was very good indeed; full of chicken, VERY spicy, as I requested, rich, and quite pleasing! I had it with garlic naan and chiles/pepper naan, both of which were great. 

I got a pea/potato thing too but I am far too stuffed to eat it! 

The food was piping hot. As I was prepping myself by reading a lot of Yelp reviews, I knew it could go either way, so I'm quite happy to report that I enjoyed a great meal at a reasonable price from this establishment.
author: Grizzle J.

description:
Stilll glowing from my meal a couple nights ago. Got home early extremely exhausted. I work in a warehouse where the temp climbs to 110 degrees or more. And when they need help on the floor I am there!  So after an exhausting work day of manual labor (I'm usually in front of a computer) I was absolutely refusing to cook for dinner.

Found Star India on Eat 24 for delivery. Of all the Indian restaurants that deliver to my house, this is the only one that offered a sweet two-person meal deal. We got the cheaper option, vegetarian, and it came with large portions of Chana masala, saag paneer, a HUGE bag of veggie pakora, and a cup of raita, naan, and two types of chutney.  I also asked to upgrade to garlic naan and offered to pay the difference but they did it on the house (I think lol, haven't checked my bank statement yet). I also ordered an amazing chile and cheese naan which is super spicy and savory. SO GOOD.  It was a great deal that, with tip and free delivery, came to around $27.

My boyfriend and I only managed to eat half the food and this is my third day eating leftovers.  Cant complain, Indian food is my fav.  Is it the best Indian I've ever had?  No.  But is it pretty damn good and satisfying after an exhausting day?  Absolutely!  Driver came on time, food was hot, and I went to bed full and happy.  Next time I'll definitely tip more.. it was so much better than I expected.  Keep it cool, Star India!
author: Kimiko Q.

description:
I absolutely love this place. I work very close and go here at least once a week, often more. The buffet is a great deal. Sure it's not as cheap as Taco Bell but the food is outstanding. I literally just got back from eating there and I seriously want to go back for more. 

The buffet includes yummy dal soup, pakoras and papadams to start, freshly made naan, rice, and plenty of delicious main dishes to choose from. It even includes chai tea, although I have never tried that. Oh, and salad, just in case you come to an Indian buffet for salad (weird-o).

I'm mostly a vegetarian, so I always eat the veggie options and despite the fact that I come in so frequently, I never tire of the food. They always have saag paneer and veggie (sometimes with paneer) korma. They have different veggie dishes, usually one with potatoes and one or more without. They rotate out bean dishes, too: sometimes chana masala, sometimes rajma, sometimes dal; I've even had black-eyed peas, and as a transplanted Southerner I can tell you I appreciated that. Although my mom wouldn't recognize the ones I ate here. :-) 

Also, the people here are amazing. I LOVE them. They are all, without exception, nice and warm and wonderful. They work so hard, even though almost everyone there is usually taking advantage of the delicious buffet. They refill my water faithfully and bring naan quickly (remember, it's prepared fresh for each customer so it doesn't come right away, but it's way better than having to rely on dried out naan from under a heat lamp). They greet everyone who comes in and strive to provide good service and food to each of their customers. 

I will be honest, sometimes a main dish might not be as good as it usually is. Sometimes the soup isn't as spicy as I like it. Sometimes they run out of something. But seriously. It's a buffet, you guys. These things happen. Overall the food is always satisfying and the dining experience is always positive and every single time I leave I'm glad I went to eat there.

You must try it! And please tell them you liked my review. They have been joking that I need to write one for months.

(I originally wrote this review in 2013 but just had to consolidate duplicate yelp accounts)
author: Charity V.

description: My new favorite place to eat! I walk 2 miles just to eat here, and the food is amazing! (Chicken Tiki Masala w/ Naan bread) with a glass of lemon water. The only problem you may have is getting caught up in how good the food is and forget that you were full 10 minutes ago!
author: Daniel B.

description: I have to start off with this - Star India is the Only place in the Entire Bay Area with a (all you can eat) Dinner buffet (Lunch ones are everywhere) and there price is Unbelievable ($11.99!!!!) And they include naan, And the food tastes Good (they can cook) (And the atmosphere is relaxed) I'm an atheist but I thank god metaphorically for places like this..
author: Elias W.

description: I went in for the lunch buffet this past weekend with my husband. I didn't want anything from the buffet, I ordered an aloo paratha & my husband went on into the buffet. My aloo paratha was ok, it was too soggy for me. My husband said the food in the buffet was not good, he literally had a spoonful of the items he choice and just left it there. The only thing he liked was the chutney. He said the food tasted like it had been made prior and was frozen and just reheated. Too top it off as I take a bite of my paratha, a roach was walking on the table. That was the end of it, I have a phobia with roaches and I told my husband let's go. Never again will I go back.
author: Jessica S.

description:
Ambiance: 
A little old inside, but it felt clean. Lots of tables and would likely be good for groups. 

Service: 
The staff were very friendly and happy to answer questions. They checked on us more towards the end of the meal, but would sometimes disappear so it could take some time to get an extra fork or napkin. 

Food:
We had the lunch buffet. There was a good selection and I enjoyed the food overall. Of course, some items were not the best, as is the case with buffets, but I thought the quality was good. I do wish the food items were labeled. I'd come back again.
author: Susan G.

description: People, don't go to this place! First I liked this Indian restaurant. Then I stopped going there after I saw MOUSE  on the tables and in the kitchen. MOUSE was so comfort that it didn't even get scared of people.
author: Abror E.

description:
Worst Indian food in SFO. Ambience is pathetic.
No vegetarian options in lunch buffet. The few veg items tastes bad. Please avoid this place.
author: Chetan M.

description: First time having real Indian food and am so happy I went here!! Really good prices and delicious food! Went during the lunch time and the buffet was great. Also the worker are so kind and sweet! Will make this a regular spot!
author: Abby A.

description: This is my favorite Indian restaurant in the area! The people are so welcoming and nice. My friend and I came here for the first time and enjoyed their buffet style lunch. Everything was clean and the prices are very reasonable. Love!
author: Nicolette H.

description:
Before going to Star India, I had never encountered an Indian buffet where I did not like the food. Usually, I rate Indian buffets based on 1.) whether there was free chai/naan, 2.) price, and 3.) variety. This place delivers on all three, but the food is just really...meh. I really wanted to like this place since it's the only Indian buffet close to my apartment, but goddamn, it just wasn't good!

Rating Breakdown:
1/2 Stars for Taste --
The one star is for the stellar goat curry and the desserts (aloo ghulab and kheer). The curry was laden with juicy chunks of goat and the desserts were not sickly sweet. The tandoori chicken wasn't that bad either. However, avoid the daal, it tastes like lentil water.  The chicken tikka masala tasted like...peaches? The naan (both plain and garlic) was a little dry. Once my friend remarked that they tasted like KFC biscuits, I just couldn't un-taste it. The resemblance is uncanny. But c'mon, an Indian buffet that can't get its naan and tikka masala right? Those are the main staples! UNACCEPTABLE. And the chai was not good. SACRILEGE.

1/1 Stars for Value --
If your tastebuds don't mind mediocre Indian, $10.99 buffet for lunch and dinner is a steal. There's a large selection of vegetarian and meat curries and kudos for having good desserts! 

1/1 Stars for Customer Service --
The waiters were super friendly and quick to take away our dirty plates. It kind of breaks my heart to have to give this place a mediocre review because these servers were just so awesome, but blame the chef!!

No bonus star because I will definitely be giving this place a hard pass in the future and satisfy my Indian cravings in the South Bay.
author: Abby W.

description: This is my favorite Indian restaurant. I love the varieties of food and dessert. I highly recommend.
author: Abdul Haq S.

description: I've been going to this restaurant for over a decade and it's easily the best Indian food I've ever had. My whole family comes back to this place time and time again. Excellent food. Great service. Great buffet. My highest recommendation.
author: Lee H.

description:
I tried their lunch buffer and the food was average, and the choices were few for a lunch buffet. 

They just had 1 chicken and 1 lamb dish. The vegetarian curry were not great either. Rice was not at all warm.

For the price it was ok. The service was excellent and the guy who served Naan was extremely courteous.
author: Amit S.

description: This is a Authentic Indian restaurant blended with culture, atmosphere and delicious food wow!
author: Sabana C.

description: not the best Indian food you could buy at a restaurant. The chicken tikka masala was just a lot of cram and the seasoning was not the best.
author: Serena G.

description: I've been coming here for years. It's the best Indian food I've had in San Francisco, and I've tried many places. Their prices are beyond fair, great service, great food.
author: Angelique O.

description:
Star Indian is the best restaurant ever I have a recommend coming here. I have emailed all over the city and this is by far not only the best tasting with the most affordable my girlfriend and I stumbled upon this place. We fell in love immediately. It's not packed at all and the food is divine. From the chicken tiki marsala to the non-bread and the mango ice cream this place is a sure bet! I am very picky when it comes in the food and this place is awesome. I highly highly highly recommend it. The restaurant is clean and the owners are very friendly. If you haven't been here you must go and see what the fuss is about :)
I promise you won't regret it
author: Emma F.

description: Came for the dinner buffet and stayed for about 90 minutes. Would have given 3 stars for average bland Indian food but the Tandoori chicken at the buffet was never replenished and we did not receive a basket of naan. minus 1 star. Breading on vegetable pakora was thick. Nothing but bits of bone in the lamb curry no meat. Can't expect much from a buffet tho. May consider giving their menu a shot in the near future. I wouldn't return for the buffet option.
author: amy y.

description: Definitely my favorite Indian restaurant!! They have an affordable buffet that has variety of curries to choose from! There's also tandoori chicken and pakoras! My favorite favorite favorite of them all is the chicken tikka masala! Perfect combinations of spices and yogurt and everything! If you haven't tried this place yet stop by and give it a shot! They even have ladoo and chai for dessert! Deff recommend it.
author: Spenta M.

description: Star Indian is family owned restaurant with outstanding service. The food is very good, especially the chicken masala (hope I spelled that right). Best of all, it's all you can eat for 10.99 I believe, which in my opinion is very cheap for a buffet. Without a doubt, my favorite restaurant in the Richmond district.
author: Elliot S.

description: Me and my wife came on Sunday evening for dinner ...I was amazed that they have great selection of currys in there buffet ..my favorite   one was lamb Curry and sag panner and not to miss there fresh naan on the table.also we had there taj mahal beer ....I will be coming back . Great service ..
author: Dominic F.

description: I don't get why this place is not packed 24x7 ... The buffet for lunch and dinner is delicious, fresh and a deal that can't be beat !
author: bruce f.

description: Very nice and calming place. It is nice to have a restaurant that serves KULFI Ice Cream and this Restaurant serves some of the Best KULFI Ice Cream when consistent of course. It just melts in your mouth.
author: Desmond D.

description: Tasty vegetarian dishes and delicious naan! I took out a Chana masala to go and thought it was really good.
author: Nicole H.

description:
This is 2.5 stars, which I've rounded up because you can't give half stars on Yelp.  I am not impressed.  I came here FINALLY after like 20 years of passing it while going back and forth on Geary.  While not completely inedible, the food was just seriously bland and not that tasty.  Nothing was actually bad, but nothing was good either.  We got the $10.99 buffet, and given how unexciting everything was, I didn't think it was actually a good deal.  The chicken tikka masala, which is my favorite thing always at Indian restaurants, was not flavorful at all, just bland and blah.  I actually think Trader Joe's chicken tikka masala from the frozen aisle is better (TJ's version is actually REALLY good, guys!).  The only buffet item that had some flavor was the ground lamb (or was it beef?).  All the other curries and dishes were a pass.  

I guess if you REALLY have a craving for Indian food, this will do, but I would not come back again.
author: Vivian C.

description: Had the buffet and it was great all for a very reasonable price. Would definitely recommend! Great customer service as well!
author: Alexandria D.

description: We went San Francisco last week for our holiday trip.we went star India for lunch. We tried lamb curry,samosha,tandoori chicken, and chicken tikka masala. Which were very good taste.we all love the food.staff are so nice and polite.i wii be back this restaurant for my next visit to San Francisco......yemmy
author: Prem P.

description: Ordered delivery through Grub Hub. Order was over a half hour late. Chicken tikka masala has NO FLAVOR WHATSOEVER and the chicken is DRY. I had to add some harissa I got from trader joe's to make it spicy and still had to add salt. Gross. Rice was decent, nothing special. Garlic naan was okay, I've had better from the frozen section at trader joe's. The best part were the vegetable samosas I ordered. Came with two sauces, one spicy and one sweet. The samosas, unsurprisingly, were decent but much better than anything else in this bag of crap. Definitely will NOT be ordering from here again.
author: Lauren T.

description:
We went there on the new year's eve for a dinner buffet. They had 2 appetizers (1 veg, 1 non-veg), around 5 veggie curries, 4 non-veg curries, rice and two types of desserts. Apart from these there is the usual assortment of salad dressing, chutney, soup and tea. They serve rotis to the table.

They certainly have variety in food but the taste is mediocre at best. For a $11 (+tax) dinner buffet, it surely has a lot of variety but if you come here expecting delicious food you will be extremely disappointed.

The service was a little below par. The restaurant was nearly empty and they dint clear the table on time. We asked for some extra napkins but even that was forgotten. After dinner, the manager told us that the Internet was down and he won't be able to accept debit and credit cards. Cash only.

The ambience is like any other typical small indian resturant, ie indian paintings and idols. The tables are too close together and very uncomfortable to get up and get the food. 

To summarize,
Food - 2/5 
Ambience - 3/5
Service - 3/5

With so many indian restaurants in the bay area, I probably won't be coming back here again.
author: Rajesh J.

description: If I can rate them no stars I would! I ordered for delivery today 3 Tikka Masala, 3 orders of rice, and 3 Naan. The food arrives and the bag does not include the rice. I call them and they apologize and say they will send the rice. Now to wait again. Rice arrives 15min later. We serve the food and begin to eat. As we are chewing the Chicken Tikka Masala the texture feels rubbery. We examine our chicken and we realize there are pieces of UNDERCOOKED chicken. We check other pieces and same thing. What happens when you eat UNDERCOOKED CHICKEN? Let's hope my two kids, mother in law, and I don't physically find out. I call them to inform them of this and they tried to give me the excuse that it's because of how they cook the chicken. Please, I've eaten here several times and CHICKEN SHOULD NEVER BE UNDERCOOKED. I ask for a refund this time and he says he can't give me one. He can only send me more food at no charge. No thanks. I don't want to risk getting more undercooked food. Last time I eat here and they will hear from me if any of us become ill.
author: Jewelz H.

description: I literally go this place with my family every month! We're a regular here since 2000. So this is basically one of my favorite childhood spots! $10.99 for all you can eat buffet and it includes unlimited chai tea:) The food is just amazing!
author: Nea B.

description:
This is my second dinner buffet visit to this restaurant and by far one of decent buffet for $10.49.. 

Ambience is fine, with limited space. They serve 4 veg and non veg items with starter and dessert, both time i had got dhal soup, which is bit ok.. roti is very fresh and super soft.. mutton curry was good.. rice kher is good but not the jamun.

Tea !!!! My favorite drink is served with buffet and hence 4 star .

All in all decent restaurant with reasonable food taste, might come back.

Wondering about the music, how come they got so many remix movie songs !!

Scorecard 
Ambience - 3.5/5
Hygiene- 3/5
Food - 4/5
Price - $10.49 for buffet with free Tea !!
author: Shailesha M.

description: Friendly staff, food is decent. Complementary chai tea. Check in for free mango ice cream :)
author: Lily L.

description: This place is no way Indian restaurant! The food being served is so adulterated with colours that next day when I tried washing my hands the yellow colour doesn't come off! Secondly the taste ruins your memory of good Indian food.. Food has no taste no spice.. The silverware and the plates were stained and all unhygienic.! I being and Indian can't consider this kind of food to be called Indian food!
author: Prachi S.

description:
I've ordered delivery from here a couple of times over the years. This past Friday, I was craving Indian food and decided to give Star India another shot. Since I was by myself, I knew I would only want a curry, naan, samosa and maybe a side of rice. This was one of the only places that has a $20 minimum versus a $25+ min. I ordered via Eat24 since I had a $2 off weekend promo code.

Samosa vegetable ($3.50)
The shell was nicely fried, flaky with a little chew. I enjoyed this with the mint dipping sauce.

Garlic naan: garlic leavened bread ($2.25)
For me, this could have used a little more garlic, but the naan had a nice chew.

Chicken tikka masala: chicken tandoori with herbs and tomato sauce ($10.95)
Good flavor. The sauce actually got better the next day since it tasted spicier. The chicken was good. I wish the pieces were smaller since it was a little hard to eat with the huge chunks of chicken. The first day, the chicken was good. Slightly dry, but nothing the curry couldn't mask. The next day with reheating, the chicken was so dry! Really hard to eat. No amount of sauce could cover up the dryness. 

Pilau rice: basmati rice with peas, tomatoes and spices ($3.50)
This has raisins and nuts. I wish they put that in the description since I literally when through the whole container and picked out all the raisins and nuts. The rice itself was good and had a nice flavor.

Not sure if I'll order from them again as everything was just okay. But I do like that they have a $20 min. Makes it easy when I'm dining solo!
author: Elena N.

description:
Really bad service. Went in today and were not offered a seat. Once we got our plates for the buffet, I found a huge cockroach in the rice. I had it replaced and had a new trey brought and the waiters cussed at us for being a hassle to them? 
The only reason I'm even giving them a star is for the previous times I've been here and had decent service. Absolutely ruined my Saturday and my appetite. Disgusting.
author: Paul H.

description:
As I've eaten at this restaurant for over 25 years on and off, more so after the Star India on Polk street caught fire and went out of business years ago, I am usually curious what my dining experience will be because it hasn't been too consistent over the years. Since I've only eaten the buffet food, depending on the time of day, its quality varies every time. Yesterday I invited a friend who had never eaten there before, although she's lived in San Francisco for over 35 years. As she likes spicy food, I thought it odd she'd never tried Star India.
First, it was in the middle of the afternoon and the place was not busy and I was trepidatious about its buffet being not so fresh. Fortunately for me and my friend, the buffet table was full of various and fresh selections. One dish looked like it was made from beef which baffled me. I was told it was ground lamb. As a vegetarian, I passed it up. The rest of the dishes were tasty and spicy enough for my friend as she tried them all, but I felt the heat was too mild, even with the chutney sides. Most appealing was the daal, spicy, piping hot and tasty. The green salad was refreshing and the tomatoes were actually ripe and red without being mealy. The papadan was dry and tasteless but the freshly cooked naan brought to our table was a nice touch. Samosas would've been nice, sure, but the khir and fried doughy balls - sorry, I'm not sure how they are called - in sugary water made up for the lack of samosas. My friend especially liked both desserts and the chai, even though the chai seemed a bit anemic to me. The selection of Indian beer and mango lassi were available, but we opted for free chai instead. The bill came to under $25 with tip. Because it started to get busy about 4:30, we were pleasantly sated and left before the early dinner crowd descended.
The staff wasn't obtrusive or gratuitously eager with the water refills, and to me that made the dining experience much more pleasurable. I give it 4 out of 5 stars because it's not wheel chair accessible and my friend has mobility issues. To walk up and down three stairs to the buffet table and or bathroom was an impediment for her. The decor was as authentic as I would imagine, and the shrine to the God ganesh was a nice touch. I would recommend this place for a first time introduction to Indian buffet food. As it's not a large restaurant, and I've been there when it's been crowded, busy and not stellar during peak times, I suggest going after the regular lunch or dinner times.

Ps.
Sadly, I read on yelp just now that the health department gave it a poor, clean health inspection, under 5%. Eat at your own risk.
author: Gemma S.

description: Great food and hospitality. Good true indian gem! Will definitely come back.good veg choices. Didnt try the non veg, but looks delicious. Hearty soup and warm chai to finish ur lunch. Good price as well.
author: Shriya N.

description: My family and I love this place it's  great place if you like to stuff yourself with some delicious Indian food. The food it's great I love it. The owners of this place are so wonderful and know how to treat their customers.
author: Shadi A.

description: I've always wanted to come here and I finally had the chance! It's honestly so worth it and the customer service is great. Can't wait to come back!
author: Crystal W.

description:
1. They don't have many choice of food. I have been other Indian Buffet, they have many choices than this one. 2. The food is so so. All the food and sauces are spicy. I know some Indian sauces are not spicy at all. But this restaurant isn't the one. 3. They don't refill the food on the buffet dishes until we asked them, "there is not more rice, can you refill it?" 

I don't want to go again. You can read other people's reviews from 1-3 stars. They are telling the truth.
author: Daisy C.

description: Delicious Indian food, great customer service, always come to this restaurant when visiting the city.
author: Manpreet S.

description: Worst experience ever.  Do not get delivery from Star India.  Order was an hour late and they kept asking me to wait.  I didn't even order at peak hours. They blamed it on the delivery guy.  Too bad. Food might have been tasty but I will never know.
author: Debbie C.

description: We all had the buffet and all four of us totally enjoyed the food. They brought naan bread, plain and garlic, that was hot and fresh. The buffet had a lot of options. The chai tea was excellent. Save room for the honey balls. We found plenty of meter parking. The restaurant was a tad worn (for instance, duct tape securing the carpet going up a step) but was generally neat and clean. The restroom was clean. Service was great. They cleared away our plates right away as we got new buffet dishes.
author: Cathy O.

description: This is a great all you can eat authentic Indian cuisine at a good price. People are nice and friendly
author: A S.

description: Yesterday I had lamb curry. It was delicious. Friendly staff & atmosphere was amazing.
author: Babu S.

description: If you want to eat worst chicken tikka masala this is the right place. it's not worth trying here.I love there lamb on bone . There Buffet items are same everyday.
author: Nithin M.

description: This is my favorite Indian buffet in the city. Best part is that they are open late. The food is made very often and always taste fresh. I love the chicken tali a salad.
author: Anthony M.

description:
The gangsta rap was bumpin' up in Star India right as the other half and I walked through the door for dinner.  That made me laugh as I wouldn't have expected such the colorful soundtrack inside an Indian restaurant.  Throughout the evening, there was an interesting mix of music.  That stuck in my mind the most about our dining experience. 

Star India seems to be a popular take-out/delivery type of eatery.  There weren't that many patrons that evening.  However, we constantly the delivery guy carry huge bags of take out packages out of the kitchen.  It took about 20 minutes for us to get our food bc there were so many takeout orders. 

Although there was an AYCE dinner buffet for $10.99 pp, we opted for ordering a la carte.  I passed by the buffet bar on the way to the restroom and didn't think the buffet looked that impressive.  However, I thought that the dishes we ordered were just OK.  
-Plain naan: Slightly greasy and smaller in portion size than naan from other places.
-Fish Tandoori: Huge cubes of salmon came out on a sizzling platter with green bell peppers and onions.  It was great with a squeeze of lemon.  Only downside was that the salmon was overcooked and a bit dry. 
-Chicken Vindaloo (chicken breast meat):  A huge portion of chicken and potatoes ordered to our preference of mild spiciness.  Only problem was that the chicken was dry.  Without the curry, it would have been much less edible. 
-Saffron Rice: Great mix of saffron rice with cashews and raisins.  
  
Overall, portions and value are great.  Our total tab was $35.  Cooking execution needs some work.  Service is tentative.  Ambiance is casual and laid back.  I might or might not go again to give them another chance.  Rating would be 2.5 stars but I'm rounding up.
author: Liv A.

description:
Been here multiple times for buffet. And the buffet bar is always filled with fresh warm food rather than just curry sauce.  All dishes are tasty except the chicken tandoori which is a little on the dry side. But hey, that's chicken especially chicken breast. 
Servers are always very friendly.
author: Tommy K.

description:
Me and.  My friend Narad went dinner.  Food.    Was.  Superb.    And.  Service is.  Amazing.       Had.   A perfect.   Meal.  At the same time a group of 50
 People r there.  Eventhough.  We got a table we had aptizers veg pakora chicken pakora. Papadams.   And.   Mix salad.  With.  Different.  Dressings.  And cmg main meal.  Like.  Plenty of dishes. Including.  Chicken tandoori.   Dessert gulabjamun.  And Kher
author: Attipatla A.

description: I placed a future delivery to arrive at my work, bc I wanted to plan ahead of time. They tried delivering the same day,even though I requested a FUTURE delivery. They couldn't give it to me bc I was not working that day. I called Yelp to let them know the situation. They told me that they would take care of it and will call the following morning to confirm the delivery to me. First off, they were 40 mins late from the schedule time, and they delivered the same food they tried to deliver the day before . Sooooo gross, chicken was in a cardboard container that was super soft , dry ass chicken. Mushy eggplant and chewy ass Naan. If you care about what you eat and the quality of your food. Don't order here. They denied the fact that they gave me old ass food. I never write bad reviews and try to give businesses the benefit of the doubt. But if they think they're going to get away with giving me day old food, they need to rethink about having a restaurant business. So gross , so unprofessional.
author: melinda m.

description: Most non tasty tikka masala and naan bread I've ever had. Never ordering food from here!
author: Ankhbayar B.

description: The service was good, buffet had a lot of options. Liked the veg kadhi pakoda and saag paneer
author: Prajakta S.

description: Amazing indian buffet! We started with the Chicken Tandoori which had a great combination of spices and yogurt sauce. Also very good was the Biryani!
author: Noah F.

description: Best buffet for $10.  This is not amazing Indian food. Not going to exaggerate the quality of their food but the quality for the amount of money just can't be beat. We live in the neighborhood and comes here at least once a week.  We have ordered few things off the menu but we mainly come here for the buffet.  There is a large selection for vegetarians and meat eaters. The staffs are really friendly and they have very interesting modern Indian music here.  The buffet comes with free naan and chi tea.  Two people walks out of here stuffed for under $25.  How can you possibly complain.
author: Daniel D.

description: Star India left junk flyers at my for despite my clear request not to do so. I used to enjoy their buffet, but I stopped dining there after my last visit resulted in severe food poisoning. I'd probably not have written anything had they not so kindly reminded me.
author: Bryan H.

description:
I curse myself for having such ridiculous and random cravings for Indian food. I ended up trying this place via delivery.

Delivery was over an hour.
The naan was burnt. All I had was a burnt after taste.
The curry was watery and lacked flavor. It wasn't even spicy.

Overall very bland and disappointing.
author: Suzie B.

description: The food is really good for the price and the service is great and it's a buffet...what more could you ask for?
author: valerie v.

description: Great easy quick affordable delicious Indian food in SF. Consistent and they are very accommodating. And we're very grateful that they deliver south of the Park (yay!). We've been fans of them for years. Also, we like to order direct from them rather than through an app.
author: John G.

description: My picky toddler son loves the Tikka masala and the workers here are really nice. We like coming here when we have the craving for Indian food and it's an easy place to go with our 3 year old. Good food, easy with kids and workers are nice. What's not to like.
author: Jae L.

description: My family has been coming to Star India for many years. They always have excellent customer service and the food here is phenomenal! You wouldn't go wrong if you wanted a good Indian restaurant here in San Francisco. It is a single, couple and family friendly restaurant. It's pricing is very reasonable as well. It is rare to find an Indian restaurant that has an open lunch and dinner buffet weekly. You will not be disappointed by coming here whether it is the service or the food, all around it's amazing.
author: Ahmed S.

description:
I got 2 words for this place: TANTRIC FIRE

My bae and I stumbled in around 3:30 pm on a random Monday because we were in the mood for some Indian buffet destruction. We left in a state of naan nirvana. 

First of all, is it a coincidence that Star India is located 1 block away from the Indian Consulate? I THINK NOT!

Second, have you seen their wall decor featuring murals of underboobed Indian babes. Very seksi!!

Buffet lineup: 

Chicken Pakora- basically like Indian chicken nuggets, FIRE
Veggie Pakora- WOW fried veggies, YUM!
Chicken Tikka Masala- FIRE x 100000; I had a lot of this
Goat Curry- not for me but tried a chunk and it was pretty dope
Palak Paneer- spinachy cheesy goodness
Ground lamb curry with peas- DANK
Honey donut balls in syrup- needed cinnamon but still AMAZING, 
Rice pudding- CREAMY and great end to my meal

There were also a ton of sauces, lentil soup, a bunch of other curries, tandoori chicken, fresh naan and FREE CHAI!

For just $10.99, Star India is a star in my eye. 10/10 would return again!!!!
author: Sherry C.

description:
3.5 stars.  

I get delivery from Star India through the Eat 24 app.  I normally get the Channa masala, rice, garlic naan and chicken tikka masala.   I keep forgetting to change my order settings as I tried them both spicy and medium and omg they are so hot!!! I can handle spicy but this is the real deal legit.  I need to remember to change it back to good ol mild so we can eat the food without breathing fire.   

In terms of the food itself I really enjoy all the dishes and no real complaints.  Sometimes the chicken tikka masala chicken pieces are rather large and sometimes they aren't.  I've gotten some other dishes from there before and the meat was pretty dry but I can't recall which meats.   

Delivery is fine as it does take a while. I usually know this so I always allow for a hour for them to get my order and get it to my house.
author: Julie F.

description: I usually only ever get take out from Star India -- chicken tikka masala, tandoori appetizer, nan bread and raita are some of my favorites -- and am consistently happy with the quality and value.
author: B T.

description: Service was good but not food, taste wise It wasn't authentic Indian food. Poolau / rice dish was definitely not cooked well, I couldn't eat more than few spoons, it wasn't so fresh. Paneer curry was still eatable.
author: Maulik S.

description: Great food ridiculously cheap honestly you get more than you paid for thanks star india!
author: Donald A.

description:
I really like the food there and the prices is very competitive.
I go there mainly for the open buffet. The food is good and the servents are very friendly
author: Lola H.

description: We've been coming to Star India for the past 10 years, and the service has always been very very friendly. The buffet is fresh and varied. The chai tea is great.  And the restaurant is always clean and nicely maintained, with tasteful paintings and colorful dwcorations. We love coming with our neighbors and friends. Sometimes we order of the menu, and the lamb samosas and korma are wonderful! We love the Kingfisher beer, too!
author: Amy D.

description: Absolutely delicious Indian cuisine. Waiters are pleasant and helpful in selecting food.
author: David B.

description: Shitty food! Asked for spicy food, what I got on the plate was neither spicy nor tasty. I would never go to that place again. The spices they use have artificial colors in them. Tasteless!
author: Richa N.

description: The curried chicken and garlic naan were excellent. The customer service was very good as well.
author: irene l.

description: So good. Super cheap, great meal options, good food, came on time. Will definitely be one of my regular places.
author: Kierra S.

description: I usually like this restaurant. Close and convenient. This time the food was very cold. Potatoes were raw and everything I requested spicy was not.
author: Mickey R.

description: This is my favorite place to get Indian buffet. The buffet is served all day, is always fresh, and includes free naan and chai. For $10.99, you get a very nice range of curries, curried vegetables, vegetarian options, and traditional dishes like chicken masala, vindaloo lamb, tandoori chicken, and basamati rice. In short, it's a great deal and the staff are always friendly and attentive.
author: Edith G.

description:
Came in to get some good Indian food, buffet price seemed reasonable but regretted it after the first plate.

This has been one of the worst Indian rest I have eaten at in all of SF Bay area and Indian is one of my favorite.

There was no one to greet or seat you but that is just the beginning, had to ask for Naan, food that was missing from buffet (tandoori chicken) and when i finally sat to eat, it was a big disappointment. I tried several classic like butter chicken, lamb, veg curry etc. Even the salad was under par. 

Never mind that buffet only has about 6 dishes - pretty small compared to others.

If you want to want to eat decent Indian food, this place doesn't have it :(
author: S J.

description: The worst experience ever , I have been there for my dinner and the food taste was okay but they have rats moving on their floor. I don't know how they are running their restaurant with rats in the restaurant. Please be aware of this before you visit this place.
author: Avinash M.

description:
I have eaten at dozens of Indian buffets and I've been coming to this one for more than a decade.  I still come here.  I normally eat the buffet and I have never gotten sick. I like the fact they have a working soap and an automatic paper towel dispenser in the bathroom - way cleaner than many restaurants.   Dated?  I don't think so.   It's what I would expect.

 Sometimes the flavors vary, but it also tells you that it is fresh cooked for each batch.  This is the variation that some people see.  The service is always great with the nicest waiters and the owners are very personable.   For the price in San Francisco, it can't be beat.
author: Dennis S.

description: This is my go to Indian delivery place. The only issue is that there are differing levels of spiciness depending on who is making it that day.
author: Bill L.

description: $10 is an exceptional value at an exceptionally reasonable price for an all-you-can-eat Indian buffet at dinner. The curries at the buffet were much better than the average buffet I've been to in the bay area.  The tandoori chicken from the buffet was excellent. As others have reported, the staff were very friendly and helpful.  I enjoyed my dinner. It was exactly what I was looking for at a very reasonable price. I saw lots of people coming for takeout. It seems like this is a popular restaurant in the neighborhood.
author: Johnjohn E.

description: I've been looking for a good Indian buffet in the City since Curry Village closed down awhile back. I was really excited after finding out about this place! At $10.99 for lunch/dinner, you really can't go wrong here. Sure, not all the dishes are fabulous. But how can you complain when the price includes unlimited naan and chai? I came with a few friends for dinner. The goat (that's right...goat!) was falling-off-the-bone tender! Mmmmmmmm....
author: Darren L.

description:
Really good selection for a $10.99 buffet. This is my second time here. My bf is in love with the lamb entrees. We came back especially for them. The chicken masala was really good too. As soon as you come in the waiter greets you and has fresh Naan on your table as soon as you return from your first helping at the buffet station.

The waiter doesn't talk much, but definitely attends to your needs. He seems really nice tho.

I would definitely come back here.
author: Nic V.

description:
Service : Above average
Food quality : almost non edible (personal opinion)
Taste : Similar to the food served in hospitals (")
Ambience : Good
Cost (dinner buffet) : $11

As an Indian, this place has upset my palate for Indian food for at least a month. The spice level and sugar level for the food served here was negative. 
Appetizers (veg) - savior (we ended up eating appetizers again after the desert)
Gulab jamun - felt like solid cold Manchurian balls covered with sugar (granular)
Non veg/Veg both of these did not come any close to pleasing my taste buds. 

If you're scared of spice, please enjoy the food and good ambience here. 
If you need some spice in your life, give this place a pass. You'll thank me later :)
author: Nishant M.

description:
Worst food quality. This review is based on three times deliveries I got of different items. The sabji was not cooked well and contained a lot of water. Second time, Dum Aloo Vindaloo contained tons of food color with not so good taste. Third time, pilao biryani, again it felt like the food does not feel freshly cooked.

Never going to order again from here.
author: Jainik V.

description: Delivery service took over 2 hours (we called after 1 hr and then again at 90 minutes and were told the driver is 5 minutes away each time!) and when it finally arrived the order was completely mixed up and all wrong and cold. Sorry, STAR INDIA, we will not be calling again.  there are better, cleaner and more efficient indian restaurants out there.
author: Carrie M.

description: Indian food and pizza, delivered to your front door!! I had one of the pizza, which was ok, and some meat samosas which were good. Don't think I would order the pizza again, necessarily, but definitely can't wait to try more of the regular Indian Food.
author: Tiffany R.

description:
I am all about second chances, thirds and fourths too. But Star India fails every time. 
The food is SO OVERSALTED it is inedible. I literally took 2 bites and quickly decided to toss the almost $40 dinner.  I hate giving such low reviews. I am sad for both them and I. I hope they improve. Will say the mango lassi was good.
author: Chelsey G.

description: I ordered the paneer to go. Basically they dumped raw paneer into a premade curry sauce and didn't bother to even cook the paneer beforehand.
author: M. M.

description:
This place is AMAZING for having $10 lunch and dinner buffet! AMAZINGLY TERRIBLE. There were only a few selection of entrees and they were not even tasty entrees. The saag paneer I got definitely tasted and smelled like something have gone spoiled in it. 

We also ordered an extra biryani. It looked and tasted like someone took some rice and mixed it with some tomato sauce.
author: LeTran B.

description: This Indian restaurant is one of the best in San Francisco when is comes an Indian buffet. I love the food here and the bread. I would recommend this place to anyone that is looking for a good Indian restaurant in San Francisco.
author: Isaac H.

description: I'm disappointed that this restaurant did not stand up for me. I used to order from y'all once a week- same order. One week I received an order that was not mine. I complained via eat 24 and star India refused a refund even though I had been weekly customer and this was my first, only, and honest complaint. I ordered tonight out of need but I will not again based on how I was treated.
author: Samantha M.

description:
The worst Chicken Tikka. I just went and got it it was suppose to be hot as I got home in 5 mins and had it but the chicken was hot from outside and ice cold from inside I decided to throw it away. It just felt like they put it in the microwave and gave it to me. Also I have never seen so chicken you don't have to serve quantity just make sure that you give less chicken but something that chewable and eatable. I would def recommend to go somewhere else or not eat at all rather than eating at this crappy place.

So I get a call from them the next day saying that our chicken is considered to be the best and how my bad experience is totally unjustified and she later on said that If i remove my interview they may give me a free meal and I said no. So than she plays the card of me being Indian and blah blah blah. Well all i can say make some fresh food.

PLEASE DONT EAT FOOD FROM HERE. IT'S PROBABLY THE WORST INDIAN FOOD IN SAN FRANCISCO.
author: Nik P.

description: I ordered a vegetarian meal and they gave me a meal with chicken.  I understand you guys was closing soon but I feel that you could have gave me the right order. I'm very sad and was looking forward to coming back.
author: Delf P.

description: I have visited several Indian food restaurants in San Francisco and this is definitely my favorite one. They are very friendly and the food is so good. Also isn't that expensive, specially if you are going to eat from the buffet they have great variety, even vegan dishes and the tea is delicious.
author: Quetzal H.

description:
Update: I received a phone call from the manager and she was extremely polite and explained to me that the driver was new and had gotten lost. She immediately offered to send out a new order. I was absolutely blown away by this. Thank you so much for making it right Star India. It is a rarity to find a business with this kind of integrity and respect towards its customer. That is excellent customer service!

Update: My food arrived approximately one hour late.

This is a review based off of service and not the food.
I ordered off GrubHub and it never showed up. No one answered the phone when I called.
author: Kara P.

description:
Amazing food! If you want authentic Indian food with great flavors this is the spot. The staff is also
Very friendly which I have found to be rare at other restaurants in the city.
author: Avista K.

description:
One of the few places to actually deliver to my place of business (I'm a big Chutney but they won't deliver). I have ordered multiple times from Star India.
