Usually get the Chicken tikka masala, garlic nam and white rice. Their delivery min recently increased so I'm forced to order another item just to enjoy what i really want to have. 
7 out of 10 times, my food arrived warm. Like any person, I want to enjoy my food hot. I shouldn't have to microwave my food almost every time. This past delivery, I also included chicken tendouri to my order. Chicken tasted dry and far from tender. Asked for no onions yet the plate was filled entirely of it. Even after adding special sauce, the chicken felt like it was 2 days old. It is what it is. Some days are better than others.
author: George A.

description:
Hmmm where do i start from ! Me and my buddy was in the area and was craving indian food so we thought we yeleped them and we should give them a shot !! The buffet was great we had goat curry in the buffet we emptyed the whole container.... It was really good !! Desi style 

When in city will return back to this place ......
Keep the goat in the buffet !!!

Keep up the great work guys!!!
author: Siddharth R.

description:
I just want to reiterate how much I love Star India. I order so often here that my friends think I'm crazy. My roommates even tricked me into trying a new Indian spot, and my boyfriend made me venture to another Indian restaurant when his mom came into town because he wanted to try something new. 

When we ordered elsewhere the portions were smaller and pricier. And they definitely didn't have my beloved Star India taste!

I just... can't leave Star India. Maybe I'm a creature of habit. Maybe I like my comfort zone. But honestly, I think I just like knowing that when I order something I'll be consistently happy with it. Even my friend who graduated from USF years ago says she misses this place and is sad they won't deliver to her neighborhood. I mean, hey, I started yelping because I wanted to share how great this restaurant is! 

I still can't speak to their buffet - but I order their take-out consistently. Since my last review, I've stopped being vegetarian and have tried new dishes. Their Sag Paneer is my roommate's new favorite guilty pleasure, and my new go-to entree is the Prawn Korma. The Chicken Korma is awesome, too, and the initial reason I got turned on to the Prawn Korma.

It's seriously the best comfort food in the Inner Richmond. 

The staff are continually sweet, too! The other day I ordered online, and online the wait was listed as 40-60 minutes. I was hungry and grumbled a bit but knew it was worth it. Ten minutes later there was a knock on my door and the manager was standing there with my food because she recognized my name and order! I was so shocked I forgot to tip her (sorry!!). Please go and please make friends with the staff because they are great people and take care of their customers!

Anyways, conclusion: GREAT SERVICE. Consistent food. Comforting. Addicting. Reasonably priced. After a year I'm still in love with Star India.
author: Laura C.

description:
wandered in here hungry as hell all by my lonesome, thought about taking out, but then settled for the buffet.

1) the servers are super nice. almost too nice. my glass of water never dipped past half full and i didn't even have to ask for them to bring a tray of warm, fluffy, scrumptious naan.
2) chai on tap. yum.
3) sure, the food isn't the greatest Indian food in the entire universe, but it's really solid for a $10.99 buffet. 

definitely will be returning.
author: Ronny K.

description:
There is a special place in my heart for Star India. My housemates and I, new to the Inner Richmond, decided to toast our successful move with some good old fashion gluttony. We decided to indulge in this classic all-you-can eat Indian buffet. 

The staff was friendly and the food was tasty. 

I ate more than my share of the usual fare, accompanied by delicious chai and finished off with some tasty dessert options (and more gulab jamun than I care to admit). 

My housemates and I now return for "special" occasions. It doesn't hurt that it is well within walking distance (which is saying something given our post feast food babies).
author: Marcus T.

description:
AMAZING Food! This place steals the crown for Indian- without doubt! The dinner buffet is simply amazing! I love the kheer and gulab jamun! I would any day exchange any meal for a bowl of kheer! 

The staff is so friendly and accomodating, that I keep wanting to go back!
author: Shraddha L.

description: I love eating food. I like buffets and this place hits the spot. I'll come here once in a while to enjoy some spicy curry. I'll order from grabhub and get it nice and ready to eat. Great
author: Paulo R.

description: I just had the weirdest/frustration experience. First thing the delivery driver says is "are you going to tip me?" as soon as we get outside to get our food. Seriously! Not even a hello, here is your order, hows your evening. Nothing. Then when we get upstairs and open our food we discover that we have the wrong items. Yes Mr Delivery Man that certainly deserves a tip! This has happened before with us, that we receive the wrong order. As others have reviewed, the food here is just not good. This will be the last time that we order.
author: Galina H.

description: We been back several times and was a preferred place when visiting SF however they must have a new cook because the lamb curry was so bad we just didn't eat it. The rice had a terrible smell like it was stale. We didn't enjoy the food as we had in the past visits. Sorry we won't be coming back.
author: R B.

description: was enjoying a pleasant lunch meal on a weekend, when a tour bus pulled up.  And about 70 people swarmed in.  They were like hawking vultures, strangers asking me to share my table, and I was NoT in the mood!!  Tons of people blocking the tiny aisles.  I had only one plate, and was afraid to get up for 2nd serving because I would lose my table to these beasts.  The employees could not control this crowd, and I couldn't get anyone's attention to help  me out.  As a long time customer - I never went back.  And the food is mediocre anyway.
author: Janet J.

description:
Disgusting! Nasty! Gross and simply non edible food!!! My friend and i were hungry so we popped into this place last nite for a quick bite. I decided to use the restroom first and was about to leave when I came out BUT my friend had already started with the buffet. So I had NO choice but to stay here!!! 

We should have left! This place is unsanitary!!! The toilet and kitchen were beyond filthy!!! I picked at the garbage they labelled as food and got sick the entire night last night.

The Health Authorities should visit this place and shut it down! It is disgusting!!! Not fit for human consumption. It is just good for the vermin running around in the bathroom and kitchen!!!
author: Mo D.

description:
To be honest save your money and time 
It is the worse Indian food I ever had 
Chicken not fresh , meat hard and smell 
Not clean place to being friend and family
author: Fares M.

description: Me and my friends were hungry after all day fishing and decided to go to this restaurant. Bad Idea. We tried butter chicken, palak paneer, vegetables korma,, but whatever we ate was bad in taste, we could not even eat it all. We regret our decision of coming to this restaurant, now we know why it's rating is this low. Star  India more like Ridiculous India.
author: Kundan P.

description:
If you offer a $10 dinner buffet, you're probably going to earn yourself five stars ("probably" being the operative word here). Thing is - Star India may not have the best Indian food in the city (they're not terribly far from it though, really), but they've got the most cost-effective system around.

We're talking all things vegetarian, big chunks of chicken tikka masala, suspicious fish pakora, an urn full of chai tea, and some totally acceptable rice pudding all for the low, low price of $10.

No more needs to be said on this matter. Mostly because I will have my mouth full of naan by the time Star India comes up in conversation again.
author: Jiordan C.

description:
You can't really go wrong for $10.99 all day buffet with a decent amount of dishes.

Free chai tea - yum
Chicken tikka masala - great sauce, but chicken was dry and bare
Goat curry - amazing and tender with a nice brown curry masala, MY FAV dish
Tandoori chicken - solid and smokey
Curry potatoes - really good
Free hot fresh naan

And you can order them for takeout/deilvery on EAT24! 

You cannot beat the price (esp for dinner). Highly recommend for above average indian food that will cost ya $13-14 after tip and tax.
author: Chuck N.

description: Good customer service , delicious food, I love mutton biriyani. The best Indian restaurant in SFO
author: Babu D.

description:
This is the WORST management ever!!!!!!!  The managers name  is Lett.  She is  extremely rude!!!!!    I have ordered food form this place for years.  When she picks up the phone,  I cringe.  She could care less about the company.  She told me "YELP REVIEWS MEAN NOTHING".  She went on to say,  we have  been here for 15 years,  I am the manager, and  there is nothing you can do to change that.  I asked for the owners name and when he worked.  She said his name was Bob, he never works, and that I could not get in touch with him.  I feel bad for him,  because I own a company with GREAT employees that watch my back.  i think he should definitely FIRE her!
I have to go now, because INDIA CLAY OVEN is delivering my food!
THEY ARE GREAT!!!!!
author: R S.

description: Finally getting around to writing this review! My mom and I have been coming here for years. It's our go to spot when we are in San Francisco. The staff is always friendly and accommodating. we ordered a yellow dahl, raita, jasmine rice, chicken tandoori, vegetable samosas, saag aloo, naan bread, papadum and a mango lassi. My absolute favorites were the veggie samosa and mango lassi. They hit the spot! I also really enjoyed the chicken tandoori, saag aloo and papadum. The raita was a little bit runny but still good. My mom felt the Dahl was too watery and spicy and she wasn't able to eat it.  Sue was patient, sweet and helpful! She had it remade so we could take it to go. The prices are really affordable and they also have a dinner buffet if you are looking for an all you can eat for a set price. The only downside was we had a tough time finding parking which is common in the city. We almost gave up but finally found a stall. The staff even offered to help us find parking. Can't beat that kind of service. Thank you for a great time and a tasty meal!
author: B B.

description: the food is just ok. the chapati & naan are fine and the other dishes ar passable. the service, however, is excellent. Attentive, friendly, and helpful.
author: Ellen F.

description: there were a ton of options for both meat eaters and vegetarians at the dinner buffet.  the fresh hot naan brought table side was delicious.  they have a ton of sauces, including mango chutney, available at the buffet and even multiple desserts.  you also can't beat the price.  i'll definitely be back.
author: Stephanie M.

description:
You would feel that it's a bit gaudy to utilize "Star" to depict your eatery, however Star Indian Restaurant has each privilege to. 

I've been frequenting this spot for a couple of years, and it's never baffled. It has a tremendous menu with each Indian dish you could ever wish for, awesome administration, buffet alternatives, and Indian sustenance so yummy that you'll be calling it your most loved as well. 

My most loved is the exemplary chicken tikka masala and chicken kebab. Both are marvelous, and accompany gigantic servings of rice. Garlic naan is likewise an unquestionable requirement for me, and they make their naan simply right. 

The staff is constantly well disposed, and I've never had a negative involvement with the administration here. On the off chance that you arrange for get, it'll likely take around 15-20 minutes for them to make your request. So quick! 

I have yet to find an Indian eatery to surpass Star Indian Restaurant. Until then... you genuinely are my top choice.
author: Prashanth K.

description: Wouldn't order again after seeing that they're at high risk for vermin infestation with their health inspection but Got delivery and everything we ordered was pretty good. The naan was burnt though.
author: Emma M.

description:
Very pleasantly surprised at how good the food was and selection found at this place for lunch buffet. For $9.99 that's also a no-brainer. My favorite was the ground lamb dish. Tikka masala was yummy. I'm still learning the names of the dishes but I would say most of the items (about 10 maybe?) were good to very good. Their tandoori chicken is not the best but not bad. Oh and service with a smile!
It's on Geary in Inner Richmond so easy trip on the 38 for me from downtown. We'll def be back!
author: Vol T.

description: Saw the most massive rat I have ever seen in my life climbing the walls near the kitchen, the staff was shocked at me for telling them I wouldn't be eating there and that I would like to cancel my order. In fact they didn't even make it easy for me to cancel my order and looked at me like I was the crazy one. Seriously, I thought it was a small rabbit on the walls but saw the foot long tail and realized it was the largest rat I've seen EVER!
author: Avyay G.

description: My fiancé and I live around the corner from this gem! He was born in India and has lived in the city for 14 years and says it's the best Indian food he has had in the city. The staff is so warm and courteous. This place is amazing! We usually get the chicken tika masala, palak paneer, and garlic cheese naan. I literally crave it multiple times per week. They are also halal which was wonderful for when my fiancée's parents were in town. You must try!
author: Molly S.

description: Really liked the curry chicken.  Was there in between meals and didn't want to brave the buffet but it looked good.
author: Kelly M.

description:
Really good food for the value they charge. The dinner buffet is wonderful. The staff is very friendly. Su, you are amazing! 
Wouldn't miss a chance to go back there for the buffet.
author: Priya V.

description:
I've been to almost a dozen different Indian Buffets, and unfortunately Star India is one of the least tasty ones.  The food tends to be spicy hot, but not sweet enough.  I think out of the 5 vegetarian choices, I only kind of liked 2 of them.  

We came to lunch buffet on a Sunday: we arrived at 11:45 and until 12:45 it was only us in the restaurant. By the time we left at 1:15 only 2 other tables had customers.   

My wife used to frequent this place years ago and liked it.  She was with me today and was disappointed by the food too.  Maybe they have a different chef now. 

On the plus side, the wait staff were nice.  

And they served gluten-free Papadum as part of the buffet.

If we come back it'll be after they change recipes or chefs...

Buffet same price lunch or dinner: $10.99
author: George K.

description:
My family and I frequent this place so much, they know us now and seat us at the same table. Who can argue with a buffet dinner of freshly made tikka masala and warm, buttery naan? 

As someone who is familiar with the indian dinner buffett, I put Star India at the top of my list for the quality of food. I've been to other indian buffets were there are 2-3 times more selections, but quality will always win out over quantity. When they ran out of tandoori chicken, it took a while for them to refill it because it wasn't finished cooking yet. Their lamb dishes are excellent, as is their saag paneer. Their two buffeet desserts, the gulab jamun and kheer are excellent, but if you're a fan of ice cream, order their homemade indian ice cream. nothing compares.
author: Patricia C.

description: Poor food quality. Buffet is not worth it. Rice is stale, and the curries have been sitting for too long. Bought a groupon ticket for this place, and later to know that the groupon does not cover the buffet, even when it states the groupon as value like dollars. Very disappointed
author: Alan C.

description: I just ordered for delivery and was disappointed when I opened my much awaited chicken tikka masala..it was super watery and the sauce didn't taste like much:( not to mention, the chicken was so orange I thought it was sweet potatoes until I touched it... I think it was rushed. I'm a huge chicken tikka masala fan and this is definitely not what it's suppose to taste or look like         :( ...but I'll give them the benefit of the doubt and probably try this dish at the resturaunt if I ever get around to it. But so disappointed!!
author: Darin V.

description:
Their butter chicken tastes fake. The color is also wrong... Bright - real bright orange sauce. I got really sick the next day.

Also, I ordered delivery and the guy asked me to come downstairs (after I have already tipped 20% in grub hub) I said, I'd prefer if you'd come upstairs, and he said, nah bro' it's better if you come downstairs I'd appreciate it. There was plenty of parking when I went down. 

Definitively never ordering from here again. Mehfil Indian Cuisine is a better option if you want Indian delivery.
author: Esteban A.

description: Samosas were tasty, biryani was okay and the meat in the lamb curry was a bit tough. Kabulli naan was okay. Service was very good. Know that if you want to use a Groupon here it is not good for the buffet items or a few of their special items like Thali. Atmosphere was quiet and pleasant.
author: Debra M.

description:
Really good food, good prices, great and fast service. SO full having just eaten a little part of one entree, a samosa, and plain rice. 

The Lamb Korma was rich and full of soft lamb chunks. You could seriously taste the cashew. Creamy, spicy goodness. 

The Veggie Samosas were perfectly fried and filled with a more interesting potato filling, kinda spicy in a spice way (not just hot) and had some texture. Crunchy and soft. 

I ordered through GrubHub and my order arrived about 20 minutes early. So awesome because I ordered at like noon15. The delivery dood was also friendly and confident. 

I'm excited to go to work tomorrow because I have leftovers for lunch!!! hahaha!! :D
author: Alex W.

description:
I've been coming for 13 years. Ownership has changed however the food seemed to stay he same. I liked that the owners at lunch up top by the food trays. I loved the  traditional. Music, 

The food has changed and become watery, the spices  do not seem well balanced, the rice was stale. The Naan was good however.

I do not know that I will eat here again. I am a little bummed.
author: Peter c.

description:
Very disappointing food.

The food at the buffet was both overpriced and of poor quality. $10.99 is far too much to pay for this.

The Saag Paneer was among the worst I've ever had. And the Chana Massala was not made with chickpeas, but actually just heavily spiced baked beans. There is also no Naan bread, at all.
 
It is a very bad buffet, both in terms of selection and the quality of the food. For $10.99 I expect far, far better than this. I certainly don't think I'll be back.

The service staff is friendly enough. But that doesn't right all of the wrongs committed by the kitchen. And it still doesn't warrant the price.

Very bad.
author: Grey Z.

description:
I love this place. I go in there for the buffet about twice a month. I used to go once a week, but I over do it, and my pants are tight around the waist. 

The staff is friendly, the waiters are always nice. The hostess is super friendly and easy on the eyes.

The food is super good. For the price , I've never had any better. 

I will continue my Thursday ritual of Indian food at star India for ever!
author: Tasos P.

description: This is a great Indian restaurant and buffet lunch deal. Been going there for many years. The staff are friendly and their nan bread is served fresh and hot to each table (not sitting out as part of buffet) but included in lunch price. Also, Chai  tea is very good. Good Indian music and ambience. Never had a disappointment there. Always good!
author: Liee T.

description: This is our go to place whenever we're craving Indian food. It never disappoints, and we've been coming here for over 5 years. The staff is always super nice and friendly, the food is delicious, and the buffet is a deal. Plus, my 4 year old LOVES this place!!!
author: alla k.

description: So happy with this place. You can customize  how spicy you want it which is just great. We ordered way more than we could eat (big portions was a plus). Fast service and absolutely delicious. Left extremely full! The potatoe nan is great, chicken tiki masala, and rice is yummy. Good service. Highly recommended.
author: Allison T.

description:
Okay, so I've had delivery from Star India 3 times now and feel like I have a more accurate feel of how this review should go down.

1) This is for delivery only. Why? Because their minimum is only $12, and the food is usually all for me after work when I don't feel like cooking (which is more often than not). Also, if you order through beyondmenu.com, you can get free veggie samosas which are sometimes a little too salty for me, but mostly A-OK.

2) I always order garlic naan, although halfway through I wonder why because it just vaguely tastes like garlic and yet has this crazy yellow coloring on it that sometimes stains my fingers. Also it isn't that soft, but that's probably because it's being delivered. I've never been one to enjoy the tamarind and mint sauce that comes with naan, so I'll skip over that part.

3) I've had Chili Chicken, Chicken Madrasi, and Chicken Vindaloo so far. They're all quite tolerable, but I think the problem is that the chicken is a little too dry. And because I'm a sucker for tender meat, this is somewhat disappointing. I have to say my least favorite dish was the Chicken Vindaloo because the sauce was very pasty.

4) When you ask for spicy, you SERIOUSLY get spicy. I have a VERY high spice tolerance, to the point where waiters warn me when I order my food, so there's my credibility. On all three occasions, I've specified my food to be spicy, and on all three occasions, when I'm halfway through my meal, I find myself not being able to think straight temporarily because the food is so spicy. So you've been warned. I'm still recovering.

So all in all, A-OK, and convenient for delivery, but nothing that blows me out of the water.
author: Jenn L.

description:
HELLA CHEAP BUFFET $9.99 LUNCH OR DINNER

it's an amazing deal and there is a good variety of items (~16 different things, all pretty below average tasting).  the only thing that was decent was the butter chicken.   what impressed me is that you had your choice of free naan (yay garlic naan, boo it isnt soft or tasty..).  

the service is amazing and super friendly.  they do not even try rushing you out of there as well.  

i got a stomach ache afterwards from all the curries churning my intestines but what can i say, i ate lots of cheap indian food.
author: Tina A.

description: Had dinner buffet with family today.  DH wanted to try Indian cuisine before we go to India next month. I enjoyed the tender lamb curry and ground lamb/peas. The chicken tandoori wasn't very flavorful and was dry. The chicken marsala was tasty. Some of the food were lukewarm on the buffet table. Naan bread was served at the table hot-- choice of plain or garlic-- delicious. Lunch and dinner buffet for $10.99-- can't complain about the price
author: Pat D.

description:
Horrible, don't know what happened but I ordered the "Special Briayni" and it was not edible. Meat dry,seafood dry, rice dry and over cooked. 
The fricken Nan was stale and chewy as jerky.  Don't waste your hard earned money.  When I called to complain, the guy said he was sorry and he would have the manager call me. Never happened.
author: Montes A.

description: I went to Star India on Friday for the first time and it was awesome! My fiancé and I ordered the garlic naan, pratha, raita sauce, coconut curry and coconut shrimp and everything we had was amazing. Great flavor, perfect spice and probably the best service I have ever experienced. All the waiters were very attentive, fast and personable! Clean restaurant, wonderful employees, awesome food and great location. I was also thrilled that they had brown rice! Highly recommend  this place
author: Kelsey S.

description:
So disappointed in this place!

There were several issues with my order.

1. 1 piece of naan was burnt to a crisp.
2. The order was almost 30 minutes late
3. They didn't bring me chutney I had ordered.

When I called to ask about my chutney the woman on the phone asked me if I wanted to be refunded or have the chutney brought to me. I told her I wanted my chutney brought to me because the spicy vegetable jalfrezi i ordered was a soggy bland mess. She said she was going to send the driver back after he finished his current delivery. She calls me back 20 minutes later to tell me that the driver had many orders so it was going to take a while to get my chutney to me. I told her that was fine then I'd rather just be refunded for the chutney. This is what seems to have upset her.

At first she was frustrated that I just didn't want to wait for the chutney. She then claimed that they hadn't actually charged me for it which is interesting that this suddenly became an issue once i told her I didn't want to wait for the chutney. I told her I could see that I had been charged for this chutney because we ordered through grubhub. She then threw in my face "Are you going to make a big deal about this for $1?" Very rude considering I had been patient with her through this process. At this point I was just irritated said "Well yeah isn't it your job to properly send me my food?" She said fine and that she was going to have the driver come back to me with $2 for the hassle.

An hour later the driver arrives to our apartment to "refund" us. He only gives us $1 but at this point I just was over the entire situation and just accepted it. He then tried to argue with my boyfriend that it was just $1. 

This was a lot of headache to eat bland food. There are too many faster and better tasting places with less rudeness and better customer service skills. Will not order from here again.
author: Vanessa T.

description:
Eww.  This place is nas-tay and service comes with attitude.  The saag paneer and chicken tikka masala were bland.  So was the chai.  The rice was okay and the garlic naan was a little burnt and uneven.

Friend had a Google Offers here.  We didn't present it at the beginning of our meal, so I'm sure the attitude from the woman working here was unrelated from the fact that we were using a deal.  She exhibited some passive aggressive behavior, then took her long ass time getting us the bill.  We had to go back and find her to see what was going on... twice.
author: Erika C.

description:
I know as someone with a very low spice tolerance, ordering Indian food is always a gamble so I try to be fair in reviewing it. I'll break it down by menu item that I purchased.

My order:
Onion Bhaji
Chicken Korma
Kabuli Naan

I was super excited to find a place that carries onion bhaji, because it seems to be something of a rarity when I get Indian food. I was disappointed though that instead of the crispy, flavorful onion bhaji I love, I got soft, squishy onion rings. It was very disappointing!

I almost always order korma, because it's usually the safest pick for someone who doesn't like spicy food. This is easily the spiciest korma I have ever had (and I have eaten A LOT of korma in my day!), and all of the subtle flavors I love in korma were totally lacking. Again, very disappointing!

The Kabuli Naan was good (something not spicy, yay!), but as the only thing I was able to comfortably eat out of the whole order, it's nothing to write home about. 

However, what I will say in favor of this place is that the portions are good, they don't skimp at least. Downside for me is that I have a good chunk of food in front of me that I can't eat, because it is too spicy or too mushy. I will try and save the korma and adjust the flavor myself as a leftover maybe, but I think the onion bhaji is beyond saving.

I appreciate that the delivery was prompt though, especially since my place is hard to find. 

Maybe if you like your food really spicy you will have a better experience than me, but overall I think the spiciness just covers up the fact that the food is otherwise fairly bland in terms of flavor and complexity.

Unfortunately, I won't be eating here/ordering from here again.
author: Kirsten E.

description:
STUFF YOURSELF FULL OF INDIAN FOOD FOR CHEAP

If you're in the mood to binge on Indian cuisine, make your way to Star India for a $9.99 ALL-YOU-CAN-EAT buffet, lunch or dinner! Yes, its a pretty good deal if you are looking for a cheap meal to pig out on. I was introduced to Star India by my friend, Ken C. (his review is below on 2/8/11) who obviously loves this place. While I never thought of it as 5-star quality, I do think there are some worthy dishes served at Star India, along with some that taste pretty bad.

Above all, their best dish has to be the chicken tikka masala. After trying the entire selection on the buffet line, I can vouch this has to be the winner. After experimenting with some unappetizing dishes like the green-colored one in my photo (sorry I don't remember the name but its green) on the buffet line, I'll happily stick with the chicken tikka masala, rice and naan! Their dessert is also delicious, and tastes great paired with the chai tea!

If you enjoy eating Indian food, I'd suggest trying Star India at least once, just because its such a great deal. While the food may not be top-notch, the price and quantity itself is worth the visit.
author: Mari S.

description: I had a coupon from corporate perks that needed to be used so we went.  Anyhow, you cannot use the coupon on the buffet.  Food is okay.  However, the ambiance is a bit rustic, if you can call it that.  The people are nice. Plates and utensils are pretty clean.  If you want to get yummy food, the allu is good along with the vegetarian combo as well.
author: Joan H.

description: $27 on two dishes that were dry and without flavor. Absolute waste of money. The chicken tikka masala was bone dry, sauce was watery, and absolutely no flavor. I also ordered it medium and there was 0 spice. My girlfriend hated her tandoori kabob and said it was dry as well. She added "even the rice sucks". Don't waste your time or money on this place
author: Jon G.

description: I actually love this place. One of the better Indian food places in the area. Their food is flavorful and they don't skimp on the spice when you ask for it! I've tried most of their meats and have to say that anything with chicken is always pleasing. If you order delivery, it's speedy and the person sending the food over is usually friendly, give or take a bad day. Who doesn't have those though?
author: Stephanie R.

description:
Overall impression: The food was average but the price cannot be beat! We went for the $10.99 all you can eat buffet during dinner. 

The chicken tikka masala and complementary naan was my favorite. The rice pudding dessert was great too. They ran out of their chai tea unfortunately, but we heard the customers next to us really liking the rose milk. I recommend trying all of the different curries because they all have their own distinct flavors. The service was average. At times I felt rushed to leave. Definitely should not get that feeling at a buffet. 
 
This is basically the only Indian food place in the inner Richmond so I shall be back :)
author: Heidi Q.

description:
The Group decided on Indian for lunch so we ended at this place.  No complaints. Just nothing great to report either. 

Small buffet. No spices, nothing interesting - everything tasted just bland corporate cafeteria style. If you close your eyes you don't realize it's Indian food. 

No real need to go back.
author: Flo B.

description:
I went here today with my girlfriend for dinner.  She purchased a living social deal where it was $10 for $20.  By using this deal, we were not able to purchase the buffet  at the rate of $9.99 per person.  We purchased Al a carte.  

Onion naan.:  Bits of onion in the dough and what appears to be garlic and little green specs baked into the naan.  Not bad at all, and it complements the Chicken Tikka Masala very, very nicely.

Saffron Rice: Rice in three different shades of red with raisins, peanuts and cashews.  I must say I was pretty impressed by this Biyani.  However, it did not have a couple more un-edible ingredients that would bring out more flavor to a dish I eat at home called "dam-bout."

Chicken Tikka Masala:  The chicken wasn't too dry and the sauce was so good that it made you want to dip everything in it!.

Spinach mesh with Yogurt Pieces: I forgot the actual name of this dish, but I have to say I enjoyed it.  The yogurt had the texture of firm/chewy tofu, and I was very pleased with this dish.

Mango Ice Cream:  If you check in on yelp, you get one free mango ice cream!  Unfortunately... my girlfriend and I both "used" our mango ice creams and we only ordered one and needed to order one.  The way it tasted was frozen Mango Lassi.  My guess is there is a mango syrup added to a yogurt/milk blend, frozen and then diced into little cubes then served to us.

Overall, I am giving this place a 4 (Though I felt like giving this place a 3 for the majority of the visit due to the wait).  I am a bit upset about two things.  

1) We entered the store at 7:10p.m.  We were seated immediately, but no water/menus were given to us until 7:19p.m.  I saw the waiter and waitress work on bussing the other tables.  One main piece of advice is that you do not have your customers wait for you.  Those tables are less important than us.  Had I ordered the Taj Mahal beer at 7:19p.m. I guarantee you it would've been done before any of the dishes would've touched the table.

2) We ordered at roughly 7:25p.m.  At 7:44p.m. the waitress said our food would be with us shortly (my personal favorite for buying a bit of time). Received our dishes at 7:48p.m.  The wait took far too long.  There was another couple that came in at the same time as us, but instead chose the buffet option, and they were gone before we even had one dish on our table.  

Once we received the food, we were very pleased.  However, we feel that we probably would've been better off doing the buffet style without the deal from the beginning.

One note:  If you choose the buffet option, you must order naan through the waiters, you cannot pick that up.

I am definitely going to give this place another try, especially for a chicken tikka masala pizza, which I think would be wonderful.  But the wait today, was a bit too much.
author: Morris C.

description:
Speed walking to Star India....
BAM!! Smell of Indian food hit me. It was on...

$9.99 All You Can Eat Buffet


Food & Drinks-------------------
+Good Variety
+Warm
+Fresh
+Tasty
+++Milk Tea
+++Cold water

Service-----------------------------
+Very Friendly Staff (seemed family owned)
+Connected with customers on a personal level
+Refilled water and took away dishes quickly
+Honored the "Check-In" special of free Mango Ice cream (Homemade)
-Was a little slow on the checkout aspect
-Ran out of plates for a couple minutes
-Didn't have the red chicken dish for a good 15 minutes

Decor-------------------------------
+Lots of nice Indian decor
+Clean tables and chairs

Overall, my experience was great and will I definitely be back. 
However, my way back to my car was the worst part... I guess it was my fault :D


TIP: Check in through Yelp on your phone and you'll get Homemade Mango Ice cream 


Ended my day crawling back to my car from eating so much!
author: Tony C.

description:
I got this delivered and it was very economical. I got Naan, Chicken Tikka Masala Palak Pakora and Sag Paneer for $30. The Palak Pakora is really good and I would recommend it because the amount they give you can serve as a few meals or many snacks. Chicken Tikka Masala could have used a little more spice, but not much.

I was only upset because the delivery took almost an hour and a half, which was 20 minutes over the expected delivery time. I'll forgive them, though, because there was some pretty heavy traffic that day.
author: Sam D.

description:
It was pretty good. Came here for lunch on a Saturday. It wasn't that busy. We just had the Buffett. Though the waiter did offer us a regular menu. I didn't look at the menu, so I don't know what else they have to offer. 
Buffett was good, but small. Only a hand full of selections. But it actually filled me up! I'm thinking about coming here again for lunch and order off the regular menu. I'd recommend this place to others looking for some Indian food to eat/try. The staff seemed really friendly too.
author: Ta S.

description:
Buffet is a little limited in veg options (one of the dishes was way too salty), quite oily and the palak paneer was tasteless and had max 2 bits of paneer in the bin at a time- however, the naan was extremely fresh and fluffy and the ambience is clean, cozy and well-kept. The service was so friendly and attentive, not too overbearing. 

Pakode were too doughy for my taste, korma too greasy.

The gulab jamuns were somehow oily. Kheer was nice (not too many ways to fuck up kheer), but the main reason this place gets 4 stars was because of the cha. They've got an amazing bottomless punjabi-style cha behind the buffet that I couldn't get enough of. It's not spicy like the ginger masala chai in most indian restaurants, but rather creamy, smooth and with that one certain flavor that's "you know it when you taste it".

If I could just get a giant pitcher of that cha for delivery, this would be a 5-star review.
author: Liz R.

description:
Yikes ...

I can't speak for the restaurant itself, just the food, as I ordered delivery. Star India actually made me lose my appetite. The saffron rice came with raisins, something the menu neglected to mention -- I thought it really messed with the flavor of the curry. The garlic naan was soggy and thick. The chicken tikka malasa and palak paneer were very ordinary.

Not impressed.
author: Tiffany W.

description: I am in USA last three years .thats my fast time eat Indian food in Sanfransisco . I like that so much. Also they have good Service .and I likes that a lot . I just wanna tell all of u . Go there and try ones. Really the hv good food .
author: Deepika R.

description:
My server Farros(maybe Ferros?) Was very nice and attentive to my needs. My glass was never empty and my basket of naan was offered to be replenished as soon as it emptied.
 The buffet is a good value. I enjoyed most everything I ate. I prefer my food spicier but it's a buffet so I can't expect them to burn everyone's tongue for my sake.
I overall enjoyed myself and will return.
author: aaron t.

description:
This place is solid. 

Stopped by in-between errands for their lunch buffet special. I didn't realize I was hungry until I walked past and smelled the yumminess coming from inside. 

Pretty standard lunch buffet; $10.99 all you can eat which was great but definitely more for a meat-eater crowd. The veggies were delicious and perfect, but the lamb and chicken tikka masala were spiced to perfection and so tender. I went back for seconds on those. Palak paneer was good, and the raita seemed homemade and was very good as well. Pakoras were great, too. I didn't end up trying their desserts, but they looked great. Naan was standard. Everything was very rich and flavorful but not over-the-top on the spicy. Chai was good; rich, flavorful, not sweet, but could have used a bit more spice (I like a LOT of spice in my chai).

Service was very quick and it seemed each server (5 total) individually came by to check on me throughout. Very kind, quick and attentive. They're nothing fancy, but I definitely recommend it, and will be back!
author: Caitlyn D.

description:
Great place if :

You like luke warm food
No flavor
Reheated naan
Same single track of music playing over and over - OMG when will it stop?
author: Aadmi D.

description: The service here is great and was overall a warm and delightful experience.  The buffet was well maintained and the music was great.  The mango ice cream at the end was actually better than it looked, worth trying.
author: Daniel F.

description: My friend and I have a friendship built on Indian buffets.. okay that's obviously an exaggeration but it's kinda our thang. SF has been hard on us. Star India is one of the few dinner buffets, and it's also only like $11, so can't really beat that. I've been here twice so far, once when it's been slower and once when it's been packed. The food turnover is better when it's packed, with hot naan and crispy pakoras. The tandoori chicken's pretty darn great, both times. With the hot chai and a little bit of everything on your plate, you're bound to go home overstuffed and satisfied. Certainly not the best Indian I've had but it definitely hits the spot.
author: Vivian H.

description:
Oof, my first review update and unfortunately, it's not to report better news.  

After a hiatus for about a year, I'm sad that
1) The food is now heavily oversalted.  Not overly spicy (which I love), but it is extremely salty to the point that the flavors of a few dishes, notably the ground lamb, the lamb chunks, and cabbage dish suffer. 
2) New, unfriendly servers that are not really attentive about clearing plates or refilling water
3) Very sparse tandoori chicken orders - they only put out 4 pieces at a time, and they only very rarely put out more.
author: C L.

description:
I ordered from this place via grubhub.com
I got 2 orders of chicken tiki masala (~$10 each), 2x garlic nan, rice and it came with free lassi because I spent over $18 via grubhub.com 

The guy delivering my food didn't know where I lived, even though my address is stated when I placed the ordered. I also named out Parc 55, Powell and other surrounding places near my apt. Needless to say, it took awhile for my food to be delivered.

The chicken tiki masala seemed watered down. You can still taste the spices and seasonings and there were large chunks of chicken, but still I don't like when it's not thick enough. Garlic nan was typical, as was the rice. Lassi was pretty tasty, but standard.
author: Connie M.

description: Great place!!! I love the buffet and Chai tea, so yummy!! The staff and owners are very personable and make you feel at home, a must visit if your eating in the city
author: Gina N.

description: All you can eat $10.99 for good Indian cuisine in SF?  How can you beat that?  They even bring hot, fresh naan to the table and are really good at keeping the water coming.  The guys there are reserved but friendly and professional.  The buffet includes the typical Indian fare that you would expect and they don't skimp on the meats like chicken and lamb (unlike the Chinese buffet where you have to search for the meat)
author: chauncey h.

description:
This place is great let me start I went yesterday evening and they were busy still they handle my order on the table we were five people and our order was big .we ordered chicken tandoori and garlic tikka Kabab that was awesome!! And we had limb vindaloo, saag paneer.
Everything was perfect! Thanks guys you guys are awesome!! Will come back fast... service was on the spot:::)
author: Jyoti W.

description: After seeing their menu  on my door gate for years, I finally tried it.  I've only ordered delivery but it is spot on.  Big portions and spicy.  If you're brave, try the very spicy.
author: Chris M.

description: Best India food in sf  buffet is great service excellent Sukh always have a good vibe thanks for bringing authentic Indian food for us
author: Rafael F.

description:
At a time when buffets are either scarce, trashy, or low-quality, Star India remains a rock solid reminder that you can have good service, a pleasant atmosphere, and truly delicious food in all-you-can-eat quantities at an affordable price.

I'll just cut to the chase: the food is excellent. The naan is served to order (included in the buffet) which means you get freshly baked naan with your meal...mm! They offer at least 8 different dishes, salad, parathas, kheer, gulab jamun, lentil soup, and chai. When I crave chicken tikka masala I crave the one they serve here - it's creamy, not overly tomato-ey, and spiced well. The lamb curry was rich and delectable. And even if you're not a vegetarian you have to try the vegetarian curry; it is light and slightly sweet. I really appreciate that every entree has a unique flavor. And if you love gulab juman like me...well you're in luck, because you can have all the sweet syrupy balls you want!

There's a sign on the buffet stand that reminds customers that you are free to eat all you would like but to please not take more than you can, and I think that sentiment is carried through the business. There's a respect here for the food and customers that so often gets ignored at restaurant buffets, so it comforts me to know places like Star India are around!
author: Clarice W.

description: I've been coming here for years and the service/food is always amazing. The chicken tikka masala is always on point along with the rest of the dishes. Garlic naan also comes with the buffet.. This place is the bomb.
author: Sabrina H.

description: Star India has become our "go to" place for Indian cuisine buffet. My son always gets the mango lassi. The naan is always fresh out of the oven. I love the chai tea, it gives a little pick me up when I need it. And, the service is great.
author: Bebe L.

description:
First i'd like to say that Judy G below is an old biddy. I was in the restaurant when that whole thing went down. She didn't know the difference between dal soup and a dal dish. Maybe she should ask if she doesn't have experience in ordering Indian food. Any of the staff would be delighted to help her. Plus who orders a 3 dollar dish at a sit down restaurant? This is not a cafe.

 I frequent this place quite a bit and feel as if everyone is always extremely polite. I even watched them try to amend the situation and offer her another dish and dal soup to go as well.
 
I guess you cannot always please everyone, especially those who are delighted to bitch about everything in life. She even was rude on the way out and left the food that they had wrapped (and gave free dal soup with) to go. 

People like this irritate me. In fact after she left, I even asked what that "rude bitches" problem was. They tried so hard to accommodate, but I guess she just didn't want to helped. 

So for you Judy G, I'd like to say, I really hope you don't frequent any other of my favorites restaurants with your cheap ass. I realize some people are on fixed incomes, but even if that is the case, it still gives you no right to act like such an ass.
author: Zoeboe D.

description: The food here is really good. I usually just go for their all you can eat, as I like to try different things and they have a good variety for the value. I would definitely come back again. Also the service is pretty friendly.
author: Emily G.

description:
RANDOMLY STOPPED BY. SURPRSINGLY GREAT. 

Definitely try the lamb and the chicken. The amount of spiciness to the curry was, in my opinion, just right. The garlic bread is great too! 

Service was great. We were constantly checked on and had our plates replaced. Did i mention the buffet was $10.99? Great deal.

Free chai tea along with your buffet purchase!

Overall, the place was a well deserved 4-stars. There may be better places, but this is one that should be visited.
author: Katarina L.

description: Best chicken tikka masla ever! Fresh naan, and great selection on the buffet. We drove all the way from Novato, worth it!
author: Madison F.

description:
Utilized the Living Social's takeout/delivery promo deal to order in Star India. I choose the Dal soup $(3) and lamb vandaloo ($11) w basmati rice ($3) http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/WKBAkKgeqJ9aCoexvpNUeA?select=394oLPu38b7MMRAsncPG8g. The vandaloo's sauce was pretty good with healthy portion of potatoes and lamb, but I found lamb a little tough at a $12 price point. 

The Dal soup was quite tasty but a little to brothy. I prefer Dal soups that are a purée of lentil sans broth. 

All in all not bad. Will probably try again if I don't find a better priced competitor.
author: Quentin J.

description: Absolutely love this place! The food is always hot, fresh and with the right amount of spice/heat. The waiters are always very attentive, especially one named Bobby.
author: Wesley H.

description:
Very good food. Range of spiciness for us with a sensitive tongue and perfect blend of spices to leave the lasting taste in mouth. 

Buffet for 10$ lunch&dinner. Need I add :)

Nice hidden gem!

Parking on the street, doesn't seem to be an issue.. maybe in the rush hour.

Kids = sure why not, the place is casual and the food is delicious! Bring them on!

No patio (that's not a criticism, just a mention for those of us with pets).

4,5 stars overall.
author: Matea F.

description: I will call it best place serving home cooked food.. Felt like m eating in somewhere good in INDIA.. Thank you for wonderful food.. And yes least expensive...
author: Harpreet G.

description:
Delighted to find this place.. Kheer and kheema. Incomplete without mango IceCream, amazing. They serve delicious gulab jamun, I don't want anything else :)
value for money 10/10 :)
PS: they play Bollywood in the restaurant.. Awesome home feel :)
author: Vamsi R.

description: i was been there for couple of times with my friend and the food was really good and i usally want to go with buffet over here and all dishes you know won't leave one item in the buffet everything is great and delicious the thing i like more here is chiken thikka masala and the at the end with gulab jamun is perfect and along with that we  have chiken and vegi pakora with tea,
author: Srikanth T.

description:
like this place a lot. They let me micromanage my experience as much as i wanted! 

It cant get better than that when they didnt get annoyed that i changed tables, rearranged the plates & flowers & everything else on the table & other annoying things i like to do at restaurants. 

their Curries are better than Clay Ovens buffet but chicken tikka is not necessarily fabulous. Their lamb is GREAT. Very tender you can tell it is choice meat & slow cooked for a long time. Delicious rice, lassi, & saag paneer. Everything was good here but the chicken tikka was not a main attraction. Also they have massala chai included in the buffet that you can get yourself! 
My favorite part that i discovered at the end was that they have different size plates! I love that they have big plates, small plates & tiny plates available too, i hate always having to use a giant plate, so that made me almost as happy as the masalla chai! The salad was very simple with many different non american dressings. Great mango lassi for $2.50, thats a good price. dinner buffet is $10.95. Nice atmosphere, quiet, like home. Very courteous and genuine hosts.

Great service!
author: Grilled O.

description: Yummy buffet. Friendly service by Bobby. Chai is nice. Nan came out nice, hot and buttery. Will come back when in the city.
author: laura i.

description:
I had vegetarian items at the buffet and I thought It was pretty good! The naan was super greasy though! The Navratan Korma was ok, but thinner than at most places I get it. 

The service was very good. They were quick, polite, and attentive.

I'd recommend the Buffet for good quick food, but I doubt the individual items are particularly spectacular.
author: Tim R.

description:
My go to take out Indian food.
Love their potatoes in triangles.
They must have Irish souls.
author: Kathleen G.

description:
I went here for years and love this place! you can't beat their buffet which is phenomenal !!! 

Highly recommend you try their buffet!!!
author: Dale S.

description:
The staff is super nice and friendly. The food is good for what you're paying.

I'm not expecting lamb chops for eight bucks, and the place doesn't leave you smelling like food when you leave.
author: Richard B.

description:
Good for hungry stops! 
Ground lamb was pretty good...even the veggie chef SPL kurma is nice..
author: Ashwin K.

description:
We have been here for dinner number of times always expecting it to be good, but its not never !
- the saag paneer always tastes stale like cooked in morning and re-heated !
- other indian curries are either too spicy or too sweet but not good authentic taste
- the kheer is bad
- gulab jamuns are good sometime but usually hard not good
- their snacks are toooo less .. the veggie pakora is not warm too ... 
- the worst is their naan service .. you need to keep waiting for like 10 min beofre naan comes even i buffet ... usually they are not well cooked .. sometimes they are fine .. but not soft as they should be.

We always repent going to this place after coming back bcoz you feel heavy ... hope they improve the quality of food like 10 times ... otherwise avoid the place .. i think nearest 'the curry village' in inner sunset is much better than this... !
author: Deepak A.

description: I come here often and the food is always great. It's one of the few restaurants that actually uses fresh ingredients daily. The staff is amazing and very friendly and will cater to your every need. will definitely be coming back here more.
author: Kabir B.

description:
Overall I thought this was just OK.  I was very surprised given the great reviews.  I ordered carry-out, so maybe next time I'll try the buffet... they're definitely worth trying again (and trying other dishes).

The Chilli Chicken was very disappointing (can't believe it's listed as a House Special).  I ordered it spicy and it lacked any heat...nothing...almost like they loaded it with bell peppers. It also had a strange fluorescent red sauce...looked like Sweet and Sour sauce...ugh 

The Saag Paneer was decent.  It did lack the usual spices you'd normally taste in this dish.  I have to agree with previous posts about it being bland.

The Chicken Makhanwala is great.  I would return just for this dish...and they also got the spice level right.  The Tandoori Chicken used had great flavor and was very moist.
author: Zoran L.

description: Worst food ever! I ordered the Mixed Vegetable Jalfrezi and Shrimp Coconut and I did not like either one. I asked for them to make both dishes medium spicy. None were spicy at all and they were very bland. Indeed, they were bland to the point that I was bored out of my mind eating and gave more attention to my glass of wine. I can make better Indian food despite the fact that I do not know how to cook Indian food. The shrimp was overcooked and I think the worst part about the meal was that you have to separately order rice. That's really cheap for a restaurant to do. Positive: people were good and the rice was okay. Overall lots of better options in SF, definitely will not be coming back here.
author: Denisse R.

description: I have had the pleasure of dining here for over 2 years now and I can't believe it took me this long to write a review.  Whether it is dining for convenience or for amazing flavor, Star India has you covered.  You can hit up the buffet for an amazing price or sit-in for a longer stay and choose from the menu.  The environment is set with great music and great design.  If you happen to be in the Richmond or not, be sure to stop in for a great experience.
author: David W.

description: No words awesome food.  Last night Me and my girl friend Kristina hav awesome dinner.   Super clean my gf order from menu I went for dinner buffet simply superb fresh and hot dishes servers are super nice. Manager is cool and friendly .i love the food  it became my fav Indian restaurant in sfo.
author: Krish C.

description: Ordered via eat24hours. The food came quickly and was very fresh. The fish curry was incredible, I've never had anything quite like it. Ordered it extra hot, spices were amazing, fish was cooked perfectly. The naan was moist and fluffy, so good.
author: Luke R.

description:
We had the buffet here, so I can't speak to their a la carte items, but we chose the buffet because it had a number of vegetarian items I normally really love.  I agree with a previous reviewer that some of the food tasted really, really bland.  I was reaching for salt, pepper, anything I could find to add a little flavor-- not good.  The palak paneer was particularly disappointing.  The veggie korma was also bland- though better than the palak paneer.  There was a lentil/read-bean "chef vegetarian special" dish that was unidentified, but more promising than the others.  Also what seemed to be simply sauteed broccoli.  Not bad, but not good.  The chai was almost undrinkable, which is too bad, and the gulab jamun tasted really stale.  I mean, still sweat and cake-y, so, you know, I ate it, but still.  Sad monkey.  Naan served to our table was okay- but nothing to write home about.

To give credit where due: the dal soup was very tasty, but sadly too spicy for my not-spicy-loving-palate.  But if you can handle a little heat, then the dal soup is yummy.

Also, the main hostess was incredibly nice, and the waiter we had was also very nice.  The prices were not bad, but not cheap enough that you thought: "oh well, mediocre food... it's not all that bad"

Maybe we hit a bad night?  Maybe we tempted fate by doing buffet instead of a la carte?  Whatever it was, with all the other Indian options, we'll probably try our luck somewhere else.
author: Tarah D.

description:
Sum of it: Delivery guy was super rude, and the food lacked flavor. 


If you're interested, story time is below.

I called the restaurant 15 minutes after my hour long delivery window passed. Turns out the driver didn't buzz my apartment and instead tried calling me on the wrong number. No worries, I politely gave the correct number and waited a bit longer. 

When I met the driver, he started ranting at me for not giving the correct number. When the customer comes to meet you smiling, you shouldn't be so rude and unapologetic. I really did not care he was late. I was the one who waited over an hour and a half for my food, and you don't see me acting like a jerk. Also guess what Sparky- I have the food email confirmation, and I did provide the right number. 

After I warmed up my cold food, I discovered Star India not only has one rude delivery man but the food lacks flavor as well.
author: Lainey D.

description:
Review of delivery from Star India

Chicken Vindaloo
The sauce was very good. It could probably used a touch more heat but it was a very pleasant mix of spices. However, the chicken itself was dry and a bit tough.

Pilau Rice
The rice was a mushier than I am used to. It did taste good though.

Vegetable Samosa
This was very average. Nothing made it stand out and the spice mixture was relatively single toned.

Garlic Naan

The naan was pretty good. It did not match up to the best of naans I've tried but it was good enough. It was especially good when dipped into the vindaloo sauce.Delivery was prompt, polite, and professional.
author: Mark D.

description:
Pass this place - everything is reheated. Only reason this guy is in business is because of the Indian consulate next door.

What is good - 1/2 roti served hot,

What is not good - chicken tikka, pakora too salty, gulab jamun for sure 1 week ago.

Place is small and food selection is limited. Not sure how people give this a 3.5 stars.
author: Krishna Y.

description:
What is most important about an Indian buffet? Please allow me to answer.

Quality - The food is healthy and delicious
Affordable - 9.99 for a buffet in the city?... Schwing!
Atmosphere - It's classy. you can be loud or quiet... the place suites all.
Service - They smile, they enjoy their work, and take pride in the place as it is run well.

5 stars to a restaurant who made a memorable lunch experience!
author: Brian P.

description: We ordered delivery from them last night based on a recommendation from one of our Indian friends. We had lamb korma, chicken tikka, the fish curry, and an assortment of naan. The order came quickly and was super hot. The Lamb was delicious, I liked that the meat still had a bit of bite to it and it wasn't overly fall-apart. The chicken tikka looked watery but quickly thickened up once it cooled a bit and the chicken was super tender. The fish curry was the star as it was perfectly cooked and the sauce was absolutely delicious! The onion naan was my favorite and the rice was very good--they add cashews and golden raisins(I think) so it was more than your average white basmati. We will be back!
author: Julie M.

description: Today we went star India with my friends , the food was really good and we can enjoy with the food
author: Gowtham K.

description:
Came here with a $10 off $20 Restaurant.com certificate. They didn't accept it for the buffet even though there were no such restrictions on the certificate. We weren't allowed to order their pizza since it was reserved only for takeout/delivery and not dine-in (wtf??). 

BUT... their food was good. We ordered their chicken navratan and chicken tikka masala with a side of plain naan bread. Both dishes were delicious (hard to fail with curries), but were TINY proportions for the price you pay ($11-12 each). Great tasting food, but not worth it in my opinion, especially when compared to many other Indian restaurants in the area (ie. India Clay Oven).
author: Andrew T.

description: Ugh this may have been the worse Indian food ever! I ordered the lamb vindaloo - it arrived over an hour late (I called a couple of times because it was only suppose to take 30-40 minutes but ended up taking almost 2 hours total!) and was not at all edible. I ended up throwing away ALLl of my food. They didn't even give me rice and I spent almost $40! I would never order from here again. NEVER.
author: Karen G.

description:
$9.99 for the dinner buffet, what a deal!  I like the Chicken Tikka Masala here better than at Curry Village, but the selection was much smaller.  The place was relatively empty so the tandori chicken and pakora seemed like it had been sitting out there for a bit (dry and lukewarm).

All the curries were really good and a little bit spicier than most Indian   buffets.  I don't eat lamb, but my friend said the lamb curry was really tender and yummy.
author: Michele S.

description:
This place has an amazing buffet! There are so many choices and well-created flavors. I'm so happy to go here with friends. It's great for vegetarians, too. This is the kind of buffet where you could easily accidentally overload your plate. Everything looks (and is!) so tasty.

The chai is good. It's not the best by any means, but it compliments the meal well. The naan is quite well done. No complaints about that.

I will be back here!
author: Sterling D.

description: We ordered off menu and enjoyed the buffet. Menu order was GREAT - Chana masala - spicy. Buffet was satisfying and good. Good crowd for Thursday night on Geary. Super nice staff. Kid friendly. We'll be back!
author: Sarah B.

description:
This place was wonderful!
GREAT Chicken Tikka Masala!
wonderful, cheerful staff that kept my glass full throughout my meal.
Highly reccomended. :)
author: Venice F.

description:
The buffet option is very economical and has good variety. But the food quality is not great. ygwypf.
The music was a little too loud for us when we were there.
author: venu p.

description:
Star India is sooooooooooooo much better than it used to be. For $10.85 I give myself some ALL STAR treatment!! Fried goodies, hot&chewy naan included, impressive spread of vegetarian and meat curries, good rice, the best dahl soup, hot chai, gulab jamun, beautiful ambiance, professional service.... i love this place. Also, they keep some staple curries but also add in some new ones here and there. My favorite things so far are the curried cabbage and the navaratan korma.

I would love it so much if they started a buffet punch card deal... like you get your card stamped everytime you eat the buffet and on your 10th, 12th whatever buffet you get it for free!
author: Libra J.

description: I ordered from Star India through GrubHub. This is the worst Indian food I've ever eaten. The chicken tikka masala had no flavor at all. The seekh kabab was soggy and cold. The food was delivered 45 minutes later than promised. Very disappointing experience.
author: Andy A.

description: Great place to eat indan food. So Happy with this place. I ordered way more than I could eat haha.fast service and absolutely *DELICIOUS* .I left extremely full The NAN is best ever I had and best Mango Lassi.the service is great. Good people
author: Lucky S.

description:
Bummed out.

This place was always our number 1 spot to grab some chicken tikki masal.  Actually the first Indian food I had ever had. We are no Indian food connoisseurs but we can appreciate a nice reasonably priced place with good food. 
I just picked up my to go order for lunch with my girl and just grabbed and went. Upon arrival I see that now, not only had the price gone up for chicken tikki masala but it no longer came with rice.  So $28 and some change later I'm sitting with naan and chicken... no rice. Amongst the WONDERFUL service they always provide *sense the sarcasm* I'm left...

Hella bummed.

2 stars = because the food was still tasty. 

In search for a new Indian spot, any ideas?

-ash
author: Honest A.

description:
I tried this place a couple times, hoping that I just got a bad impression at first.... wrong.
I usually judge Indian Restaurants based on their Chicken Tikka Masala and the Lamp Curries. Their Chicken Tikka Masala was just runny, lacking flavor (I don't know how it is even possible...) and meat that was hardly edible.

the Meat for me was so disgusting, I had to throw it away.Hope I am wrong but I got the feeling that these guys are just using the cheapest meat possible....
author: David V.

description: My husband and I regularly order the vegetarian thali for delivery. While it's not the best Indian food I've ever had, it's a great deal and it usually arrives pretty quickly. Recommended for those nights you don't want to cook and you need something tasty!
author: Jessica M.

description: The food was pretty good but the fritters were way salty. The buffet quality was as expected. Not bad. I think there could have been more heat and spice, personally. I was pleased that there were a couple of dishes I hadn't had before (one with kidney beans). My biggest complaint is that they did not seem to use a rice cooker, for the rice was holding a lot of moisture which resulted in a bland watery curry gravy/juice on my plate in the end. But hey, I ate three plates. I enjoyed myself but comparatively it wasn't stellar.
author: Andrew W.

description:
I thoroughly enjoyed Star India for these reasons:
* The restaurant was neat and clean.
* They had a buffet for $9.99.
* The chicken tikka masala was excellent. The flavor was more tomato than cream which was fine with me. The chicken in it was fresh and moist. Most importantly, I did not find any fat/tendons on the chicken.
* They put ice in their water. It may sound insignificant, but this is the first time I have been served water with ice out of about 10 Indian restaurants that I've been to.
* Geary street had plenty of open parking meters at noon on a Saturday.

Some things they could improve on are:
* Putting labels on all of the food. I only know what tikka masala looks like. The other things I tried were satisfying but I couldn't tell you what most of it was.
* Selection was limited, but understandable given the number of patrons eating there at the time.
author: Daniel B.

description: Get the Buffett! Amazing service, and amazing food! Came here at 9pm after the Warriors game and the atmosphere was really nice
author: Zak B.

description:
I go here for the buffet at least once a month (which says a lot, given how many options there are for restaurants) and I I always love it. 
I'm vegan and they're really good about telling me which buffet items are vegan-friendly, and the one time that there were only 2 dishes in the buffet they brought me an entree out to supplement it for free! Also, the free naan has dairy in it and they've brought me out chapati as a vegan alternative (also without extra charge). 

The staff is incredibly friendly and helpful, and the food is great! Plus the fact that you can eat a huge dinner for $10 is pretty awesome.
author: Emily B.

description: For $10 dinner buffet: great service, five hot vegetarian main dishes (including bengan bartha and saag aloo), hot buttery naan to your table. Also, appetizers, lentil soup, salad, chai, and desert.. Why only three stars? Short wait, and bland food. This food is lacking some flavor - needs more spices.
author: Dana G.

description: Ordered delivery. Instead of the makhanwala, they gave me chicken tikka masala, which was not as complex at all as what I wanted. The keema naan was soggy. The spicy vegetable jalfaze was ok. The delivery guy couldn't be bothered to ring the buzzer, even with my 15% tip.
author: Derrick V.

description:
I went in for the lunch buffet. Liked this place a lot. The food was great with a large selection including some for the vegetarian folks out there.
      The service here was some of the best I've had at an Indian restaurant in some time. My waitress (wish I'd gotten her name) was friendly, helpful, and just on top of everything in terms of customer service, maybe even a step ahead.
      It was also reasonably priced, parking availability decent, and just a worthwhile spot to visit when you're hungry in the city.

5 stars for customer service. 4 stars for food. Two thumbs up.

P.S: Everything was great, but the tandoori chicken was incredible and easily the best I've eaten.
author: Ej S.

description:
I was craving Indian food and this place did the trick.  The flavors were all there, and I enjoyed everything I ate. I do wish the chicken in my tikka masala was more tender and in smaller pieces, but I loved the flavors.  I loved the veggie samosas, and it came with two dipping sauces. The tamarind sauce was a little spicy but so tasty I kept eating it. 

Delivery was super quick, and friendly. The prices are cheap so if you're looking for decent, cheap Indian food this will do the trick.
author: Jeanne M.

description:
Although I live only a few blocks away, I tried Star India for the first time tonight with my boyfriend. It wasn't very crowded though it was busier than I had expected for the Inner Richmond. I think most people get/got the dinner buffet ($10, great deal) but we opted for a la carte. 

The samosas were tasty, the chicken tikka masala was quite flavorful. The spicy vegetable jalfraze was good but not very spicy at all (would forego if you're looking for spice). However, it was a solid vegetarian dish with good flavors. The onion kulcha naan was good, though it was a little doughy for naan (I'll try the garlic naan next time). Next time, I'd also like to try the tandoori chicken with yogurt marinade (yum!).

We ended the meal with delicious kheer - very mild and soothing rice pudding - and Kulfi ice cream. The ice cream was awesome - like eating cold chewy ice cream that tasted like a million diff subtle flavors. 

Service was great - really attentive. The waiters were nice and friendly and always kept our glasses full of water.
author: Nami S.

description: This is a nice restaurant and the service is great. My problem is that the food is so bland. Are they afraid to offend americans with authentic spicy Indian food? The chai tea if free, and that is good, but it is the worst tasting I ever had, and that is bad! The food was hot, and the buffet had a decent variety, although it could use more vegetarian options. No fruit? All in all, decent food.
author: David B.

description: Hate to be negative, but this buffet was quite, um, how shall I put it? Bad? Yes. That's a good word for it. Sweet-natured staff, they made us tea. But the food was....not good. Stale, cold, poor quality. The wall painting of the dancer with the come hither look and the crop top à la Miley Cyrus is amusing but not worth the price of dinner.
author: Michael B.

description: This has become our go-to Indian place in the Inner Richmond.  Note: I have never eaten in-restaurant, only done take-out.  But from our experience, it's been really good.  The prices are decent because the portions are really big-- I'll usually get a thing of rice, curry dish, and a nan and I will eat half of each and I'm stuffed.  Then I get to have the rest the next day!  I'm personally not a spicy fan, and I get the coconut curry (mild) and saffron rice.  I got chicken the first time, but was really disappointed by the taste and quality of the chicken, which is something I've read from some other reviews on here, so I've gone veggie after that.  Overall, this place is great for take-out-- always quick, too!
author: Jess B.

description: If only there would be  0 star rating....  Ordered through Eat24. Delivery was confirmed for 40 min, but food came an hour and a half later. Plus missing a dish and spilled all over the bag. Tasted pretty plain too. Their soup was just hot water with curry powder added to it. Tikka Masala tasted like nothing. Horrible food and horrible service. Nasty and never again, after 1 1/2 hour wait.
author: Laurie P.

description: Easy, affordable ($11) Indian buffet.  The food was pretty good (for a buffet), and the service was very friendly!  I got a bit of work done on my laptop while I ate in the late afternoon (2:30-5pm), and they didn't seem to mind that I was there for a while (there was hardly anyone else in the restaurant).
author: Cy C.

description: The $11 buffet is always solid and the waitstaff is very friendly. I find myself coming back to this place every time I visit SF and it never disappoints.
author: Keith P.

description:
So this is the worst thing happened to me during my SFO trip

After been to Golden Gate, I was trying to find some Indian place to have the meal and this place come up as one of the good search, I called the place and confirm if they are open as i didnt want to go another 8 miles and Owner confirmed that they are open for lunch
Finally we reach to the place, Did a street park and as we entered the place, I was told to sit on 2nd left table, I was about to get settled and a man approached me and said, sorry we can't serve you.
I was confused as i can see other customers (10+ ) and they were having food so surely they aren't out of food or anything.
When i questioned about it, he said, they are expecting a party of 20 ppl so they have just enough food, I was more pissed now, I told him that i called the place and confirmed before coming here and interestingly I talked to the same person, But he didnt show any remorse or felt any sorry, Finally i left the place and had lunch next door.
author: Dharm S.

description:
I've tried Star India twice, once getting the buffet and once à la carte.
 
Yes, the buffet is a great price - $9.99, but the food is lukewarm at best, and you need to give it a good stir to mix in the "skin" that forms on top.  There's no naan at the buffet, you'll need to order that separately (and do that right away, bc it can take forever.)  Also, you can't use the Yelp Check-In Deal (Mango Ice Cream) when you get the buffet. 

We had a tastier (and warmer!) meal when we ordered à la carte, everything was delicious, but yeah, your bill will be higher.  

Service was off both times we went.  They seem to have an issue with my having a beer.  The first time we went, I needed to point to the beer on the menu- the waiter was either unfamiliar with it, or didn't understand me.  Maybe it's just me, but if you're selling something, know that you are, and recognize the name of it.  It gets better from here... the waiter brought my beer without asking my boyfriend if he wanted a drink, so he ordered a beer when mine was brought to the table.  Umm, the waiter took my beer from me, and gave it to my boyfriend.   This last time we went, I wasn't asked if I wanted to order a drink, the waiter scurried away after my boyfriend ordered his beer.  I gave up.

Getting the bill was another challenge.  The waiter knew we were done, he asked us if we were, then took half our dishes away.  It's frustrating to sit at the table, dirty dishes piled around, watching your waiter BS with the kitchen staff.
author: Meg W.

description:
Dear Star India,

I'm not just saying this because you all are related to my favourite Indian.  BUT.. I THINK I LOVE YOU.  I definitely love your food.  The super spicy chicken saagwala was amazing!  The naan was buttery and gorgeous and I think my chicken tikka masala made me a cry a bit from joy.  (Might have been my allergies, but I don't think so..) The kulfi was uber delicious; loved the condensed milk.  

Thank you for a lovely lunch.  I'll come back with my 2nd stomach.

-=c
author: Chell M.

description:
This place ain't fancy schmancy but they're pretty darn deeee-licious.

Their buffet doesn't have a gazillion dishes so don't expect much in selection.  However, they do prepare their food with love.  Everything was pretty tasty and the staff were all very friendly.  

Their mango ice cream is wonderful.  It's made in-house and is a rather lengthy process.  Try it!
author: Jennifer D.

description:
10/19/12 UPDATE: after my harsh previous review, the manager called me and has offered to resend my order in an attempt to get me to improve my review. This has already improved my review by one star. I love good customer service. Very nice Miss Manager! :)

The food is much better if you get it after a bad review! I'm actually taking a break from eating it to write this part!. The poori still isn't great, but maybe eating that onsite is better. Perhaps their regular naan is better for delivery.
The samosas taste great and the outside of them is not covered in weird extra spices this time. extra star for my second order. much better than I thought yesterday!
author: Alexandra R.

description:
We had a Living Social coupon and upon entering Star India we told the waiter this.  He then asked if we wanted the buffet, which we agreed to try.  The food on the buffet had obviously been sitting there a very long time, as everything was cold.  The service was weird and almost non-existent.  

At the end of the meal we told a woman we had a Living Social, and she said we could not use this on the buffet. We clearly told the waiter we had a Living Social, and he did not tell us there was any problem using it.  The app version of the coupon said nothing about such a restriction.  They absolutely would not accept this coupon, even though originally they did not say it was a problem.

Isn't the point of a coupon to introduce a customer to a new restaurant?  How does being completely rude and lying, as well as serving cold food, win over a new customer?  We will be contacting Living Social to hopefully get a refund.  I will never step foot in this restaurant again.
author: Tim K.

description:
Star India is a consistent source of tasty chicken korma, savory samosas and and perfectly tandooried naan. Their reliable delivery service is always fairly prompt.
