I've enjoyed their lunch buffet many times over the last several years. It offers a bounty of vegetarian delights alongside a lamb and chicken dish or two.

Salad, daal soup and chai and dessert round out the feast.

Star India is my go-to spot for good Indian cuisine.
author: Carole B.

description:
Worst Indian food I have ever had!
Sag Paneer was like tastless watery green soup with a few dried cheese chunks. The Chicken Korma was too watery too and the chicken dry and over cooked. The Seekh Kabob was  over cooked until dry and had little taste. The Tandoori Prawns were not prawns but shrimps and were not Tandoori but yellow Curry Shrimps. The Nan was tough, so tough you could hardly tear it apart and chewing it hurt your jaws.

Oh and did mention that it is expensive? They don't even give you Rice or Nan with your entree.
author: Steven B.

description:
Namasté!
Two things: Firstly, I tried to go there once on a break as serving at one of the election polling places.  As this place is dark and dingy, the only ONE table by the window was almost becoming avaliable.. Then the person left. Then like a shinkansen train, some other Indian bloke zoomed snugly right into my spot I had waited for. I thought that was quite rude on his part!  I complained and I was told that to simply find another (dark and dingy) table!  The waiter stood up for this rude sucker simply because he was from India as well! (I am not Indian, but European and Japanese mix (hapa). As both Europeans and East Asians, we ultimately at one point in our genetic makeup, come from India!

Two: I decided to give it a go some months later at night.  I was profoundly disappointed. The place looked like it came out of the largest slums in Asia, located within Kolkutta. It was dirty, unkempt, and litterally falling apart!  It doesn't seem that the place ever went through a remodelling job since whenever it first opened!

the staff were grossly unfriendly and it was so blatantly obvious that despite my interest in Indian culture, the only thing that mattered to them was $$$$$! I was simply a wallet on two legs to them!

The food. It was bland, their buffet was half empty, and when I got home that night, during the wee hours of the morning, I became "married" to the toilet with the Kokutta Trots!  I was sick for two days in bed and in the bathroom!  It was a living hell!

My friends, Indian or otherwise, PLEASE venture away from this old run down delapidated place!  I know it is virtually conveniently located close to the General Consulate of India, but It is unfriendly atmosphere, unfriendly staff, and indeed quite unfriendly to your intestinal tract!

I am very surprised that the San Francisco Department of Health has not yet closed down this place!  Perhaps I should contact them and have an inspector come out to investigate!

WARNING!  UNFIT FOR HUMAN CONSUMPTION!  STAY AWAY! Thanks!
author: Akinato K.

description: I had Dinner buffet. Its terrible. Food was cold and looked like leftovers from day before or morning. Chai tea was definitely very old and changed its taste. I am Indian and I know how a decent if not wonderful Indian food taste. Gulab Jamun in desert were unbreakable hard.Mood spoiled!
author: Garima K.

description:
I've been to star India a few times before. I usually come here for their buffet. Their lunch and dinner buffet are both $10! And the food is really good! They have a large assortment of dishes as well. They even have my favorite, palak paneer! 

I came here for lunch for the first time the other day. At most buffet restaurants, the dishes are not fresh and you aren't given many choices. But it's quite the opposite for this place; which is awesome! 

The service was great as well! Our waiter was very friendly and attentive. This was a pleasant surprise since most buffet places tend to neglect their customers. 

All-in-all, I really enjoyed having lunch here and their dinner option is great too! Definitely stop by when you have the chance! You won't be disappointed!
author: Christy S.

description:
Order food food online. Estimated time was 45-60 min wait. After waiting for 75 min, I decided to call on the status of my order. Was told food was on its way. After waiting for an additional 15 min, we finally received our food. I specifically asked not to have the doorbell rang, but call since I have an in-law apartment and did not want to bother my neighbors (we have multiple doorbells). Delivery guy ends up ringing ALL of the doorbells disturbing my neighbors. Very upsetting. 

We ordered chicken tikka masala, saag paneer, garlic naan, cheese naan, and samosas. Food was average and very oily. Definitely not worth the wait or having had my neighbors bothered. Very disappointed with them!
author: Ana C.

description: The place itself has a nice ambience. The food was very delicious and flavorful! I'm not much of a fan of very spicy food, so if you tell them they can adjust the spiciness for you. The staff were friendly and attentive. Overall, a great dinner! Will definitely come back again.
author: Ashlinn L.

description: consistently good food - only order take out from here when my husband goes out with his buddies (he doesn't like Indian food). I am never disappointed in Star India - their Tikka Masala is always delicious and the curry (medium) has the perfect amount of heat for my tastes!
author: Denise S.

description:
I was craving Indian food, so I got my friends to drive out to SF to try the all you can eat buffet.  As soon as you walk up to the restaurant, you get a whiff of the spices from the restaurant.  The AYCE lunch and dinner buffet are $9.99.

Their website says they have a wide selection of dishes from a 25 course buffet, but I only saw about 9 main dishes plus rice, salad, soup, naan, dessert and tea.  

Be careful not to pile too much food on your plate.  They have signs saying they'll charge you for wasted food.  I just got a little bit to start out with to see what I liked.  The food was only warm.  And the naan was room temperature.  I liked the chicken tikka masala sauce and spinach paneer and mostly ate that with rice and naan.  Everything else was just ok.

They just need to work on keeping their food hot, and then it would be much better.
author: Patra I.

description: I just ordered take out from this place and it is the worst Indian food I have ever had! I ordered the tikka masala and it was inedible. The sauce was really really thin.. It was so thin it was like water?! It was almost comical how watery it was. I ordered it mild but it was really spicy and what little flavor it did have was awful.  If I didn't live all the way out at the beach and just get done working a 12hr shift I would have turned around and have taken it back to at least get my $20 back. After this horrible experience I am sure they must have changed ownership in the last few years. I ate here a few years ago and it was great but this was shockingly bad.
author: liz B.

description:
Had the buffet. It was decent. Service was good. The food itself was fine but uninspiring - there's no dish here that will make you say "wow."

If all you want is some decent Indian chow, this is your spot.

I would give it three stars, but the prompt courteous service gets an extra star.
author: T.J. K.

description: We had Mani as our waiter.  He was really friendly and attentive.  Kid friendly!  Kids were on an ice cream craving so Jeet to the rescue with a separate serving of mango ice cream.  Good food, great service and value.  Thanks!
author: Jeni C.

description:
I wish they would up their game. 

For instance, the Vegi Korma used to have potatoes and mushrooms and was fresh. Now, it is a mush.  They once offered Indian Pizza on the buffet but not any longer. 

I wish they'd keep the Tikka Masala and change up the other dishes and add more. I don't see many people opting for the salad bar portion and it seems a waste of space and options. 

On a recent visit, I did observe the older delivery guy scooping up and eating the chicken pakora and pocketing a few to eat later. Gross. 

The people seems very nice and friendly but I am coming for the food and options.
author: James D.

description:
I am glad that the owner of Star India reads their Yelp reviews, however, the fact that he is bringing up my concerns at his next staff meeting does not change the fact that they need a better cook.  I mean, seriously, there wasn't one edible dish out of about six that I tried from their buffet, last time I was there...except the Naan and Pappadum were edible (which they don't make themselves, probably!)...

If the owners were smart, they would go to the old owners, and ask them to share their recipes (and also, their warm and welcoming attitude - it was always fun to go in when the old owner was there because he would ask how we were doing, and seemed genuinely interested in us as people, not just interested in our money).  Also, it was always the same owner, and he was always there, and he always took time out to make us feel welcome.  And, it was obviously a family establishment.

Now, they just have waitresses.  I've never seen the same waitress twice.  They don't know who I am, they are probably working for minimum wage, and have no interest in me personally.  They are adequate, not friendly, no smiles, just doing their job.

So, now that I analyze it, I realize it is not only the awful food that disappointed me, it's also a great decrease in customer service and general ambience that makes me not think favorably about this establishment any more.

Seriously, Star India owner - go to the old owner.  Pump his brain.  Figure out what he was doing that you are not, and please, get yourselves a decent cook.  I mean, how do you feel about the food you are eating?  If you went to the old owner's new restaurant, and did a taste test I'm sure you would see the difference between their food and what you are serving.

No, I will not be trying Star India again.   I've already tried 3-4 times and been disappointed every time.  That's a lot of wasted money (their buffet price is very high, and I have seen it go up and up and up over the years, with no greater value for my money).

I'm looking for a new Indian Restaurant in SF, I'm sorry!
author: Tara T.

description: Used eat24 for delivery. Food was damn fine, got here quickly, and price super reasonable for the qualify of the food.
author: Adam G.

description: Food was good but I came in with a Restaurant.com certificate and so we couldn't use it on the buffet. We ordered 2 dishes. The waiter asked if I wanted rice or bread so we got 1 rice and 1 bread. Come to find out, neither came with the entrees and they charged us for them. Doesn't the dishes come with rice normally. The waiter barely spoke English as he could not even get our order right. I feel like because I had that coupon, they wanted to charge for everything even if it normally comes with it. Definitely will not be coming back here.
author: Edna S.

description:
My gf convinced me to drive all the way to Star India from the Marina district, but it was well worth it... 

The food was great. The restaurant is very clean, and the staff is friendly. The price was very good as well.

The naan is served by order and it is fresh and yummy every time.
The only draw back was that I was so looking forward to tasting palak paneer, but it wasn't what I expected. It was on the sour side... just tasted little off.

The rest of the dishes were delish!!
I will be eating there again.
author: Iva L.

description:
My overall rating for this place is 3.5 stars.

After walking by another Indian place in J-town with the initial "D" that was charging $15 for a plate of Chana masala chickpea curry (that's a la carte with NO rice), I decided to opt for my plan B which was to hop on the Geary and go to the Avenues where Star India is.

I wouldn't call this place a destination restaurant like Indian joints I've frequented in Berkeley and the T-loin, but it is a reliable mom-and-pop Indian neighborhood restaurant.

As other YELPers have noted, it appears there's been a management change -- they do seem friendlier.  I didn't have an overcharge problem though because I only went for the 9.99 dinner buffet.

I do like the lentil dahl soup they offer -- the thickness is just right and it is on the slightly spicy side.  I prefer it here to other places which serve a literally watered down version.

The curries offered at Star India were equally divided along vegetarian and meat choices.  It also seems they vary according to the season which makes sense.  The last nite I went, they had cabbage curry, chef's curry (peas and potato), a 2nd chef's curry (vegetarian kidney beans), spinach saag with indian cheese, vegetarian korma curry, chicken masala curry, lamb curry and lamb keema (ground lamb) curry.  There was also chicken tandoori.  If I'd gone during the summer, I'm sure the veggie curries would have been slightly different.

They don't use a lot of cream and yogurt in the curries offered in the buffet, which I do appreciate (exceptions being chicken tikka masala and any kind of korma curry which require dairy, but even those aren't too heavy).

I'm not a big fan of pakora fritters in general, but at least they were in chickpea batter so I could still enjoy them (I eat GF). Another gluten-free item I loaded up on was the papadum lentil crackers with cilantro yogurt chutney - YUM!  I couldn't eat the naan b/c of my wheat allergies, but I did notice that everyone who got the buffet meal were treated to freshly baked naan to order. The basmati rice was well-prepared and not mushy like some other places.  I'm trying to keep my carbs down so being able to control the amount of rice via buffet is helpful.

All in all, a good deal for 9.99 when considering my other options for the evening. I'll definitely be coming back again for another cheap, hole-in-the wall, but home-style buffet meal.
author: Bodhi D.

description: Always yummy lots of veggie dishes, checked in and got delicious free mango ice cream! We come here all the time
author: Deb R.

description: Buffet looks decent, but no key dishes (no tandoori, lamb, etc) was included. We ordered from the menu, I thought it was ok but I would not repeatthe saag paneer. Prices were higher than usual but that is because it is full-service vs. the usual "order and pay up front, bus your own table" Indian joints. I would not come back unless I was starving for $11 buffet!
author: Natasha F.

description:
This review is for their buffet. 

Selection was small and I didn't find anything that I liked. 
Tikka Masala- has the creamy consistency that I like, but lacking a lot of flavor and spices.
Don't even bother trying the tandoori chicken....worst ever. DRY and no flavor AT ALL.
author: Jenn T.

description: Best Indian food in San Francisco!! Great dishes and the food is delicious! You must eat here (: I'm a student coming here all the time. The chicken masala and the Vegi pakora are amazing!! Also, the price is reasonable, and the people are nice (:
author: Inbar V.

description:
I went there for their lunch buffet 5 years ago and thought wow it's a really good deal for $9.99.  Went back for dinner and thought, wow it's really cheap, it's still $9.99.  

And to my amazement the food is still good, and it's still only 10 bucks for dinner 5 years later.  I love this place.  The food quality is above average, good service.  Warm naan bread to your table even with the buffet.  Free Chai tea, and their Mango ice cream is AMAZING.  It's homemade and INCREDIBLE.  Right now it's free with Yelp check in.  But even if it wasn't I'd pay for it in a heartbeat.
author: Johnny J.

description: Terrible food, but we were so hungry we ate anyhow.  We ordered Chicken Tikka, Tandoori Combo, Kabuli naan and plain naan.  Chicken sucked and so did the Kabuli naan... don't bother with both.  Staff was nice an courteous and there was a little bit of fun music...but the food is the reason why ppl go and it failed us.  Sorry.
author: Tesh S.

description: Excellent food and service. My friends really liked the buffet and I liked the paneer tikka masala very much.  The staff was very friendly and made sure we never ran out of water or naan. The paneer was a little on the spicy side but definately good and the prices were reasonable.
author: Heidi D.

description: Food is good, as always.  BUT... First, they would not honor a restaurant.com voucher. Granted, the voucher was 2 years old, but it does explicitly say that it never expires. Second, it took forever to bring the food, and several groups were served who came in after us, before we got our food. Third, we ordered one dish mild, so our toddler could eat, and it was not mild at all.
author: Dan B.

description: We've been coming here since 2005 when we moved to SF. Star, as we call it, is simply excellent- by far the Indian restaurant we've been to the most of the city...think we've been here hundreds of times. They've got an great buffet with lots of choices (veg and non-veg) and the cost is very reasonable. The employees are always super friendly (including the owner who is super nice) - unlike other Indian restaurants who may try to nickel and dime you - and the restaurant will play some good tunes you'll probably Shazam while you give yourself food coma. My caves: chicken tikka masala, veg korma, garlic naan, keer... well I could go on and on because most stuff is really good. And there are good, clean bathrooms (an absolute necessity for a restaurant with a good Indian buffet). Can't say a bad word about Star - very highly recommend this spot.
author: Rick P.

description:
People here are very attentive, the place was very nicely decorated with an Indian-Pakistani theme obviously and they set the mood with some candles and Indian music.

After each customer the tables were not just wiped but sprayed probably with some disinfectant and then wiped, which was reassuring that at least the exterior was clean, I'm not sure about the inside.

Food wise we had the buffet which for $9.99 was pretty decent. I had a bit of everything. They all have weird names so idk but over all everything was very tasty especially their chicken tika masala which was better tasting than other places I've tried. They replaced our Na'an which was included in the buffet which was good.

Three stars only because I was burping Indian food the whole night! LOL give it a try and you be the judge!
author: Oriel F.

description: The staff at this restaurant is extremely nice and friendly. And the dinner buffet had so many vegetarian options for an Indian restaurant. Having a dinner buffet to begin with is great, and then 5 vegetarian dishes in it is even better.
author: Rishi A.

description: We come here once in a while when we crave for curry. $10.99 per person for buffet isn't a bad deal at all considering we get chai tea and all the curry we usually get at other Indian restaurants.
author: Lorraine T.

description:
I live in the area, but never stopped by even though it has been here as long as I can remember. Fortunately, when a friend with a taste for Indian food stopped by to visit, I remembered this place.

Overall, the food and the service were both top notch. I will admit, I do not usually eat Indian cuisine (mostly only when I'm visiting friends at UC Berkeley), but everything tastes great to me.

To me the price was good, especially if you come for the buffet while hungry. A clean restaurant, cheerful decor, and attentive staff. The buffet area looks small, but they actually have a good amount of variety, and it remains well-stocked. I assume by putting out smaller portions, there is less chance you get food that has been sitting around for a while, which is a potential issues for buffets in general.
author: Jonathan L.

description: I didn't know Indian food could get so bad. The mango lassi tastes extremely artificial and the lamb biryani was dry and chewy with rice and cilantro, so weird
author: Julie H.

description:
Really loved the food at this place. Though located in a rather quaint place the quality and taste of the food more than makes up for the setting. Pakoras, Saag, Mutton curry and the Butter Chicken made an instant connection with my palate. 
The steward seemed very attentive to customers needs and was customer friendly. Great bang for your buck....
author: Kris P.

description:
WHAT HAPPENED?  HOW COULD YOUR FOOD GO FROM TOPS TO NEAR BOTTOM?
I ordered from eat24 yesterday.  I ordered the Vegetarian Dinner for 2, which includes Vegetable pakora, nan, sag paneer, channa masala, raita, rice.  Here goes:
Vegetable pakora - Fritters coated in garbanzo: onion, cauliflower, potato, spinach.  What I got was NO cauliflower, NO onion, a couple of spinach and WAY TOO MANY potatoes. It sure wasn't what I was used to getting from Star India.
Sag Paneer was scorched.  It had that horrible taste that it had burned and they served it anyway.
Channa Marsala was not up to par
Nan was about the only item that tasted as it should.

What a shame that was once a pretty good Indian option has gone downhill.  I have been ordering from this restaurant for years. Remember the Val-Pak coupons?  I won't be ordering again as it just isn't worth it.  And, honestly, their heavy use of salt does nothing but bring out the worse in the taste.  Too Bad.  I would not recommend, no matter how good a deal you feel they are.
author: Catania G.

description:
Updated and up-rated. The quality of the buffet has been consistently high in recent months, though I'm still confused why they do not offer more (or often, any) bean/lentil dishes. 

The lamb (both curried on the bone and ground) and the sag paneer are both standouts on regular offer.

The chai still sucks, however.

Price is also up to 10.99 for the buffet, but it's a solid value at the price.
author: r g.

description: Decent buffet (with chai tea included!) and friendly, attentive service.
author: Alyce K.

description:
This restaurant is not expensive, but their food is only average at best.  I've had lots of Indian food, and I would rate this restaurant in the 20-30th percentile.  It's fine for paying $10 for a dinner buffet, they had soup and lamb curry and chicken tiki masala.

Their lamb was not good, very bony.  If you're looking for great Indian food, this is not your place.  If you're looking for something that's quick, fast and cheap, come here.  Don't get me wrong - I like all Indian food, so this place was very good.  It's just not good compared to other Indian food.

The restaurant is located in a great area with lots of other restaurants.  I'll have to try the all-you-can-eat shabu shabu next time ;)
author: Stephen W.

description: 5 stars! 5 stars! 5 stars! This is the best Indian food that I've had in years! I tried the buffet so I can try out the different options, and oh boy! The food was well seasoned and delicious. The owners were really nice, and gave me a drink on the house. I would definitely recommend this place if you're looking for real good authentic indian food. I will definitely be back.
author: Miss M.

description: these guys really stepped up their game. The selecting is of food in the buffet might not seem like a ton but it's all the good stuff that people know and love. If you are craving some good Indian food and don't want to break the bank these guys are great. p.s my stomach pain after :)
author: Sr. Misha T.

description: Good Indian buffet for the money, nice atmosphere, a little on the mild side though if you're a fan of spicy food.
author: Maxim L.

description: I stop by here once a month to fill my stomach with great flavors for less then $15. All day long bufet or fresh made to order food. They are in a very convenient location and the staff is always nice. Very good value for your money.
author: Norbert H.

description:
After my last review, my husband and I went months without ordering from Star India.  We tried Indian all over the city, trying to find a meat samosa and keema naan that we liked as much as Star India's.  Finally, on my husband's birthday, I decided to order it again and pick it up versus having them deliver - just to see if that helped.

My friends, Star India is BACK!  It was like seeing an old friend.  We devoured our meal and have since ordered (delivery) from them a few times.  (We clearly eat a lot of Indian food)  I am so glad I gave them another shot and it really feels as though they have upgraded their quality and delivery time.  We are psyched!
author: Lindsay G.

description:
Review of Buffet only:

When I moved to SF I tried all the Indian Buffets in the Richmond/Sunset and I've been eating at Star India for the last 17 years. 

Their buffet food is very consistent, and hasn't changed much over the years.  They don't have the largest selection but what they have is very good.

They will bring you fresh naan now which is nice, and you can ask for more if you finish the basket. 

My Chinese mother-in-law ... 90 years old ... LOVES the Tandoori Chicken Legs, and we take her every month or so!   When we know we're going all she does it talk about eating chicken legs all week long (lol) ... we usually go on Saturdays for lunch and there is almost always street parking in front. 

The staff is always very friendly.    

(Tip - If you're going with a group of more than 4 you should make a reservation.)

Update to add Pizza review = YUMMYLICIOUS - it's like eating Indian Food on pizza. Also, the pizza itself was well constructed - I'm from Chicago and a poorly made pizza would be a turn off.  

20$ for a large is a good price compared to say North Beach or even most pizza places in the city which I think are too high for thin crust pizzas.
author: A D.

description: I love Star India.  It doesn't have mind-blowing Indian food, but then again, I've never had mind-blowing Indian food.  What they do have is a homey, friendly local hangout sort of vibe, and their buffet is cheap and full and has stuff for the veg and the carnivore (my wife).  Staff is always welcoming and low-key, and the decor brings me back to florid days in the mother country itself.  We always take our funkier friends there when they are in town.
author: Lynn C.

description: This is my second review n mesmerizingly review for same restaurant. How does these guys maintain same taste every time. I wait everytime to just see whether they get flactuated but never. As usual ordered for a delivery and bang on time. This time I tried different on  advice of the delivery guy, 1)Mulligawtani soup, 4 Lamb pcs, Mixed Tandoori, Fish Vindaloo, Rice n 4 nans for three of us. All were ordered spicy. And everything tasted good, the spice was exactly what we were asking for. Fish pieces were tasty and special mention for mixed tandoori(chicken, lamb, prawns) was awesome. It was first time for my friend who came from New York n he was shocked to know that there were indian restaurants with such good taste in SFO. I would recommend this restaurant to any one who just landed in sf n want to have authentic Indian food.
author: Abhishek N.

description: Went to this place with some friends and had the all u can eat buffet. The curried chicken and lamb was decent but there were not that many other options. I wish they could have had more choices but overall was pretty good. Service was great as well and had a positive experience.
author: Ryan R.

description: The people who works there are awesome, interesting, food is great, the chiken tikka masala my fave, eeverything there feels like family.
author: Elisa A.

description:
This place is okay. 

Maybe I'm spoiled by higher end Indian restaurants in the South Bay, but this place was not bad. It's a highly decent place, and it satisfied my craving really nicely. 

Basmati rice seemed a little on the oily side, but it still tasted really good. Actually, it may not have been oily at all, but it just looked... wetter than usual. I had chicken tikka masala and some other meat curry and the ground lamb. The meat dish was full of bones... It was really tasty, but just inconvenient to eat. Ground lamb was... Interesting. I honestly didn't know what to expect of it, but I was highly intrigued. I felt like I was eating an Indian version of a sloppy joe. Maybe I should've sandwiched it between the naan bread and ate it like a sloppy joe naanwich. Pretty good stuff. 

Chicken in the tikka masala was cut in huge chunks! A little bit dry, but easily fixed if you break it down into smaller pieces and soak them in the sauce. I admit, I really enjoyed the tikka masala. Mixed in with some of the yummy raita, and yum all around. 

Naan was a little different from how I'm used to. It's a little more crunchy on the outside, and chewy on the inside. I'm more used to it being on the fatter, chewier side of things, but it was still good. Just... different. I can hang with that. I can deal with change.

Customer service is excellent. Felt very comfortable and welcomed. If I craved Indian and was in the area, I wouldn't feel bad about coming here, although I probably will explore some more. I won't forget this place though!

Overall, the food is really, really decent and the price is really good, especially since SF tends to be more expensive when it comes to restaurant eats anyways. Obviously, if you're snobby about your Indian food, this ain't the place, but if you're looking for a cheapish, fast bite of Indian, you could do worse than this place. 

Oh. I also liked their kheer, and I was super surprised that I like gulab jamun after all. I didn't use to like it until I came here. I'll be giving that dessert another chance now. 

I left really happy.
author: Hayne P.

description: Best Indian buffet in San Francisco! I love this place!
author: Sammy E.

description:
GOOD:  Food here was excellent, price very competitive for the neighborhood, and a nice glass of wine very reasonable $.  

NOT SO GOOD/BAD:  Ummm...how do I put this nicely...I had no desire to touch the table, the place in general doesn't feel clean.  Service is...interesting.  I didn't feel all that welcome, but the food was so tasty, I didn't really care much...this is not a warm and fuzzy resto; I'd have been ok with the service if it had been just more clean in general.  It wouldn't take much to make this place FANTASTIC.
author: Kate P.

description: Yum yum yum! I've been coming here for years and it's been consistently good. The staff is always pleasant and cheerful. There's a large selection to chose from the buffet. Or sometimes I'll sit down and order from the menu. Either one is awesome. I would highly recommend this place. It won't disappoint. :)
author: N K.

description:
I was really looking forward to a spicy indian meal.  Instead, the food was bland and definitely not as flavorful as other Indian restaurants I've ordered from.

I ordered through delivery.com and remembered enjoying the smells coming from this restaurant whenever I walked by with my dog.  

I ordered Saag Panner, Garlic Naan, Saffron Rice, Papadum and Kheer.  The papadum was delicious and the kheer cool and refreshing.  The rice, naan and saag paneer were a little on the bland side.

I would still give this place another shot.  I'd like to try the meat curries next time - I think I will really enjoy those entrees instead.
author: Carmel U.

description:
Gone there for the buffet dinner scores of times.  The chicken is soft and succulent (and its korma sauce tasty), rice and nan cooked perfectly, and the veggie dishes delicious.  I always leave there stuffed and satisfied.  And I've had many great conversations there, it's a great place for me to meet friends.

As often as I frequent the place, I can't give it that final fifth star, though, cuz the space is a little on the dirty side, and some of the dishes are a bit "off" (overly dry pakoras, sharp bones in the lamb stew, etc).
author: Adam C.

description:
The first time I had Indian food was here. I got the buffet, but I didn't like it very much. That was a few years ago, but since then, I have tried other places and found dishes that appeal to my taste buds. 

Recently, after work I was craving for Indian food, but the only place I could think of in walking distance was here. I got the chicken tikka masala to-go and although it is a bit more pricey then what I normally spend on this dish, I had to give into my craving. 

They asked if I wanted rice with it, but I said no since I was going to make some at home. Almost at the end of my wait, they told me they'd give it to me for free. How very nice of them.

I thought the dish was good. Mmm, just the way I like the sauce.

I think I'll give the buffet another shot since I'll know what dishes I like.
author: Mandy D.

description: This is my go to for Indian delivery and has been for years. The curry shrimp alone is worth ordering or going here.
author: Mark R.

description: Good Indian food for a great price. I like this buffet because they have a few dishes you can not find in other Indian buffets. The price is excellent and the atmosphere nice. And parking is not usually a problem.
author: Larry H.

description:
Can't believe the price for what you get. 

Entrees were on the high end: 12 dollars each. When they arrived, it was about 6 pieces of chicken nugget sized lamb in a tub of sauce. Naan is extra. 

The delivery was fast and friendly, but for 30 dollars, the what you get is pitiful.
author: Jay C.

description:
I got home late from the airport and their menu was hanging on my door knob. The minimum for delivery said $12 but they meant $15. 
I tried the bhindi masala (okra) and veggie somosa. Both were flavorful but not really spicy. Some of the okra where tough. In fact my first bite was into a really fibrous piece however I powered through and most of it was tender and tasty.  
I'm not sold on it as my fave local spot but if in a pinch (need late night delivery), I might consider trying something else from this restaurant.
author: Rakela W.

description:
The bf and I came here this past Saturday night. Parking was a bit hard to find but wasn't too bad. You walk in and the decor is nice and looks really clean, especially for an indian restaurant that features a buffet. I had purchased a living social deal for $10 worth $20 dollars of food. So I was excited to use it. It was pretty small but certainly no line. It was pretty packed by the time we got our food so that was a sure good sign. 

It took about a minute for us to be greeted, host stand was all the way in the back with the cashier. We didn't know if we were suppose to sit so we just stood and waited. I guess there are tables just for those who eat the buffet and for those who sit down and order. Those that sat down and ordered seemed to be only able to sit in the way front of the restaurant. 

The wait staff was very nice and I had presented them my coupon deal. We had already looked online at the menu so it didn't take very long for us to decide. We had ordered the garlic naan, chicken tikka masala and chicken vindaloo and an order of rice, but the waitress told us to try the garlic chicken which wasn't on the menu. She said it was better than the vindaloo so we sure why not. 

The chicken tikka masala was the best I've had. The chicken was tender and the sauce and my garlic naan. I was in heaven. 

The garlic chicken in the curry sauce was good, chicken was a bit dry. The bf liked it more than me since it was a bit too spicy for my liking. 

It took awhile for us to get the check and even for the check to be picked up. It was a different server who gave us the check and forgot to take the discount off. But it was okay. 

I'm happy with my experience and next time will try the buffet. And if we ever move to SF, totally getting them to deliver to my place! Score on that.
author: Angela D.

description: Orange Chicken Curry, White Rice & Gulab. Recommendation to try it Out. Location, Address is 3721 Geary Ave. @2nd Avenue San Francisco, CA.
author: Pink R.

description:
Worst dish I have ever hadin my entire life!

I made the biggest mistake by going to this restaurant and ordering Spicy Vegetable Jalfraze (It does not look like the image they show in their menu). My dish was watery, full of red color that I could taste more than anything else and bland. 

I will highly recommend not going to this restaurant.
author: Neha B.

description:
Do Not Order Delivery From Here.

Ordered a delivery and the estimated wait time was 70 min. The food did not show up until almost 2 hours later! Was very hungry at the time and pretty bothered about the food taking almost 50 min longer than estimated. 

Aside from the service aspect, the food was actually pretty good. Comparable to other Indian Restuarants in the area, but their Butter Chicken was better than most.
author: Michael M.

description: Not bad for my first experience with Indian food. The price for the buffet is $10.99. My favorites were the chicken tikka masala and the sag paneer. The lamb curries we pretty spicy for my taste but I did enjoy them. Thumbs up for the naan. I would like to go back.
author: LaShea R.

description: Food is ok but Very bad customer service! DID NOT honor restaurant.com coupon for Pickup orders (there isn't anything on the coupon that states that it's not applicable to pickup orders).
author: Lan T.

description: Great buffet we loved the meat. They gave us Nan as we requested. Thank s for your service !
author: Mohamed A.

description:
I've come here so many times for the dinner buffet. I love and hate that they have a buffet at dinnertime ... I love being able to try a lot of different things, but hate how stuffed and gross I feel after I leave -- I just can't help myself!

When I lived within walking distance, I used to come here way too often. Now, it's a much more occasional treat, which is probably beneficial to my waistline.

They always have some really good vegetarian options, and their veggie korma, chana masala and saag are pretty consistently delicious. They generally have a nice selection of garlic and plain naan, samosas, pakoras and pappadums with chutneys. They also have complimentary chai tea, as well as kheer and really good gulab jamun for dessert.

I oftentimes wish I still lived closer to a good Indian buffet ... but it's probably best for me to have a little bit of distance from these establishments. Way too much temptation.
author: Jamie T.

description: Ordered delivery on livingsocial and it was over 30 mins late (total time 1 hour 45 mins) and cold. But I ate it and it wasn't completely gross so there you have it. 2 starz.
author: Aaron H.

description: My first time trying Indian food and I LOVED IT. As hesitant as I was with all the spices and mixtures, I am so glad I gave Indian food a try. This place is great. 5 stars to the service and food.
author: Linnea H.

description:
I HATED the other Star of India on Polk, so I was weary to try this place. But, I just escaped from rehearsal across the street and was starving, so I gave it a go. I was SHOCKED. These aren't the same owners. This is the highest quality buffet in the city and the prices are better than Round Table Pizza. Everything was tasty (chicken, veggies, lentil soup), well spiced, great variety in the buffet and lunch prices. The chai needed work. The guy at the checkout was very proud of his food, which he buys fresh 3 x's a week. There is nothing that makes me happier than a prideful South Asian food entrepreneur. 

Note: the guy told me that people close to the other Star of India purposely order delivery from the one in the Richmond.
author: Andrew K.

description:
3.5 stars.

Another movie night marathon with my bff. Make that a 2 NIGHT marathon! haha. 

We ordered:
2 Nan's, one garlic one regular. Not the best I've had but not the worst. C+
One Chicken Tikka Masala. Again, not the best, but it sufficed. B-
Aloo Gobi was perfection. A+
Basmati Rice was aromatic and still good the next day. A+
Online ordering was a snap and delivery was FAST! A+

8 movies later, I feel accomplished. I rarely get to indulge in girly movies let alone 2 DAYS straight FULL of silly, romantical love inspiring fantasies.

We had left overs for lunch the next day and didn't have to leave the house except for a quick mani/pedi across the street! :P
author: Lily M.

description:
4 stars...
1 for their gulab ball thingies
1 for rice pudding
1 for the chicken tikka masala
1 for the veggie curry (i forget the name, sorry)

Really, though, this place is darn good when you want a buffet of very good food at a pretty decent price. If you like Indian food, I would recommend coming here. Don't limit yourself to just what I gave my 4 stars to cuz their naan is good, and their lamb curry, and their chai tea, and their samosas.. wow, look at me I can really keep going.

Basically, for a pretty small place the variety is not bad. And you still don't feel bad because, again, it's cheap! The only time you might feel bad is when your stomach isn't all too happy with the food :X

Once a couple of my friends were trying to out-eat each other at Star India. Talk about barely being able to walk, let alone breathe afterward. I believe right after that we stuffed 5 people into a mustang... that was a mighty uncomfortable ride home.

PS - I've only come for the buffet! Never ordered off the menu or for take out
author: Danielle G.

description: We thought it was outstanding. Our meal was very fresh and the tastes/spices were just right.
author: Andy T.

description: I hate to write this because the food here is actually really good, it just sucks when a place has bad service.
author: Shawn S.

description: I have been going to this establishment for four years, and I have to say I'm digging the new management/ownership. The buffet has always been great, usually start out with some spicy dhali soup and salad then move on to the chicken tandori and various curries, and for dessert I can't go wrong with rice pudding and those delectable sweet bread  covered in syrup. Overall I give this place four stars, good food, good service and much improved atmosphere compared to the old management. If you're hungry then the buffet is definitely the way to go.
author: Jeric M.

description:
I like this place alot.  Their buffet is great and worth every penny.  Make sure to go through salad, dal, main course, and desert.  It's all there.

I think the only thing they could do is make one different dish every week.  That will keep your creative juices flowing.  I have the impression that the dishes kind of stay the same here.

I come here to experience so titillate me.  I want to try something unusual. You have mastered the classics.  Now, show me something new.  Indian food has so much potential.  It is like painting with 100 colors at hand.

You are great.  Keep innovating and experimenting.  

Joseph
author: Joseph M.

description:
3.5 stars
They have a relatively limited lunch buffet selection, but what they have tastes good to me at a good price! The lady hostess was also very nice and courteous, and the free mango ice cream (with yelp check-in) was delicious. It's close to where I live, so I'd come back again for convenience and location, although I prefer more variety in the buffet.
author: Angela W.

description:
After talking to the part-owner of Star India I can't rate them any lower then 5 stars!

Yelp really should take all the reviews from past 5 months ago off because that's when ownership changed. The food is better, the service is amazing, and they really want you to leave happy.

And an even bigger plus he left me take a box of the buffet food home to my boyfriend!

Seriously GO HERE!
author: Lisa H.

description:
I love this place!!! The staff is marvelous, super friendly and super helpful. This place is amazing because it has LUNCH & DINNER  BUFFET for $9.99. This is as good as it gets in SF. 

PROS: 
tika masala
nann
balsamic rice 
coconut chicken curry 

CONS: NONE

Don't forget to say hi to the wonderful staff.
author: Amanda C.

description: I did not havea good experience last nt at Star India. I ordered Dal for $3 and I got Dal or $8 and it was awful and fire hot.
author: Judy G.

description: Great food, we changed our mind last minute and grabbed our food to go and they were super accommodating... Naan is amazing, as is the mixed platter. Super friendly wait staff.
author: Lara B.

description:
Awesome Place!

Its located on Geary and Arguello.

$10 per person eat all you can! Open for lunch and dinner.

The food is awesome and they have a ton of selection. The desserts are very good as well. They also refill the buckets quickly so everything is full at all times. The staff is very accomodating and does not live on tips. 

I will be going here weekly now.
author: K C.

description: I've been looking for a good Indian place in the Bay Area for a couple of years, and this one is by far my fav. The food is delicious, the atmosphere is nice, and the staff is friendly. My only complaint is that I wish they served bhindi masala. Love this place!
author: Jessica G.

description:
While Indian buffet wouldn't have been my first choice for a Saturday night on the town, I was pleasantly surprised by the entire experience.  And only $8.99 for dinner- we were all completely stunned at how cheap it was!    

I should preface this by saying that I spent three long years working in the suburban hell that is Fremont.  Am I exaggerating?  Uh, not really.  But I won't forget the fabulous Indian food galore- and this restaurant definitely brought back the love.

Just some of what the buffet serves:

naan
papadum
samosas
pakora
daal soup
chicken tikka masala
tandoori chicken
saag paneer
chicken, lamb, and vegetarian curries
gulab jamun (aka the sweet balls)
rice pudding
surprisingly good chai tea  

A huge array of condiments like raita, peach chutney, tamarind chutney, mint/cilantro sauce.   These totally made the meal.

Just thinking about this food makes me want more, more, more.  Buffets are dangerous.  

Seriously, Star Indian is a billion times better than Naan and Curry, and unlike the latter, the employees are incredibly friendly too.
author: Joanne G.

description: This place came highly recommeded by locals, and was not dissapointed.  The buffet was great and the naan was hot and fresh.  Perfect for vegitarians.  However, nice selection of chicken and lamb.  Will go back again.
author: Peter G.

description:
Everything was just bad. The mango lassi tasted full of artificial flavoring. Lamb karahi was neon red (food color so nasty my fingers are red), lamb was over cooked, curry was watery and lacked flavor all I could taste was salt and under cooked ginger. The  mashed potato stuffed paratha was absolutely awful, first of all its not a paratha secondly it was not stuffed. The naan lacked flavor and was super chewy. The samosas were old and the kulfi was just downright absolutely  nasty.

Please do yourself a favour please dont eat here.
author: Anurag N.

description:
Went again for the dinner buffet. Service was excellent as usual. 

Really friendly atmosphere, people who eat here are nice and friendly and every time you make eye contact with them, they'll greet you with a smile. The table behind us was doing magic tricks and we got a free show!

YELPERS!! They're not kidding about the discount for yelpers!! They came over and thanked us for reviewing them on yelp and offered us a discount! It's really nice to know that they take their customers' comments into account and try to make our eat-out experience more enjoyable :)
author: Erica L.

description: Did a to-go on their dinner spread. Food quality was average, and there was a 10-minute wait to get my naan. Ambience & overall cleanliness seemed average. Nothing makes me want to give it another chance (especially with so many options in the area).
author: Abhinav A.

description: i get take out from here all the time, even after i moved to a farther neighborhood away!  still worth it!
author: Paula P.

description:
Oh Star India, you fed me so many days when i was poor and didn't feel like riding the bus somewhere. Literally down the street from my little couch away from home, I came in here at least once a week.

The take out buffet used to be all you could stuff in the box, plus they would give you a container for the desert which i used to just stuff with veggie korma. They started cracking down on that though, and made the take out a little more strict. Too bad, I used to be able to feed at least 3 people with all the food I stuffed in there.

I miss Star India back home in SD, because there is no good Indian food here at all. 

Also I see they have remodeled. Too bad, Ill miss the TITTY paintings on the walls. Nothing better than naked ladies on the walls while you stuff your face full of naan after eating several special cookies... ;-)
author: AL S.

description:
Best Indian food in SF. Period. 

One star for the service. 
Second for the Naan. Mmmmm.
Third for the chicken tikka masala. Oink. 
Forth for the chai.
Fifth because parking is easy in the area.

And if I could give it a sixth star I would... For the fact that they have a man in a samosa suit doing the deliveries.... (welll I lied, but wouldn't that be awesome??!)
author: Priyam S.

description:
I'm always looking for a good deal for good food. 

If you are craving Indian food and don't want to break the bank, this place is great for buffet. You can enjoy multiple meat dishes and vege dishes and they don't taste bland like the place I reviewed at Embarcadero One. 

When I have a mediocre Indian meal downtown, I come to this place to feel happy again. I try not to fill up so much on the food, so I have room for their kheer and fried donuts in honey. :)
author: Faith W.

description:
I liked the staff at this restaurant, but I was unimpressed with the majority of the dishes we ordered (Saag Paneer and Begnan Bhartha - excuse the spelling!). The exception was the chicken tikka masala and the mango lassi, which were both good. 

Since there are so many other excellent choices for the same price in this city, I probably won't go back here.
author: Alyssa A.

description:
Horrible. Pure horrible. Why is this place even around? If I made an Indian restaurant next door, it will out-run this place. What is with the service and food? Geez!

I ordered take out because I live close by. The waiter kept messing up what I was trying to order (Don't you know your own menu?). But I was patient, I assumed it was busy. So I ordered a very simple dish. Even before I could even THANK him or ask for the amount, they hung up! RUDE!

The delivery guy was .. Just WOW. He asked me to meet him in the street because he couldn't find parking. I come out, there is CLEARLY a parking space three houses down. I sit next to my window, so I saw that NO ONE PARKED THERE SINCE MY BOYFRIEND LEFT THAT SPOT 20 MINUTES AGO. I paid enough to cover the food and tipped him 10%. He looked at me as if I didn't pay him enough. I swear he started swearing under his breath or something. 

The food was very cold by the time I got it. It felt like it was caught in the rain and thrown around. It was horrible, I only ate half. I didn't even bother calling the place, I knew they weren't even going to bother with a refund.

I write this to warn people that this place is biased and HORRIBLE. Stay at home and make microwaved Indian food because THIS IS WHAT THIS PLACE SERVES. But at least you don't have to deal with service, you serve yourself.


They also contact you if they see your reviews that are low and offer a sort deal. Fix your review and they'll redeem you. No. Keep your janky food. You have more to lose than me right now. Frickin' Hell.
author: Iris L.

description:
the food is better then ever; finally asked the cashier, if the owner changed.
He said a couple years ago, a new owner came on board.
So,I advised him , now, I  know why the prices went up AND the quality went WAY UP.  $9.99 AYCE is a good deal.
author: Bert K.

description:
All-You-Can-Eat Indian Buffet....EVERYDAY (Sunday through Saturday)

For the price of:  $9.99

Entrees:  Chicken Tikka Masala, lamb korma, veggie and more
Desserts:  Indian tea, donut balls drenched in sugar, rice pudding
Appetizer:  Spicy soup, salad, fried potatoes and more

This restaurant is clean, quiet and service is quite friendly.  It's nice to eat yummy Indian food in the Inner Richmond neighborhood. :)

And...if you want a free show...Look at the walls of the restaurant, especially the paintings of the girls and framed pictures. 

Happy Yelping!
author: Deborah C.

description:
Love their food.  Love the (lunch and dinner) buffet.   Love their take out (and yes with the buffet too.)  Good chai.  

They are always so nice, friendly, good service, and they remember me too.  (Hell, they even tease me for doing take out on the buffet.  There is a long story to go with it, but it's not relevant for this review.)
author: Fannie S.

description:
We've driven by this place numerous times and finally today we ventured in for lunch. Walking in I noted that they weren't crowded and I thought "uh-oh" Also there was this silence in there as well. I don't know about you folks but most Indian restaurants usually have some sort of music blaring. The restaurant decor felt like it was something out of the 70's or early 80's era. 

Anyhow, I digress. So what you really want to know is how was the food right? It was pretty decent for a $10 all-you- can- eat buffet. They had my curry lamb, tiki marsala chicken, mango chutney and that spinach dish with the cubes of cheese. Can't really complain too much since all my favorites are there. Bonus that they had my little fried dough balls in syrup and chai tea. 

I highly recommend the lamb curry; it was really good. A major bummer about the lunch was that the food wasn't that hot temperature wise. Many of the dishes were luke warm. We weren't too happy about that. 

Also for some odd reason I never saw the Tandoori chicken the whole time I was there. Where was the chicken? Only saw a layer of onions and a lemon wedge where the Tandoori chicken should have been. Hmmmmm..... 

The naan was decent. Was thankful that this was at least warm when I bit into it....Overall not too bad, but still thinking that there are other Indian Buffets out there that I might enjoy better.
author: Cris H.

description: I stopped in to order some food to take to my friend's. It's really a hassle to unpack the bag to inspect the food, but I should have because they gave me the wrong food! When I discovered this when we opened the bag at home, it was not worth the trouble to go back even though what they gave me cost less than what I paid for. That aside, what I am guessing was Chicken Tikka Masala was mediocre. The Bengan Bhartha was OK, but each time I ate this food (split over 3 meals), I would be so thirsty afterwards, which makes me think there is lots of MSG in it.
author: MT Y.

description:
Love it! Such a great place with yummy food and friendly staff. Try buffet.Definitely come here for a delicious Indian cuisine. 
Mango ice cream is unbelievable!
author: Tatiana G.

description: For a $10 all-you-can eat buffet, this place is definitely worth its money. Is the food something you'll be raving about for the rest of the night? Definitely not. But every dish was quite edible, and some were even good. The tandoori chicken was the winner on my plate. We also ordered a half-carafe of decent house red wine for $7.50 (enough for 3 full glasses). Hard to complain about that!
author: Scott S.

description:
I recently went here with my bf on an impromptu date night.  We had just gotten out from a movie and were a little hungry.  It was almost 10pm and he was wanting Indian food, so I googled what was still open.  

When we walked in the door it was the start of one of the most awkward dining experiences I have had.   I know it was late, but you would think that there would be a few people out enjoying the night out and stopping in to eat.  There was pretty much one other couple there in the main part of the dining room that was definitely to themselves and whispering to each other. They disappeared like ghosts halfway through the meal,   I think there was a family up behind us but couldn't really tell.  

The staff wasn't rude or mean, but it felt like they didn't really want us there.  Sitting by myself while my date went to the restroom felt more awkward than a horrible set up with someone you cant stand. 

We ordered our food from the menu and got it pretty quickly.  We knew they were closing soon so we tried to eat fast.  Even though the food was pretty good, my bf was scared to eat some of it.  He has lived in India for a decent chunk of his life and he was so freaked out by the bright red cut up chicken legs that he wouldn't even touch them.  He said he'd never see Indian food like that ever.  

All it all it wasn't anything too special and I think I'd probably go somewhere else next time.
author: Robin L.

description:
This is me and my husband's choice for Indian delivery. Surprising that it was one of those rubber banded menus I hate getting on our front door. But this neon green, over sized menu was totally worth it!

Chicken pakora? Delicious. Fried and seasoned to perfection. They give you a VAT of mango lassi. My husband and I usually split one and it fills up 2 pint glasses. A small child could swim in the lassi container.  Food definitely has some kick so grab some raita if you need to cool down your tongue. The deal breaker? They always deliver quicker than their estimation. Last time it was under 30 minutes... KEY.
author: Jamie P.

description:
One of the easiest ways you can earn yourself two stars is being overpriced. I'm happy to pay for your food costs, overhead and of course a reasonable profit, after all, you are cooking so I don't have to. But if I'm feeling gouged, it's one of the few times the malicious yelper in me will come out.

Let's just say I wasn't initially too pleased with my decision to grab takeout from Star India. $12 for what essentially is grilled chicken was excessive, but I was in a rush, had no Plan B, and figured what the heck. Service was minimal at best, felt like a bit of an outcast in a too large with too few people establishment. I clearly had beat the dinner rush.

But, I was too quick to judge. $12 is on the high side, but do know you are getting two meals worth. I couldn't believe how much chicken and veggies were stuff into this tin foil ball of Indian spiced goodness. Half has been consumed on a salad. Other half will make a rocking burrito.

Apologies for jumping to conclusions. One meal in, you are definitely A-OK.
author: Jason B.

description:
I really liked this place. The buffet is 9.99.  Sure, it won't rock your world, and probably you don't need to drive in from Concord to eat here, but if you live in the neighborhood, and you're in the mood, this place is lovely.

I think the secret is that a lot of Indian food is kind of stew-like, and that stuff always tastes better after it's been sitting for a while, and all the flavors can develop.  It's really the ideal food for a buffet.   

I think the buffet is tasty and quick, and pretty inexpensive. 

I really like the fact that there's a sign which says something like, "take all you want, but eat what you take.  Extra charge for wasting."  

Of course, I doubt they do this, but I like the idea of just eating what you can, and I think wasting food is horrible, and so I highly approve.
author: Melinda A.

description:
I can only speak for the buffet here, but this place is tight.

Consistant.  Tasty.  Incredible Value.  Great Service.  Nice.  Cheap.  

I seriously love this place.  I think I'm gonna go tonight actually.
author: Claudia M.

description: Great flavor Indian food!  Good chai and vegetarian options on the buffet!
author: DaKine J.

description: I was missing home-cooked Indian food a little so I came here. It's what you'd expect from an Indian buffet (the food was somewhat cliche but still tasted pretty good). Normally I'd rate it four stars, but for their niceness and good service I'll give it another one!
author: Alan D.

description:
Been here before and had only good things to say. Great service, nice selection in the buffet.

I hadn't been in a while, and got a flyer in the mail for $9.99 dinner buffet. On entering, I saw a sign that said $10.99 dinner buffet. I figured the flyer had a discount, as there were a number of coupons in it. The bill charges $10.99. I ask an employee, and am told they ordered 50,000 flyers. I'm unclear on why I'm being charged more than is printed, and am told that they ordered 50,000 flyers. At best, they don't warn customers before charging them higher prices. At worst, they're intentionally misleading customers.

In any case, I'm not going back any time soon.
author: David K.

description: I just went to Star India to get some take out for lunch. I was really disappointed with the food. I am very surprised that it has gotten good reviews because everything I tried was mediocre at best. I ordered the Chicken Tikka Masala, hoping it would live up to the boasts that this place had the best. I was very let down, it tasted like it had come out of a can or been made from a powder. The Sag Paneer was horrible, it just tasted gross. I could not even eat it. The only thing that was good was the Naan. It helped make the Chicken Tikka sort of palatable. I'm angry because I spent a lot of money for this food and it tasted awful. Really bad. If you have not been to really good Indian restaurants you may not notice, but if you have a discerning tongue then just don't go here.
author: L.A. C.

description: Very good indian food.  I'm told (by friends who know much better than I) that it is real deal.  The family that owns the place is very nice.  Always on our list of places to eat when we don't feel like cooking.
author: Scott L.

description: buffet was affordable. naan was good. lamb curry was good.
author: Tiff C.

description:
Moving cross-country isn't easy, nor is finding a new place to eat.  Fortunately, there is Star India as my savior.  It's great, all the normal tasty tidbits available and the price is awesome.  I've been there three times already, and my tastebuds and tummy are well served.

Thanks for being my new go-to for this new gal in town!
author: Robyn J.

description: Came to the restaurant for the third time and was equally impressed. The food was consistently delicious and reasonably priced. The service is great and the restaurant is clean and inviting.
author: Natalie N.

description: Worst food ever ! Chicken tikka was like rubber and I have never seen an indian restaurant that doesn't know to make a biryani.. by far the worst biryani with rice drenched in masala not even cooked... spoiled our entire day with bad food. When we gave them our review they didn't even bother asking anything. As an indian and who loves food , I would not recommend this restaurant. Even raita was charged extra which was ridiculous .. people were good but food a definite no !
author: Deeshna D.

description: Cannot express enough how terrible their customer service and employees are
author: Ann T.

description:
This is my go-to Indian Delivery restaurant! 

1. You can order online, I LOVE that! No having to yell a food order to someone in a busy restaurant or chance that it will be wrong! 

2. They are usually VERY quick with delivery. I used to live in the inner Richmond and sometimes they'd be to my house within 20 minutes.

3. My typical order is tikka masala with chicken which I LOVE, perfect spiciness (you can pick levels of spiciness when you order online) and perfect amount of food that I end up with 2 meals.

4. The price is a little high (entrees are around $11-12, rice is $1.50 and naan is $1.50) BUT I always end up with 2 meals out of the one (leftovers) SO you could split and entree between two or save some for another meal and with that it ends up being a pretty affordable eating option....

5. Very friendly staff, I've only eaten in the restaurant once but everyone was really nice and the buffet area was clean and well stocked!

6. The only negative I have is that in the last few months I've found that there is less chicken in my tikka masala which bums me out but the flavor of the sauce is so good that I'm happy eating that with my rice and naan!
author: Amber E.

description:
They upped the buffet price to $8.99 and it's still such a good deal.  So what's so great about this buffet besides the awesome price (lunch and dinner)

- Open pretty much all day, you can walk in at 3:30pm and have a great meal
- Always fresh food.  Every dish is available 
- Lamb is tasty and it's even better if you pour the minty sauce on it
- Succulent, syrupy donuts for dessert
- They don't stare at you after your 4th helping!
author: Yvonne Y.

description:
I was pretty apprehensive about going to Star India since its an Indian buffet and wasn't sure if it was a hole in a wall place BUT my BF really liked the restaurant. He kept insisting that i would like the place. Boy, was i wrong about Star India. 

GREAT CHEAP EATS, CLEAN RESTAURANT, GREAT CUSTOMER SERVICE and ALL YOU CAN EAT BUFFET (but how much chicken tikka marsala can one eat?). 

The chicken tikka marsala was cooked well with huge chunks of white meat. I thought the sauce wasn't as powerful and creamy compare to Naan & Curry which is a plus. My favorite was the lamb ground meat = YUM! the naan bread was made perfectly -- not too thick and thin. 

Ill definitely come back here again when i am craving for Indian food.
author: Carol Y.

description:
I love this place!!..they have one of the best indian foods you can find in san francisco. There chicken tikka and lamb keema is amazing. The seating is very comfortable, great place to have lunch or dinner with family or friends. 
The service is excellent, very friendly waiters. They also do buffets for only 9.99$, and the buffet menu offers a lot of variety in foods from meat to vegetarian. Would definitely go back and recommend this place.
author: Monika M.

description:
Smelled the food one day when I was waiting for a friend and was starving for some good  curry. I ended up eventually coming here a month later and getting some curry lamb for dinner. 

I ordered ahead since I was working and only had an hour to pick up the food, head back and eat it. Ordering half an hour ahead, coming 10 later than their estimated time, they still made me wait another 10 mins for my food.

When I got it, food tasted good but it looked like they spoon it out of their buffet table.
author: M C.

description: About as good of service as I've had anywhere.  I didn't get the impression the staff was "trying too hard" either.  It was simply well delivered service.  The food is authentic and delicious.  Priced very well and the serving sizes are not such that you will leave hungry.  I'm not from the Richmond but I will try to be a regular.
author: Obi W.

description:
I like this place but the only problem is with the breads especially Naan which supposedly soft and yogurt based not hard or sometimes so thin crisp and Paratha supposedly velvetly layered with butter not dry.

I sincerey hope they improve the quality of their breads which is staple and hallmark of Indian Food.
author: Ryu K.

description: Nah, compared to other Indian places this is simply crappy place. Food quality and taste is below standard and not even close to good.
author: Yuriy K.

description:
I LOVE this place!!  I have been going to Star India for 5 years now and just found out that they changed ownership a few months ago.  I did not think the place could get any better but it has.  I am normally a person who loves trying new restaurants, but I always come back to this place time and time again.

First, they deliver anywhere in San Francisco!!  Second, it is the best Indian food I have had in the city and the prices are fantastic!!  Third, it actually serves my favorite PIZZA in the city!!

Yes, I said pizza.  Indian Pizza.  They do not have it on the menu in the restaurant, but it is on the take out menu.  They will serve it to you in the restaurant, if you ask.  The chicken tandori pizza is to die for.  They also let me on a little secret that they also serve a Chicken Tikka Masala Pizza that is not on the menu.  I have yet to try it, but I can't wait too!!

I have introduced this pizza and this restaurant to many friends and have yet to have anyone give it less than a 5 star rating.  You have to try Star India!!!  You will be hooked for life.
author: Jennifer M.

description: Ok so i HATE buffets, BUT i LOVE this place, the food in the buffet is actually quality and delicious.  The staff is also extremely friendly and the place has a very welcoming ambiance.  Definatly coming again, highly recomend  ^_^
author: Colzie T.

description:
You just can't beat this deal!  All you can eat Indian food for under 10 bucks!

Disclaimer: I'm no Indian food expert, in fact my venture to Star India was probably the first time I had Indian.

Anyway, there was a good variety of dishes that included lamp and chicken curry, tandoori chicken.  My favorite dish though was the naan.  There were so many different dishes to eat it with!

My biggest complaint was that the food did not look fresh.  It looked as if it were sitting there all day!  The place was empty and appeared drab on the Saturday evening that I went.  Although it WAS raining fairly heavily, so that might have added to the blah atmosphere.
author: Matt S.

description: What other place offers a $10 dinner buffet??  Sure, some dishes are better than others (the vegetarian dishes and chicken tikka masala are all very good, the lamb dishes not so much).  The naan is delicious, they bring it to your table fresh out of the oven instead of letting it get cold at the buffet table.  Good service too.  Great bang for your buck!
author: Beatrice W.

description:
My husband LOVES Indian food and this is his favorite place.  I guess you just can't beat a place that offers you all-you-can-eat buffet for $7.97.  It's puzzling how they can make ends meet with charging only $7.97 for dinner... illegal dealings? hmm...

Anyhow, taste of the food is not bad either.  Their selection is decent with your typical Chicken Tandoori, samosa, Curry, masala, naan, etc.  Waiter always fill up your water.  

If you never had Indian food before and want to try a little bit of everything, and especially don't want to pay an arm and a leg, THIS IS DEFINITELY THE PLACE TO GO.     

I only give this place 3 stars because unlike my husband, I don't like Indian food -- in general.  So I'm biased.
author: Jannie Q.

description:
My delivery order just arrived, and the food is yummy.  I highly recommend getting the saffron rice for about a buck more. It's delightful - golden raisins and cashews!

I also ordered the navratan korma (veggie korma) as it's one of my favorite Indian dishes aside from chicken tikka masala.  Also very good with a wide variety of veggies.

And their mango lassi is yum.

Delivery took a while, almost an hour, but only a little over what I was told on the phone.  It's been faster before.
author: Diana C.

description:
visiting from socal and near where i live there's a city called diamond bar and this city has a significant indian population. due to this there are a number of great indian eateries and i have been spoiled and expect better indian food. aloo gobi is my favorite indian dish and star india ruined it for me it was very bland, i think they may have forgotten to add any spice whatsoever. the chicken masala was somewhat tough although the sauce was standard, the tandori chicken was ok but the onions that accompanied it where not and the naan was gross. the worst item from the all-you-can-eat buffet was the soup, it was completely offensive. soup should not be that watery. the one good dish they had was good was the lamb curry. i usually don't care for lamb curry but they definitely did it right. although i wasn't a big fan of the ground lamb, it was still nice to try something new. 

my last complaint has to be about the staff, not friendly at all, they were even somewhat rude. i told my friends i'm visiting to do themselves a favor and eat there. it's san fran, there has to be better indian restaurants.
author: Michael G.

description:
First off, great price per person: $9.99!  Secondly their chicken tikka masala and naan was to die for.. that's the only thing I ate was that and their rice.  I wish it was more spicy but I understand since it's a buffet and it has to cater to every diner that might eat that.. it must be mild but it was so tasty nonethless!  

Service was good and quick.. we kept having to refill the water.  Nice, small, and intimate restaurant for small groups.. not good for kids unless they like Indian food.. my daughter had their rice and naans all that time.

I'd definitely come here again.
author: Tram N.

description:
Sunday evening we stopped in here for some much anticipated Indian cuisine. I was so excited esp since my last Indian food was at Dosa. We didn't do the buffet, just entrees.

-Veggie Samosa (yum)
-Variety of naan (really good)
-Chicken Tikka Masala (not a whole lot of flavor)
-Fish Vindaloo (um nothing special)
-Mango Lassi (it was ok)
-Gulab Jaman ( this is my fav Indian dessert, but when it arrived..it was hard not soft like it normally is. And the syrup was cold. I'm used to it being warm. Epic fail on this one)

Overall, the food was not good. The staff is nice, esp the hostess. She was really sweet and we enjoyed talking to her, but food...eh
author: Lola D.

description: We've been going to this place for years, we live in the neighborhood.  Always had their buffet.  They're supposed to be known for their chicken tikka masala but it was not very good yday.  Their lamb keema was actually very good.  Their daals are good usually.  They will bring out fresh naan to your table - big plus.  They also have pakoras usually - those are always a hit with the kids.  Don't get the mango lassi - nothing special at all.  Their wait staff has gotten much better although now it seems their food quality has gone down slightly.
author: Ketan D.

description: I give this place about a three. Wasn't too bad. Had a spend $100 and receive $50 bucks back so it was a pretty good deal. Got a lot of food for 6 ppl n had plenty left over. Best thing though is the chicken curry, extra spicy! Everything else was pretty average but was actually disappointed in their chicken tikka masala. Chicken curry, lamb masala, and veggie samosas are the way to go. Naan can be too crispy and their tandoori chicken is mediocre. I've definitely had better Indian-Pakistani food but this one was not bad.
author: Bayan A.

description: Average food (very low on spices), good service. For this price you can get much  better food in South Bay.
author: narya a.

description: Flavor were bland for Indian food! Slow service. Overall lots of better options in SF
author: jessica t.

description:
It's not often one sees a buffet at dinner time.  This place really hit the spot.  Quite a variety going on, and plenty of vegetarian dishes, too.  Plus the small basket of nan included is a nice touch.

The full menu is also offered, so everyone's happy!
author: Ken B.

description:
I have eaten here over 40 times in the last few years and 3 times in the last 2 weeks.  

Great quality for an O.K lunch price.  That strong tea is included, serve yourself.  

Lunch is now the same as dinner at 10 bucks.  Nan is brought to the table rather than serve yourself.  Hot sauces and such are gone and not for the asking ( I like red chili paste ).  I came here to complain and say the place seems to be heading downhill a tiny bit but realize the food is fantastic and I should be back in the city next week to enjoy more.

I always do lunch here but I have never done dinner.
author: Stan H.

description:
It all started on a warmish evening two summers ago when the bf's mom grabbed some of this delicious grub on her way home.  We had been India Clay Oven fans at the time, but were blown away by the dishes she had picked out (one of which was the Channa Masala--two words: Damn, Gina) and the total she claimed to have paid for it all.  Two years later and it is THE go-to spot for those moments when only pure, unadulterated spice and some yummy yummy naan will suffice.  He's into the Chicken Vindaloo, I'm a Prawn Korma kind of girl.  He goes for the garlic naan, the onion is out of the bag and on my plate before he's realized the food's arrived.  (Opposites attract?)  But we can both agree on the Channa Masala (medium spicy, please--because as much as I love me some sauce--they do NOT mess around) and the Rice Pilaf.  

The prices are not as impressive as they were in the beginning--when we had been consistently offering up our first (un)born at Clay Oven but I feel that I can overlook this little fact because at Star India,  you can totally order online!  LOVE that.  While they do call to verify your order, there's something oddly satisfying about an entire restaurant experience that involves little to no human contact.  I mean, for me, generally, I'm ordering out because I'm not in the mood/too lazy to cook and therefore ALSO not in the mood to put on my happy voice to place a polite yet well-enunciated order--hoping beyond hope that they were able to distinguish between "Fulton" and "Folsom" and that my food's not now on it's way to some SOMA loft...What can I say, I'm a total freak when I'm hungry.  I think about these things.  Don't judge me...
author: Jasmine L.

description: Wow, the thing i like about this place is its friendly vibe. I go there for buffet and even if its packed staff don't forget about you at all. There are not many places that does that. The food is plain and simply great, the menu is broad and has number of entrees to dig in. Plenty of parking space on the cross street so you don't worry about the meter running out so you can enjoy your food. Hats off for the service, very sociable.
author: Greg M.

description: I came here for the $9.99 lunch or dinner buffet with my family. The buffet is just two carts of stuff. One is full of hot dishes with a platter of rice, some ground lamb, lamb curry, a potato eggplant platter, a yellow curry platter, chicken masala and a really hard chicken BBQ tasting platter. The other cart had a full tray of salad, two platters of fried food (fried potatoes and some chick pea balls and another with popcorn chicken like stuff) and five little platter things with sauces and pickled things and two cold platters, one with rice pudding and another with cucumber yogurt sauce. I had three plates and was really full. I mostly had salad with rice and curries. The mixtures of curry is dangerous. Ad by dangerous I mean for your stomach. Talk about atomic... The rice and chick pea curry, the chicken masala and the rice pudding were my favorites. The popcorn chicken stuff wasn't too bad either. I honestly felt like blowing up afterwards. This buffet could be better but it's bot exactly the worst I suppose. The restaurant was nice and empty when we got there and when we left. Only a few other tables were occupied.
author: Alex T.

description: Epic fail! So we ordered the onion bhajji/pakoda which turned out to be an incarnated onion ring. It's not your typical pakoda but I was pleasantly surprised by their creativity. Taste wise it was alright.. We then tried the vegetable jalfrazie and the dal with naans. The vegetable jalfrazie was awful! It was cold, the veggies were under cooked and insipid.
