My guess is they were frozen and didnt get enough time on the pan. The dal didn't come till half way through the meal so I called our waitress n let her know. The dal arrived 10 minutes later( we were almost done) and had suffered a massive overdose of turmeric. It wasn't palatable at all. The waitress was as apathetic as can be and didn't bother checking how we had liked the food nor did she apologize for her snafu...Needless to say we won't be going back.
author: Natasha I.

description:
I have eaten here twice and, to me, the food is VERY mediocre.  I've never had saag paneer with no flavor, but I'm telling you the saag paneer here has absolutely no flavor whatsoever.  Didn't taste like they'd added any spices at all.  And I ordered it fresh rather than eating it off the buffet.

But the most important thing is that, if you eat here, please double check your bill!  i am on a budget (who isn't) and so very carefully checked the prices on the menu before deciding what to order (chana masala, saag paneer and papadum).  When the bill came it was several dollars above what it should have been. When I pointed it out to the waiter he was not surprised at all.  He said that the menu I'd ordered from was old, and that the bill was correct because it was printed from "their system," which had the correct prices in it.  He said they had ordered a new menu with new prices, and just didn't have the menu in the restaurant yet, but that the new prices were already in "the system."  lt was my gut feeling that the new menu story was b-s.   Besides, if you're handing someone a menu and telling them to order, you should charge the price that's listed on the menu!  The manager said he would "honor THE PRICE LISTED ON THE MENU anyway, even though it's incorrect."

I have since been back by the restaurant and there is no "new menu" with new prices.  I think they are scamming people and hoping that customers don't check their bills before paying, so please check yours!  Or, better yet, just don't go there.  There's way better Indian food around town to be had.
author: Larry H.

description:
If your hungry and looking for inexpensive India food, this is your place. Enjoy all-you- can-eat buffet for $10. The food is nothing special, but its to be expected. 

They offer a wide variety of different curries, nan, tandoori chicken, salad, rice, etc.  The place is also clean and the staff friendly.  

Parking is a bit challenging for any restaurant/store in the area.
author: Kristina S.

description: My husband and I come here for the $9.99 dinner buffet, which is a great deal for the quality of the dishes especially recently.  Not sure if they have new management or maybe changed up their menu a little bit, but the food tastes fresher and more flavorful than before.  My favorites are their naan (comes to your table warm in a basket), papadams, saag paneer, and tandoori chicken.
author: Julie P.

description:
I really love curry. When you walk in this place, the aroma of curry hits you like Moe slapping Larry and Shemp. I was so ready to indulge! 

I was a little disappointed in how weak the lamb curry was. Little bits of lamb and bones...  lots of gravy for the rice, but the flavor was lacking. The Masala was OK, BBQ  Chicken, and the eggplants very tasty. The naan bread was awesome.

I've had better Indian/Pakistani food. But this place isn't bad.
author: Rick V.

description:
I've been here a couple of times with my friends for the dinner buffet, and we've never had any problems. The waiters are nice, and our water is constantly being refilled; which is much needed & appreciated while eating spicy curry.

I think if you have never tried indian food before, coming here for the dinner buffet would be a good idea. Instead of ordering a couple of things that you may not like, you can try a variety of the more popular dishes. One dish would probably cost you 10$ already, so 10$ for the dinner buffet definitely seems worth it in my opinion. 

Most of curries have meat in it, but there are like.. a few that are vegetarian. Like spinach & cheese and veggie curry.

Sometimes I feel really sick after eating indian food, (not just at this place) but I think that's just my problem cus my friends are always okay. Maybe I just have a weak stomach. 

I think they have complimentary chai tea but I'm not really sure because I haven't been here in a while.
author: Christina X.

description:
I ordered the meal for two (with meat) for delivery and waited approximately 60 minutes, even though they said between 30-45 minutes.

The Lamb Korma and Tandoori  Chicken were pretty good, but I didn't really like the Raita or the Pakors (way too oily).  

This is an okay place if you are ordering delivery, but nothing to write home about.  The meal for two lasted me, a single person, three meals, so the price isn't bad considering how much food you get.
author: E-dough R.

description: We had the buffet, it was ok, but then what does one really expect from a $10 buffet. The food was warm, not hot which is a little concerning when it comes to buffet style food, but alas we were fine afterwards. I would not go back, but I am sure that the food is better if you order off the menu.
author: Amy S.

description: I love it that the buffet is economical and they have Taj Mahal beer. The people are super friendly and laid back! Great service and relaxing atmosphere!!!
author: S W.

description:
This is one of my favorite restaurants and trust me, that's not an easy thing to say.  I've been living in SF for the last 10 years and Star India has been consistently one of my go-to spots since I've discovered it 2 years ago. When the bf and I can't decide where to go for dinner, Star India it is.

My friends and I usually go for their buffet. It's cheap, good and you always know what you're gonna get. I've been to a few Indian places in the city, and this place is always on par with them. Their employees are super friendly, which definitely makes them a neighborhood favorite.

Don't forget to try their Chai and garlic naan - soo good!
author: joanna u.

description:
I don't know why everyone gotta hate on Star India.  I was convinced I wasn't a fan of Indian food prior to my visit, and I left a believer.  Star India is pretty much the greatest place in the city to eat.  Screw Gary Danko, Star India is where it's at.  I didn't understand why people would order off the menu when they have such a badass buffet.  That's stupid.  For $10 you can get rice, garlic pita bread, really crispy tortillas, tea, taco meat, potato wedges AND salad bar.  Fuck yeah.  At the end, to top off your meal, they have amazing rice pudding. 

The pictures on the wall are beautiful as well.  Beautiful Indian women and gods with large bellies.  Beacause after you eat here, it's not realistic to think you're going to have a flat stomach.

-1 star for the rope light on the wall.  Thats sooooo college dorm room.
author: Katie H.

description:
I think I may have had food poisoning from the buffet, but it's really hard to tell sometimes what it is that causes 2am problems of this matter.

I've been here a number of times before and felt fine, so don't base your choice on me. I've just gotta be honest. 

Sorry guys.
author: Alex S.

description: I LOVE this place. They have a great menu, but the buffet is awesome. Consistently delicious, yummy daily specials and free Chai!!! All for 10 bucks. Star India is fantastic, traditional Indian food. The cauliflower and spinach morsels covered in fried chickpeas are my favorite-- my boyfriend is obsessed with the Chicken Tikka Masala. And their rice is the best.The staff is ridiculously nice and the service is always prompt and accommodating. No reason not to eat here once a week!
author: Chelsea H.

description: Been going here for years. Love this place. There's more great food in the menu, we always skip the buffet.
author: Milena N.

description: Their vegetarian buffet selection, taste, and price can't be beat. I LOVE the taste of the vegetarian dishes here.  No waiting, just go to the buffet, get some food, and the delicious fresh warm Naan bread will come soon afterwards.
author: Andrew J.

description:
Wanted to order Chinese delivery last night, but Melisa's was closed. So, we tried this place. I used the online ordering system, which was sexy. Very quick and easy. The food showed up about 20 minutes later. The chicken vindaloo was properly spicy, but (according to my wife) the chicken korma was "good, not great." The samosas and naan were.... well.... samosas and naan. 

Overall, nothing special, but, I'll def order again... mostly because of the online ordering and the delivery speed. I also wanna check out that buffet. $10 Indian buffet is the greatest sentence since, "We Allow Smoking."
author: Aaron Z.

description:
We had a craving for Indian food, and after a search through Yelp came across this one over on Geary.

Having read the menu on their site, we already had our selection in mind when we walked in and were a little surprised to see the buffet offered. The waiter tried to nudge us to try it, so we walked over to take a look. The buffet looked okay, but we had recently been burned (not physically, but mentally) by another Indian buffet and so were a little shy about trying it again. So we opted to order off the menu as we had planned.

In terms of the food, it's okay to good. We got the Naan, the lamb Naan, rice and the Chicken Tikka Masala. The Naan was good, although we have had better at a couple of locations now. We were happy to see lamb naan on the menu, as it can be kind of rare to see. The rice was standard, while the Chicken Tikka Masala was quite good. Sadly, the portion size for this was very small. In fact, it was notably smaller than any we had ordered before, and actually ordered a second helping of Naan because of it.

As for the service, it wasn't as attentive as it could have been but we never felt abandoned and our drinks were kept filled pretty well through the meal.

All in all, the place was good. If we were closer, we might even be tempted to go again as its more of a 3.5 place (although closer to the 3 than the 4). So we might suggest it, but prefer some of the other Indian places we have frequented in the Bay Area.
author: Sami R.

description: "Food was great and the employees were sweet and funny people. Had an awesome time and had just dropped by chance but glad we came in. I would recommend it to anyone who is trying to have a good time and with friends. Food was delicious also. Drinks were bomb!
author: Roxanna V.

description:
I can't say I've eaten a lot of Indian food in my life, despite having grown up in San Francisco where there's no shortage of Indian food. You see, I've only just gotten around to liking things that have any spice or heat to them. I'll never like cilantro/coriander, but I can live with that.

Anyway, in comparison to what little I've had before, Star India's food was fine. The buffet had plenty of options (and plenty for vegetarians) that I enjoyed, but there was nothing that made me want to eat platefuls and platefuls. 

If you're hungry, the all you can eat buffet is a good deal ($9.99), but be sure to clean your plate; anything you leave on your plate will be weighed and you will be charged extra.
author: Katie I.

description: I love the neighborhood Indian spot. No, it isn't the best in the city. But, for me, it's convenient, good food and very friendly service.  Star India has the traditional Indian cuisine. You can eat at the buffet for $9.99 or order from the menu. They have vegetarian dishes separated from the meat. I particularly like that. Nothing extra is needed. They also have Indian desert. The food is served hot and the staff is genuine. I go all the time, they even know me by my frequency of visits.
author: Erik R.

description: I love Indian buffets and despite one bad review yesterday, I decided to give it a try as it was only two blocks away when I looked on Yelp. Well, I was disappointed. I didn't even finish my first plate of food.  The only things I enjoyed were raita, kheer, and chai. The rest was blah, at best.
author: Sanda E.

description:
Just ordered delivery from Star India, my experience was not good. 
I ordered mushroom matter , allu gobi medium spice and garlic naan. I started with mushroom matter. It was so crazy spicy! The allu gobi was red in color, I am used to it being more yellowish, it was also  very spicy . The mushroom matter was so spicy it was inedible, I had to wash both dishes in water just to eat them as vegetables. It was still spicy but I could eat it. The garlic naan was not flavorful nor could I taste any garlic. 
Indian food is one of my favorite cuisines and this was probably the worst Indian food I have ever had. 

Also the delivery driver smirked and grunted like when I handed him his cash plus  with a tip. That was very strange.
author: Robin W.

description:
I've had very consistent delivery from Star India, which is why I'm giving it 4 stars!

This is generally what we order:

Chili Cheese Naan
Chicken Tandoori
Vegetable Samosa
Sag Paneer
Saffron Rice
and one Mango Chutney

All this is about $30, but it's enough for two meals for two people.

On occasion, the Chicken Tandoori is better than other times, but overall, no complaints.

It usually arrives really hot, but that could be because I'm closer to the restaurant than others.

Doubt I'll go to the buffet, because that could change things. For now, the delivery is where it's at!
author: thrasher b.

description:
Basically, you get what you pay for. The buffet was cheap- $10 I believe? But the food was highly mediocre and I didn't think it was worth even $10. I've been to really good Indian buffets for the same price, so this place fell short for sure. I couldn't believe how limited the selection was, and how lukewarm the food was. If you've ever been to one of those cheap Chinatown buffet places where you can get a meal for something like $4.99, imagine that, but Indian style! Not only was the food bad, but the place had a party of 40 coming in about half an hour after we started eating (which they should have told us before we sat down). When the time came close to their arrival, we ate with our heads down, the owners huddled together and whispering as they glared at us from the back of the restaurant, obviously trying to silently kick our butts outta the place to make room for the huge party. Umm...I paid for this meal and have the right to sit in the restaurant and enjoy it for a reasonable amount of time, people! How rude. Customer service and food are seriously lacking at this place- and isn't this the whole point of going out to eat??? Skip this joint and go elsewhere.

One thing I should note, though, is that a homeless guy came in asking for food and they let him sit and eat. I thought that was nice of them, but still not nice enough to make me ever want to come back.
author: Jess E.

description:
In no particular order, the stariest stars for Star India go to: 

*Chili Cheese Naan 
**Coconut Shrimp 
***Delivery in less than 25 minutes, every time 
****Chicken Tika Masala 
*****Lamb Korma 

Not the cheapest in town, but the best Indian food available for delivery. Yummy!
author: Megan L.

description: I finally found a good Indian restaurant in San Francisco!!  And they have delivery as well, with a minimum purchase of $12.  I was amazed as to how good and how much food I got for $30.  I ordered the Dal, the Bengan Bhartha, Chicken Vindaloo, and the Garlic Naan.  The only complaint I had was that when ordering online I was not prompted if I wanted to get rice with my dishes as well, and when they called to tell me that my food would be there in 45 minutes, again was not asked about rice.  I totally forgot about it because usually at other Indian Restaurants it either comes with it or my server will ask if I want rice.  So don't forget to order the rice while ordering online.
author: Rose Z.

description:
I included a german beer in my delivery order. 

They brought me an O'Douls

:(
author: Jessica L.

description:
I've had the $10 buffet twice. They're pretty nice but the food isn't great and lukewarm. My boyfriend and I felt sick after the last time and decided we shouldn't go to this place again. 

It's just with all the great Indian food in the city, I wouldn't go here. You pay for what you get.
author: Dianne N.

description: When you ask for spicy, they don't mess around especially with the chicken tikka masala. Good value with the all you can eat buffet but ordering off the menu is better quality food that has not been sitting under heat lamps. Come for the food and the easy parking not the lackluster decor.
author: Shawn K.

description: Coconut Shrimp Curry, Vindaloo and Saag. That's all you need to know when you order. I recently ordered, fell asleep, woke up the next day to six missed calls from the driver, and embarrassed called them the next day. They were super cool and just said to tip the driver next time I ordered. In my top three for Indian in the city.
author: Katie W.

description:
I've only gotten delivery here, so that's what this review is based off of.

The food here isn't cheap. Entrees hover around 8-12 dollars a pop. You pay extra for the breads and rice.

But this is really, REALLY good food. I told my family about how good my lunch from here was, and they had me buy 50 bucks worth of food and bring it back to Fremont so they can try it. The food was cold when everyone tried it....and it was still good. 

Great place.
author: Jae S.

description: I just moved to the area and stumbled upon this place. All I can say is WOW! Amazing food, wonderful service, good prices, need I go on? I've been here several times, each time bringing a different friend. Everyone I bring loves it! The buffet is such a good deal and their Indian beers are awesome (I recommend the Taj Mahal). The employees are so friendly and welcoming, you can't help but get that warm and fuzzy feeling. So in short...EAT HERE! You won't regret it :)
author: Lindsay B.

description:
Oh Star India, you have rescued me many times from my kitchen. 

My husband and I have been eating here for nearly five years. We originally discovered this place through my coworkers, who were devoted fans (for good reason!). 

Though we've only dined in here a handful of times (and always off the menu, never the buffet), we order takeout frequently.
Always the same order: chicken vindaloo, chicken karahi, rice, naan, veggie samosa. Yum. Yum. and YUM. Once in awhile the dishes are a bit on the spicy side for me (I'm a lightweight), but always good. The flavor of the chicken in the karahi dish is my favorite - I don't know what they do to it (I'm guessing some kind of magic marinade), but it's delicious. Whatever you do, don't ask for "mild" - that's the only time I've been unimpressed with our order - it tasted kind of watery. 

The guys who answer the phone and the guys who deliver are always nice, patient and not once, in three + years of ordering have they ever messed up our order (that's saying something). Additionally (because I can't say this of most of the Chinese food places we've ordered from) - never, not once, have we ever been sick from this food. 

This place is absolutely one of our go-to options for takeout. We love Star India.
author: Laura G.

description: I rarely give two star reviews because, let's face it, I consider myself pretty qualified at picking out eateries.  Unfortunately tonight's experience warrants two stars, not because of the delivery service or the freshness but for the worst reason of all.  It tastes BLAH.  For us, Indian food is a treat.  We love it and are excited when we get the chance to eat it.  Tonight we ordered chicken tikka masala and sag paneer and both were lacking in flavor.  The nan was fine and the samosa was good but they didn't make up for the entrees.  I guess we're still on the hunt for a good Indian place that delivers to Presidio Heights.  We miss you Mehfil!  (Sorry Star India)
author: Denise G.

description:
One evening not long ago I found a paper menu rubberbanded to my front door with a list of Indian delights. I reviewed the menu, and to no suprise I found what I was looking for: a Tandoori platter to sample the restaurant's "bread and butter" dishes.

But alas, my appetite was fierce, and in an impulsive fit I decided to splurge my hard earned wages on sweets, meats, and spices known the world over for their delicatable flavours.

A vegetable Pakora please! Chicken Vindaloo? Of course! And Gulab Jamun with a Mango Lassi. That will do, good sir.

The delivery was quick, the portions immense (save for the Lassi), and the Tandoori platter was quite decadent indeed. I found the lamb bits were soaked in red yoghurt, having a deep red crimson hue that did not soon betray its dense, full flavour. 

The vegetable pakora mix was massive, full of fried, breaded, spiced vegetables bursting with aroma and oil. And the Gulab Jamun was luxury incarnate; a treat one would be hard pressed to soon forget.

All in all a good choice for delivery, a fair price, and a happy smiling belly.
Star of India... "Mujhe tumse pyar hai!"
author: Michael F.

description: Great place for munchies! 10.99 for all you can eat buffet. not all that spicy so great if you dont prefer too much spice.
author: Jp K.

description:
These dudes are grand -- for years, I've been maintaining a close relationship with other Indian favorites in Lower Haight, but I've found a new home at Star India.  Consistently brilliant, if you need a fix of chicken tikka masala, look no further than takeaway from here.

I've hit the $9.99 buffet, and it'll do just fine when you're in need of volume, but try and explore the rest of the menu.  Service is top drawer and wicked efficient -- you'll love investing your Indian food dollars at this hole in the wall establishment.

You can't go wrong at Star India -- custom order for maximum effectiveness.
author: James D.

description: I come here on a more regular basis than I care to admit. I love Indian food. And I love Indian buffets therefore this place is a no brainer. I actually used to rotate between Star India and another place in the Richmond, going at least weekly (I really like Indian food). Start India has become my go to and I have yet to be disappointed. The food is always fresh, the curry flavorful and the chicken pakora is the best out there. Boom.
author: Loren F.

description:
If you're a college student, esp. of nearby USF, and you LOVE deals on awesome food, come here (or order from here, and they'll deliver!).

My ex-roommate and I had our Indian food fix satiated each time we came - which was often.  For an Indian buffet at $10 per person, we definitely got our college dollars' worth of perfectly prepared food.  If you're not willing to make the walk/MUNI trip to Geary, order in.  

Best dish: spinach paneer, with naan. MMM MMM 'mazing.
author: Gemma G.

description: This is very affordable yet clean Indian Restaurant in San Francisco. I have been going there for more than a year. I like the most of the things in the buffet but I like  Tikka Masala the best.
author: Jeevan R.

description:
I am stuck between giving this place 3 or 4 stars.  

The quality of food is worth 3 stars.  The buffet is what I go for... so the food options are usually the same... Some masala meat stuff, and some veggie stuff.  Nothing special, but its spicy enough to get the blood pumping.  The food is normally lukewarm... and the naan is always cold.  

Wait..... now I am asking myself, what was it that I was debating about for the 4th star...

Oh yeah, the place is always open (or it feels like it) and the cheap buffet price.  I guess, I like dependability.  Furthermore, everyone who works there is nice enough, and its a calm place, where you never have to worry about waiting for food.  

Heck, all you have to do is throw your jacket on a chair, grab a plate, and eat!
author: Jaclyn O.

description: I order from star india regularly and Ive never been disappointed! Usually I order the tandoori prawns, the cucumber salad and onion or garlic naan. I also get extra sauces; both the green and purple are great! The food is delivered pretty quickly and always arrives hot and fresh!
author: Natalie M.

description:
Dinner for 2 is a great option when you want a little bit of everything (or just can't decide).  

Online ordering is slick and very easy.
author: Tom O.

description: I've only recently become a fan of Indian food. My friend said this is a great place and we were in the area so I thought we'll give it a try. When he said buffet I was expecting a lot more. The only thing I really liked was the garlic naan and one of the meat items. I don't like lamb so that was out of the question. The salad wasn't too good nor was the tea. The price wasn't too bad for a buffet. I didn't eat 11 dollar worth of food.
author: Sarah C.

description:
So after walking all day in the city, I decided to take my sister who was visiting to get some Indian food. I always go to India Clay Oven, as it is so freaking delicious that the price doesn't even bother me. However, I thought I'd give Star India a go, and well I was not impressed.

Admittedly we did get their dinner buffet, and one cannot expect the best meal ever with a $9.99 buffet. The food was room temperature, full of oil, and not spicy (except for this cabbage dish which was tasty and spicy). I think what was worst of all was that even the naan was sitting out under a heating lamp. I mean come on, i've been to Indian buffets before and they at least bring you fresh naan!!

So yeah - meh, i've had better...next time i'll make myself wait out the journey for India Clay Oven
author: Roxanne C.

description: This place has the best indian food and the owners and staff are great! I live in the neighborhood and come often and it is consistently good food. I highly recommend !
author: Kelly K.

description:
Though it's been almost 1 year since I went to this restaurant so I don't know if anything changed recently but I would still like to share my experience. 1 star is overrating imo. We went there for lunch and had the buffet. Horrible food and service. 

Firstly the service, lazy unprofessional servers. Serving plate was dirty so we asked the waiter to get another one. The waiter on his way back to our table with the new plate literally rubbed the plate on his butt yes he did that eww!! Off course we asked him to get another one stating the exact reason to him. We were very hungry and absolutely had no energy to try some other place so we decided to stay and try their food. On any other occasion the plate rubbing incident would have been enough to drive us out. 

Now the food, cold, tasteless and oily. We all know that hunger forces you to eat anything but trust me their food would not even qualify for anything you would rather prefer staying hungry. Terrible experience unhygienic food and waste of money. That place was also empty with some weirdos sitting here and there.

I would never go back.
author: Vinni T.

description:
1) Meat (ground lamb) Samosa (2) $4. Puff pastries w/bit of cucumber salad, and four sauces. Tasty. I'll do it again.
2) Kabuli Nan, supposedly w/cherries. $3. Except for some red stains on the interior which didn't noticably affect the taste, not obviously different than plan nan ($2).
3) Lamb Vindaloo ("very hot lamb curry...with potatoes in tangy sauce"). $12. Didn't tang much, for my taste, lots of tomatoey sauce. Didn't seem to be all that much lamb in the tureen, and when I got a piece after a couple big hunks of potato the connective tissue resisted disassembly, so I left it for my partner. Will skip this one in the future.
4) Ground Seekh Kabob. $11.50. Plentiful segmented rolls of ground lamb, with onions, bell pepper slices. As with the Samosa version of the ground lamb, tasty. And plentiful. I'll order this again.
5) Basmati rice, $2@. Fine.
6) Mango Lassi. $2.50@. Fine.

$42.67 with tax, but before tip or discount. The doorhanger menu gives you $5 off the second entree, but I took home plenty of food despite my companion complaining about how much she'd eaten (and I'm not a light eater) so I could have done without a second entree, so that's less useful than the $12/$20 Groupon Now I actually used. Which in turn wouldn't have been as good as the $10(or less)/$25(of $35) (etc - three other options) available on restaurant dot com. And I noticed a BOGO$10 off on BigTip. And another review mentions LivingSocial... None of these (except some specials for takeout on the doorhanger) can be used for buffet or takeout, but it appears you can eat here cheap without limiting yourself to the buffet.
author: Andy P.

description:
excellent service, nice owners, the buffet didnt have a lot of variety, mostly just the basic Indian cuisine, they didnt have any samosas or Biryani rice that day, but they had goat stew and I thought it was one of the best goat stews Ive had from Indian buffets, the meat was tender and tasted fresh made, the naan bread was oily and kind of doughy tasting, Ive had better naaan bread , authentic naan breads Ive had at other places was not made this way, it's usually fresh baked right out of the tandoori oven, there's tasted like it was reheated in a pan with some oil?

this place is definitely worth a try, I plan to return and try something off the menu next time
author: Mr Bolo B.

description:
TAKE OUT REVIEW ONLY

Love the online ordering, be sure to click on the coupons and add them to your order so you can save. And if you wonder if the order was really received, don't worry. They call you and confirm - yay! 

The dinner for two is awesome (and sounds soooo romantic!). It comes with lots of food - you could stretch it into 3 people super easy. Add more naan though - I feel like there is never enough naan. It was one big piece and I had to ...share!?!?! Hello... I'm basically an only child so I don't like get this concept. But you can totally sneak the bigger piece... Not that I did that or anything... (luv you Jessica L.!)

Also their sweet naan dipping sauce is delicious and you can pretend it's dessert. 

And you can get beer delivered.

And you can write notes in the online order section, like a nice haiku for them.... "Hot boys in Speedos/ For delivery please/ I like them a lots"

And I can't think of anything else to say.
author: Ali R.

description:
I loved ordering online.  I did not love the hour I had to wait for my food.  And despite my Mexican heritage, perhaps I'm a bit of a "spicy sissy" because medium = pretty darn spicy.  Not uncomfortably so, but certainly not "We realize your American tastebuds have been deadened by years of too much salt and sugar in your highly processed foods so we'll take it easy on you" spicy.
Though not entirely their fault, by the time I attempted to enjoy my tasty Indian treats, they were pretty cool and flaccid.  I typically love the pakora/samosa sampler, and even the best fried foods wilt quickly, but the flavor wasn't that great, despite the sog.  The channa masala was crazy spicy upon first bite, but only because I wasn't expecting it I imagine.  The tikka masala was good, but 75% sauce to 25% chicken.  I suppose I'd give them another shot as nothing sucked, but I wasn't that wowed.
author: Jennifer D.

description: Based on the other fairly positive reviews, did I go at the wrong time? We visited on the weekend and the buffet was terrible. Dry Chicken Marsala, super dry and old Bbq Chicken, other items old and dry tasting. Lamb was the only decent item. Service was friendly but food was barely edible. $10 isn't a good deal when the food is this bad.
author: Rice C.

description: Their buffet is very tasty! There is a lot of variety in what they serve and the naan is freshly made to order. I had a delicious lunch there and was very stuffed. They also have my favorite dessert there- the rice pudding. If you check in on yelp, they will give you free mango ice cream! It comes in cubes and it a bit icier than regular ice cream...delicious.
author: June Q.

description:
All you can eat does not mean eat all you can!  My bad!  

Walking into the place sent me right back to Castro Street in Mountain View.  This is a typical suburban-style buffet.  Dinner for two for under $20!  Yay!  

There is something to be said for the ability to just walk in, pick up a plate, and start eating.  We came hungry, and after the first plate was wolfed I went for another 1/2 plate.  Whoa!  My stomach is shrinking!  I felt STUFFED all evening, and fell into a 10-hour food coma.  

Tasty, DELICIOUS.  Naan is a little chewy, but there is a great selection of meaty and vegetarian dishes.  Watch the breading, it will fill you up.  Tandoori chicken is very popular here.  When we walked in there were two tables occupied; when we left the place was full, including a family of eight at the front middle table.  

Oh -- the decor -- paintings of artists and artisans everywhere.  Cool, dark lighting.  Sufi chants and Bollywood soundtracks.  The buffet is in an elevated back room, which felt like I was climbing to the Temple of Food.  

This is the quintessence of middle-class all-you-can-eat satisfaction.  It's up to you whether that's your style.  Come hungry, eat slowly.
author: David D.
Drue C.

description:
We were in the neighborhood today and I had a craving for indian food. It was $9.99 for the buffet - so I thought why not try it. The selection didn't look too bad, and the resturant was clean.

Overall, for a buffet it's not bad. The chicken tikka masala, tandori chicken, spinach paneer, lamb curry, and the lentils were not bad. The rice was pretty good as well. And they have the crispy bread thing as well as 2 different kinds of naan (garlic and plain). They also had a spicy soup which I normally do not see at buffets - that was ok. Of the desserts - they had these sweet ball things (not sure what it is called) - and those were good. There is also chai tea, which I really enjoyed because it was piping hot. 

Overall, not bad but i wished the naan was hot. I like the naan fresh, and not sitting there getting cold. There selection was pretty good, but I just normally stick to the staples..so you can't really go wrong there. The food could have been warmer/hot - but then again, maybe its because I came here when its raining and cold, so all I wanted was super hot food. Whatever the reason, not bad, but I think I'll stick to India Clay Oven if I were to do an indian buffet again.
author: Betty S.

description:
Here's the thing: my brother-in-law is Indian. I've tasted his family's food, and have been a big fan of Indian food since I was lad growing up in England (where they have many fast food curry joints). So I got a feeling I know my Indian food better than the average Joe.

That being said, Star India is not out-of-this-world great. The tandoori chicken can be somewhat chewy, the lamb curry isn't overly flavorful, and I've tasted better samosas (though it's all still damn good). But you know what, that $8 buffet, combined with stellar service from the staff, and the selection of food, counts for a lot. Picture the scene: you know you're up for a big night at the bars, it's mid-afternoon, and you just wanna fill your stomach and do it with little hassle. Well then roll in here, enjoy the above-average food (as many times as you'd like), and cut out of there without even spending $10. Not bad.
author: Drew S.

description:
My name is Dfens..and I have a serious naan addiction.  I can't get enough Naan in my system to satisfy my craving. Right now I'm getting the shakes because I haven't had a garlic naan in the last hour.. argh! 

So obviously what better place to get my naan fix than an Indian buffet. Seriously this place is cheap. Damn cheap for what it is. $8 for all you can eat food, well at least in theory. Too bad that this is the smallest buffet you'll ever see. When I say small I mean I could have eaten everything on the buffet table myself.  Yes I had my 4 heaping plates of naan but after it ran out they slowly put out pieces.. the same with their chicken tandoori and everything else. The food is pretty good though. But replenishing the buffet  was so slow that I actually walked out of a buffet wanting to get more food. So then I went to Genki Crepes..but that's a whole other addiction I don't want to stop right now. 

I've also been here around 830pm and though the buffet is still open there's not much food left and they will not replenish it. It's a bummer because it's cheap and good but I can't ever seem to get enough in my belly. 

I read through the other reviews and no one ever mentioned about the slow buffet service so maybe it is my fat belly and naan addiction that's holding me back. I'm not sure. but it's definitely decent food for a low price so if you need to get some Indian food for cheap stop by. Just don't take my naan.. or else I might freak out and get the shakes aggaaaaiiinnn...
author: Dan T.

description:
Good value for what they provide - I am only ever able to find one or two things on the buffet which I like... usually chicken tika masala or something somewhat close to that.

I dated a guy who loved the hell out of this restaurant.  Never saw what the big frickin' deal was... I've had better.
author: Kate R.

description:
I went here last night with my roommate.  We got an add in the mail about $10 lunch and dinner buffet.  A $10 buffet is always worth giving a try.

I have to admit that it wasn't the best indian food I've ever had, but they had a good selection of different curry's, nan, tandoori chicken, salad, rice, and more.  The place was also clean and the staff friendly.  

The chicken curry was my favorite and I ate my fill.  For $10 this place is a good deal if you're hungry, on a budget, and want a variety of curries.
author: Peter W.

description:
Craving for Indian food, I gave this place a try for lunch.  I guess I was expecting more of a larger scale buffet, like Todai...that's why I was kind of disappointed.

The smell of curry welcomed me into this place.  Lights were off/dimmed...which feels somewhat odd for lunch.  

There was a small selection...tandoori chicken, chicken masala, soup, salad, naan, rice pudding, and tea.  Naan was chewy, not bad.  My favorite was the chicken masala and that was what I mostly kept to during the lunch.  It was only 11:40am and the tandoori chicken was out but not replenished during the time I was there.  The rice was cold.  Just too early into the lunch hour for this to happen!
author: Mick S.

description: What can you get for 9 bucks? A shirt at Marshall's? Sometimes. A large cup of frozen yogurt with 3 toppings? Sometimes. A new album from Target? Sometimes. But for $8.99, you can get many courses at Star India with endless naan, curries, tandoori chicken, salads, soups, and much more! The curries were all tasty and all had a nice sweet and spicy kick to them. I enjoyed the food there and my plate was clean after every meal. However, they ran out of samosas for the entire night. My friends got the last 3 and I lucked out. In addition, one of my friends claim to have gotten food poisoning from the tandoori chicken which was one of the items I did not eat. I cannot really say much about that but it did look a bit pink on the inside. I love the simplicity of the place, grab your table, plates, and pile away. The selection is worth your $8.99 and the decor is inviting and you do feel like you're at someone's dining room. Overall, a great place and I would definitely come back.
author: Danster L.

description:
Oh dear...this was not a good experience at all.  Gave the dinner buffet a try.  What a disaster!  Not sure if it's because it was late, but the food looked like it had been there all day--untouched.  Yikers!  On top of that, the dishes was lukewarm, room temperature at best.    

poor food + served at room temp = never to return (at least for buffet)

sometimes these types of places are better for carry out, but skip the dinner buffet.  i'd rather drive to south bay and eat at grand indian.
author: Jennifer H.

description:
I feel utterly shitty. goddamned boyfriend coughed and hacked in my face all night and now I have a fugging headcold. it's freakin Friday and I don't even feel like drinking. curses. so I ordered in for some spicy lentil soup and samosas and fried bread. I've been on an indian food kick, don't ask me why. I haven't eaten eggos in a week and the freezer is filled w/ boxes and boxes of varying flavors. anyhoo. I just had half of the soup and my nose is running like a mofu. at least now I can breathe and there's some damn heat in my bones. we keep this house cold enough to sustain an indoor skating rink, don't you know.

the lamb samosas were good (not too many yucky peas) but I am still marveling over how that dal made my head feel better. could there have been vodka in there ? if you are sicky and whiny and runny nosy, swallow some of this liquid elixir and sweat your illness away.

delivery took 40 mins which I think is excellent for a Friday eve. the poor guy was shaking, the 10-lb Prima Dachshund was barking at him like a scorned bitch. I tipped him $5 for his fear.
author: Prima D.

description:
I am not a fan of Indian food but the dinner buffet was perfect since I was able to try little bits of everything untill I found the yummy dish...Lamb Massala.  That was some good lamb it didn't have the strong scent or taste that can come with it when ill prepared.  

The naan was great...It was light an fluffy and tasty.  I could've eaten that for days.  

$8 for dinner buffet and they have a some stuff I didn't have the balls to try but they have tasty veggie options and though Chicken Tandori was a little dry it was good, too.

For a non Indian food eater...I would go back again.
author: Jay H.

description: BEST Indian buffett ever! $10 bucks gets you everything:soup, chai, bread basket, stewed meats, fresh salad, fried appetizers, lots of veg dishes and dessert!! DONT waist your time going anywhere else!! ;)
author: Jesica M.

description:
Value with and E 
Great deal for a Monday night dinner. Everyone from families, college students, dates. It's easy low key dining. Maybe not the best place to tell the story of the hooker with the broken leg on capp street.
author: Jennifer S.

description:
I think I had one of, if not THE most surreal dining experiences here with some friends a while back.

We ordered a bottle of wine to have with dinner. It came of course, before the meal and the waiter emptied it into our 4 glasses in the very first pour. He literally filled each glass to the very brim. Unless you just slurped it off the top there was no way that your weren't going to spill it just trying to sip it.

All the dishes we ordered came like 15 minutes apart, except for one dish that took so long we had to get it to go as we were going to a show so eating together was sort of not an option. The food was good, but not timely, and clearly the service left much to be desired.

The waiter was utterly clueless.
author: Marz W.

description:
It is my personal favorite place to go for comfort food.... and I had no idea you could be comforted so thoroughly by food from a country you had only tasted for the first time 5 years ago!!??!

It's my favorite. 
the end .
author: J C.

description:
Not quite 5-Star India.

4-Star India:

* You can already smell it around the corner. That, my friends, is probably the smartest advertising ever, since it has this effect of always making me wanna eat here when I pass by... even when I'm not hungry.
+
* It's a buffet. Which means you enter, pick a table out of the corner of your eye and head straight for the kill. No time wasted, no questions asked.
+
* The chicken tikka masala never, ever lets me down.
+
* $9.75 for unlimited chicken tikka masala, tandoori chicken, saag paneer, naan, rice, and gulab jamun in kheer (syrupy, doughy balls of deliciousness floating in a sweet concoction of milk and rice). So eat a lot. Or eat a little. Either way, it's worth it.
+
* It's fun inside. Campy enough to make you smile (murals of scandalously-clad countrywomen and Bollywood background music are a staple at most Indian restaurants of this caliber anyway) but doesn't overdo it. Cozy atmosphere.
-
* The saag paneer always tastes different! Last night not only was it spicier than usual, it didn't even seem like the same dish. The rising cost of food must seriously be killing buffets, which seem to be succumbing to lower quality everything including spinach.

4 stars for a valiant effort though.
author: Kate V.

description:
Great overall experience...

We showed up around 8pm hoping to use the $20 living social deal that I'd purchased a few months back.  They had their dinner buffet going, but unfortunately the voucher specifically stated that it wasn't good for the buffet... though once we saw how tasty the buffet looked & smelled, we decided to go for it anyways, as it was only $10 a person and the voucher was still good for anything ordered off the menu.  So we got the buffet and then ordered some cheese naan, poori, and samosas off the menu, all of which were pretty damn good.

The buffet items were all really good as well... the tikki masala flavorful, the palak paneer amazing, the tandoori chicken nice & tender...  My only complaint is that they had some fried veggies out that looked like they'd been sitting out under the heat lamp for a while, and biting into one confirmed that that was indeed the case.  But everything else was good.

I got some of the raita for dessert, which was tasty, though I have had better.  The gulab jamun was also somewhat mediocre and a bit lacking in flavor, at least compared to how I've had it at other places.

All in all though, this place rocks.  It's not the best Indian food you'll ever eat, but for $10 you're getting more than your money's worth.  Taking the food and price into account, it's a solid 4-star.  However, at the end of the meal, we hadn't yet ordered a full $20 from the menu so I asked the waiter if we could order something to-go, despite it saying "no takeout" on the voucher...  After running it by the manager, he was more than happy to make an exception!  This definitely earns them an extra star, because I know a lot of restaurants can be real dicks about the stipulations on their groupons & living social deals.  So hats off to Star India for good service!
author: Josh U.

description:
I checked out the Star India lunch buffet a few days ago and was satisfied overall, but not blown away.  I could see coming here regularly for my fix if I lived nearby, but wouldn't make a destination of it.

All the veg dishes I tried on the buffet tasted pretty good and were the right temperature, etc.  The staff were less-than-vigilant about refilling the buffet, however, and had a few tables of us waiting for naan and papadum for quite a while.  When it came out though, there was both garlic and plain naan.  They also have samosas on the buffet, which is a good thing.  The dishes on the line were pretty standard, as were the chutneys, although they were kind of hard to see through the oddly dark tinting of the sneeze guard.  One concrete complaint is that the saag paneer had almost no paneer in it.

At $11 with tax, the buffet is a little high-priced for what you get, which is a very solid yet equally no-frills North Indian buffet.
author: Josh C.

description:
I think Star is geographically, the closest Indian joint to my house, and for that reason I'd probably return.

Damn, $8.99 for a dinner buffet is unreal. I gotta say, though, at 8:30 when I got there some of the items were cold.

It was pretty empty when I was there and the young guys working there were all super friendly.

The daal soup hit the spot.
author: Jason R.

description: Love this place... One of the first places I ate when I moved here from NY.  The staff is always super friendly and welcoming. The food is alway great regardless of what I order. I prefer to order off the menu instead of Buffett. If your looking for a great place to eat and has superstar service Star India is the place!
author: Malcolm S.

description: Food itself was good.  Ordered the lamb curry and baigan bharta.  "Hot" was actually spicy!  Too bad it took and hour and 40 minutes to have it delivered when I ordered it on Eat24.  When I called the restaurant after an hour and asked where it was, he said it was out for delivery already and that "they were slammed."  Please, at 8 pm on Sunday in the Inner Richmond?  Delivery guy claimed that the other delivery guy had left it there and skipped over it.  It really should take that long to deliver from a place that I can get to on my bike in 10 minutes.
author: Kathy C.

description:
A nice lil' place in the Richmond District, good buffet, great dessert and a quiet comfortable place to get together with friends and actually be able to hear eachother's conversations.

You can either choose from the menu or try from the buffet, which I recommend if you're not familiar with Indian food.  Great curry, Naan was alright and the rice pudding was excellent.

My only beef is that the chicken tikka masala wasn't available in the buffet during my first and only round of food, then when I was ready for dessert it magically appeared.  I guess I was just unlucky.

I want rice pudding now.
author: Jonathan B.

description:
my favorite neighborhood Indian restaurant. The prices are good and if you eat in you can always take advantage of their buy one dish and get one free. I generally stick to the buffet and everything is usually fresh. 

The Chicken Tika Masala here is really good. They give you plenty of options on the buffet as well as having some tasty dessert options if you still have room.

The staff is always friendly and cordial and while the decor is nothing special there is generally enough room if you go there in a larger size group.
author: Patrick B.

description:
OK, so I admit it.  This review is based on one late-night delivery, which I so enjoyed after a couple of stiff cocktails.  I might not have been in a position to be too critical.  Then again, if the food wasn't GREAT, I might not have told my wife 10 times how awesome the Tandori Chicken was.

We've recently been wasting a lot of time playing Super Mario Galaxy, a guilty pleasure.  Well, it was suddenly 9:30, and I asked my wife to forage for dinner.  We've generally been unimpressed with the takeout we've tried... Ho's, Modern Thai, Hai Sun, some Indian place on Fillmore.  So she found Star India on Geary and 2nd Ave..

We ordered the non-vegetarian combo meal for 2, about $25.  Instead of the lamb something or other, we ordered Saag Paneer, so we ended up with veggie somosas, raita, jasmine rice, garlic naan, saag paneer, and tandori chicken.  The saag paneer was a little spicy, which was new and exciting.  All was fabulous.  The chicken really phenominal... or so I told my wife many times during the feast.

Thank goodness for Star India Restaurant & Pizza.  Can't wait to try the buffet for $9!
author: Joshua B.

description:
$8 ALL YOU CAN EAT BUFFET. How the hell can you not want to eat here?

if i ate here every week I would be so fat. But i CRAVE their food. I know what your thinking, Indian Buffet = cheap crusty chana masala and tough cold nan. Not the case here.. First of all, they have tons of veggie options, which like any good indian place, they should, especially if they are Sihk. I was incredibly annoyed last night however when I went in to spend my $8 like a baller and had to listen to the girl next to me who was on some college double date from hell ask repeatedly to the staff "does this have animal byproducts in it??? Does this have dairy???". Okay retard, you're vegan.....WE GET IT ALREADY!!! Now SHUT THE FUCK UP AND EAT THE DAAL!!!!!

seriously, why are some 'vegans' so damn annoying? No wonder people roll their eyes. At first I thought maybe she just was allergic to dairy, but when she spit out the 'animal byproduct' line, I knew what we were dealing with. How can you live in the city, be in your mid to late 20's and not know that the majority of indian food is Vegetarian and that cheese is a huge component in the food? And I'm saying all of this as a vegetarian who eats vegan about 40% of the time. Cause ain't nothin gonna stop me from the Veggie Korma at star of india. Korma is probably the best invention of all time. I would bathe in Korma daily if only it were possible.

So yeah, if you like tasty Indian food and don't have a ton of cash to spend. Hit up the Buffet at this location. You will not be dissapointed. The tea and rice pudding is included and the Naa'n comes out hot and they consistently replace and replenish all the dishes and there are about 5 different veggie options. it is my all-time guilty pleasure.
author: K B.

description: Solid Indian food  and good service.  We ordered off the menu, but the buffet looked good as well. Naan was good, but not the best we've had. Would go back again for sure.
author: Meg L.

description:
I woke up this morning for my EMP.  I was amazed by the interesting smell it emitted and I remembered the meal I had last night at Star India.

Awesome Indian buffett for 8 BUCKS!  (That's right, they have not changed their price of $7.97 plus tax, since they raised it by 2 cents from a while back).   There are at least 10 items and all of them are delicious!  There are fried samosas, great chicken tikka masala, tandoori chicken, fresh mint and tamarind chutney, korma, spinach aloo, garlic naan, salad, rice, lamb dish (but didn't have this).... the chai tea was good too.  They got some perfectly fried papadum too.  Papa Dum preach... I'm in trouble deep....

 Utensils are clean!  Water glasses are clean!  Plates are clean!  this place is a STEAL!  There are interesting wall paintings too... there are two pseudo PG-13 ones on the right, near the front door, but don't take the kids at that one corner with that particular rated R painting.

Of course, mind the amount of food you put in your mouth (and don't forget to get those lovely sugarwater-infused brown balls and milky rice for dessert) since it is a buffet.  It'll try to greet you back in unpleasant moist burps, tinged with acidic overtones.
author: Grace M.

description:
I am vegetarian so I can only speak to those dishes...

There is absolutely nothing wrong with their buffet, at least when I went at 7:45 on a week night.  Fantastic vegetable korma.  Fantastic chana masala.  The food was hot and did not appear to have been sitting out.

Why people gotta be knockin' this place?  I plan to go back for lunches constantly since its in my hood and I work from home, plus its cheap and its FAST when you eat buffet style.
author: Chris B.

description:
This review 
is long overdue
Their delivery is fast
A pleasant repast
Still quite hot
Inexpensive, not
But tasty and delicious
I am sure, nutritious
Their veg coconut curry divine
And pratha texture so fine
Tikka Masala chicken spicy and good
Order from Star India when craving yummy food
author: Liz B.

description:
I'm upping it to a four now.  Got delivery.  Very efficient online ordering system.  

Still pricey, though.  

Prawn korma, fish curry, chicken tikka masala.  Safe selections with lots of sauce.  Lasted me three meals.
author: Mrs F.

description:
Ha. So I read the Yelp reviews and my expectations were this:

1) Decent - not the best ever - Indian food.
2) Friendly staff

That was it. Not much, eh? And I am easily pleased so to be this underwhelmed by a restaurant takes some doing. First of all, the daal. Why did it have beans in it? Lentils are a pretty delicately flavoured food; they definitely didn't need to be overwhelmed by another, more boisterous protein. Secondly, the korma and the vegetable curry both had mushrooms in it. I love mushrooms but I find them incongruous with Indian food. 

Alone, these aren't terrible faux pas. But combine them with the server forgetting to offer us the dessert  that came with the vegetarian thali (then having the nerve to say that he was waiting on us to call him after we'd already been sitting, dinner plate-free, for over twenty minutes) and - the piece de resistance - charging us extra for our korma because they had given us the old menu with the old prices. It was only an extra dollar but the lack of apology was galling.

Being disappointed by this place really sucks because there's a dearth of Indian restaurants in the Inner Richmond. Sigh. And sigh again.
author: Korrena B.

description:
This is the reason why I cannot lose weight. Affordable prices, and most delicious ground lamb (don't know name) over aloo gobi. Drooling as I speak.

My daughter always gets a mango lassi, in fact she learned to say it before her 15 month birthday.

Never change Star India! Your Buffet rocks!
author: Claudia J.

description: Food is good here but Michelle is right, the waiters are very slow and also slow to react when you try to tell them something. Lunch buffet is very reasonable and good and there isn't a crowd even though the Indian Consulate is right around the corner.
author: Anita L.

description: We have been here twice and although the naan and dessert is the best, the rest of the food was way too spicy hot for us.  The tandory chicken was tasteless. Even the lamb dish was too spicy.  I believe their food tastes real good, but the burning of the mouth takes away the taste.  I noticed nonIndians come here, so I am sure they would prefer nonspicy items.  I recommend either tone down the spicyness or have a couple dishes that don't burn the mouth.  In San Mateo there are two Indian restaurants, Bombay Gardens is always packed because the food is mild on the spice.  The other one much less busy because they are too spicy.  These owners should come to Bombay Gardens and taste the tandory chicken & other items and try to replicate them.  In short, they should cater to their customers' taste and that equal mild on the spice.
author: donald l.

description:
I probably should not order Indian food on a whim anymore. Seriously, it's just too expensive to crave randomly. Star India is no exception. I did a delivery take out so I'm only going to cover the food itself. Kudos to the delivery guy he was nice. Onto the food - 

- the garlic nan was pretty blah. They threw enough saffron on the bread to drive home the idea that it wasn't just plain nan. I should also point out, I couldn't really taste the garlic but the bright yellow bread was a reminder.
- Lamb Rogan Josh was ok. Nothing spectacular but tasty enough. A little too heavy on the tomato? I don't know what they put in it but it did look like lamb in marinara sauce.
- Samosas! Hells yeah. Err hells no. Waaay too salty!  No no no!

I suppose it's not worse than what I've experienced in SF so far (wrt indian food) so I'm ok giving it an A-ok rating.
author: Janelle C.

description:
I love Indian food!!! and Star India is great. I checked out grub hub and decided to get a bit of take out. I was hungry and so I order a lot of food. (don't judge me, It all was great!) I started with the Vegetarian Combination and the samosa's are crispy potato goodness. I then moved to the main course where I combined the Channa Masala I decided to have it a little spicier and ordered it hot!!! Wow was it good. The Lamb Korma was creamy, savory & tender. I'm not sure why I ordered lamb, I was just compelled to give it a try and boy was I glad I did. 

There take out menu will be at the top of my short list when I'm in the mood for Indian food.
author: Alex T.

description: Great food, basic selections, but very tasty. Service excellent. definitely going back.
author: Madalene M.

description: I was expecting more from this place. The food was alright. It got the job done but not much more.
author: Darius A.

description:
Star India is a great option for Indian food delivery. Ordering online is very easy, they call you back to confirm the order and delivery time, and the food is pretty good. 

I've been pretty happy with everything I've ordered here. I haven't had anything really special, but everything has been tasty. I usually get the non-vegetarian dinner for two and add a dish or two. They never give you enough naan - one piece, with a dinner for two? The tandoori chicken is good, very moist and flavorful. It would be nice if the lamb koorma came with a little bit more lamb in it. The food has always been consistent for me.

Delivery can be a bit tricky, especially for a meal that comes with so many sauces. Once my order came without the dipping sauces for the samosa, and the samosas aren't nearly as good without the sauce. The container for the tandoori chicken needs to be wrapped to contain the oil, but one time my order came without the wrapping, so oil got all over every container in the bag. But over all, they do a decent job, and the prices are reasonable, so I keep ordering from this place.
author: Erin Y.

description:
I have mixed feelings about this place. I used to go just because it was the closest buffet to my old house. I have taken two people there and both claim the atmosphere was depressing. They likened it to the kind of place you got to when you don't want to be seen.

I have to admit the people who were there were quite nice. The food is OK. The Tikka Masala is not so good. Kind of tastes like Campbell's tomato soup. Whatever. I probably won't eat here again just because there are so many other places that are just flat out better. Meh
author: Zac H.

description: Delivery for a large order was very speedy and they followed our instructions for plates and utensils accurately. Food was ok, but definitely not that great. Naan a bit dry, chicken not well cooked, mango lassi meh.
author: Janet J.

description: Went here with a few friends not too long ago.  Never had Indian food buffet style before, so this was an interesting experience.  Very much enjoyed the garlic naan bread and lamb.  Will be coming back in the future!
author: Serge S.

description:
Star India has a reasonably-priced lunch and dinner buffet for eight bucks and change. The chicken masala was flavorful and tasty with large chunks of chicken. The lamb curry wasn't as successful, with small chunks of lamb clinging to bones and a greasy sauce. The rice and naan didn't impress, although I didn't try the herbed naan they offered. There were vegetarian dishes and samosas, which were good, but unimpressive.

All in all, the meal was a good value, so if you're looking for a buffet in the Richmond, here it is.
author: Timothy O.

description:
This place is pretty fantasic when you are hungry, tired and experiencing Indian food cravings.  Their location in the inner Richmond allows for easy enough parking, and the restaurant itself is warm and cozy.  I've only ever gotten the buffet here, because, well, why wouldn't I when it's only $7.97?  

Usually when I go out to eat I'm not that hungry because I can't really plan ahead for my hunger.  So, I'll be starving, plan to go out to eat and then eat before I go because I've let myself get so famished.  I know, I need to learn to control this.  But until I do, I can go to Star India, walk right in and make a beeline for the buffet, and start my feast straightaway.  

The food is pretty damn good.  I don't eat meat and there are myriad* other options--and it's super cheap.  Go here and eat when you're hungry--you won't be sorry.

One star missing because it's a little weird having the waiter stand on the buffet platform peering down at everyone while they eat.

*see "myriad" posting
author: kelly m.

description:
I have never actually eaten IN this restaurant, or even been TO it, I only get take-out.
With that said, I love this place! You can order online and they'll call to confirm. Technology is amazing. 
I have an unfortunately LOW tolerance for spicy foods but I love curry so I always order my mild EXTRA mild. It still makes my eyes water a bit but it is very yummy. There delivery is generally the exact time they estimate. Overall, this is the only Indian food place I get delivery from because they always pull through.
author: Emily H.

description:
I like this place. I really do. Came here last night for the dinner buffet and left satisfied. The price for 2 was less than $20. Can't go wrong. 

The food was a bit cold. Warmish cold. The Naan wasn't baked, looked like it was steamed. Didn't mind when I dipped it. I like my food hot. The flavor was awsome. I love their yogurt sauce mixed with my rice and sides. I'll come back soon, gotta invite my cousins and friends too. 

Been going to Naan and Curry and now, this is the new hangout spot.
author: David L.

description:
I go here because it's convenient, the buffet's cheap and the food's not bad.  

The interior is what it is.  It has the potential to be like one of those Chinese restaurants where there's a fine film of oil on everything... but they're trying hard with decor and colorful (if not nipple-y) wall paintings.  You gotta give em some credit for that!

The samosas are always better when ordered special rather than taken off the buffet table.  And it's not even that they're cold - they're just made tastier. 
Some decent veggie dishes (the standards are saag paneer and navratan korma) and OK meat (from what I hear).  Chai's so-so.  The Gulab Jamun are perfect - not super sweet 'n syrupy.   Now that's hard to find!

Warm and spicy, yes, but I continue on my quest for the perfect Indian restaurant!
author: Rashmi N.

description:
I was driving east on Geary looking to make a U-turn to get some take out from one of the five hundred Korean barbecues in this part of the Richmond when the sweet aroma of cumin from the Star of India snagged me like a leash tethered between a tree and a dog that had taken off for a squirrel far beyond the reach of the leash.

Aborting my u-turn abruptly much to the ire of honking drivers in my way, I found parking and jaunted to Star of India to get a quick curry fix to go.

I love Indian restaraunts. I think I love them much in the way that clinical sexaholics crave dubious, unsafe liasons with complete strangers. I love the first step into dimly lit, dark paisly wall paper establishments as Bollywood pop music enraptures my senses. Coriander, cumin and cardamom in the air invade my veins like crack cocaine and I can't wait for the first bite.

Far in the back is the all you can eat buffet at the very reasonable rate of $8.95 for Lunch AND Dinner too! The spread is not the most impressive but it has all the core staples of lamb curry, chicken tikka masala, various pakoras, paneers, tandooris and naan. Unlike many of the other Indian buffets I've been to, they also have spicy papadoms on the buffet table! I feel sorry for everyone who's ever died before having tried at least one papadom.

Since I was getting to go, a very dry restaraunt manager said that I was allowed two ladles from each dish. With eight to ten different dishes, my to go box wouldn't be able to fit all that food!

My only critique is that Star India does not quite have the variety that most other buffets offer. The food although quite delicious has a little room for improvement.

Because Star India provides the buffet for both Lunch and Dinner, this is a recommended restaurant for newcomers to Indian cuisine to give them a chance to try several things at once. Veterans of curry will not find dissapointment either!
author: Stuart Y.

description:
I miss the location on POLK st. Hopefully they return :)
Even though my last experience was a bit gassy....I love love love indian food after eating at this place. Make sure you order from Star India, not India Palace...we made the mistake of ordering on-line and it went through India Palace.
author: Jarrod R.

description: We had a great time!  All 13 of us!  Plenty of food (buffets can run out of food with such a large crowd).  Service was great, food tasty, good variety and the staff/owner were really nice and attentive!   We even stayed until closing time around 10:30 pm on Sunday.  Everyone had a wonderful time there!
author: Marian L.

description:
not many places serve indian buffet for $8.99 for lunch AND dinner.  That deserves an extra star right there, cuz sometimes you want cheap all you can eat Indian food for the evening.  Food is good, and there is wide variety of the usual dishes: naan, Tandoori chicken, saag, samosas, chai, etc.

Now for the longest while (over 15 years), I avoided this place like the plague.  reason was one time in the 90's, I had a nice lunch with my family (no buffet at that time, but still good), and I get up to go to the bathroom.  Right there, hanging out in the hallway was a roach.  Just sitting there, saying "Yo, what up dude."

For the past five years, my wife has been bugging me to give this another try, and I'm glad i did.  No roaches greeting me in the hallway.
author: Jane C.

description:
On a recent trip, I learned that buffet restaurants in England advertise "All You Care to Eat" instead of "All You Can Eat."  It makes quite a difference, when you think about it -- that all-American challenge to eat until you're sick for one low price just isn't there.

I was hungry when I arrived at Star India, and I definitely went at that buffet American-style. It was delicious -- sure, not the most amaaaaazing Indian food ever, but it was pretty darn good for the price.  A nice selection of kormas, masalas, and saags, with veggie and meat options.  

It's serviced by the famous 38, as well as the convenient 33, and if it's not too foggy and windy, the Arguello bike lane is also a nice way to get there.  I'll definitely be back the next time I want to see how much food I can stuff my face with for $8.
author: Megan D.

description:
Went with my ashram girl to the Indian Consulate for her visa and grabbed the lunch buffet afterward.  Well done buffet, good for veggies and omnivores alike.  All very basic (chicken tikka masala, saag paneer, samosa, etc.) but delicious and fresh.  The paintings and the Bollywood music gives this place a vibrant atmosphere, and the service is very prompt, courteous, and attentive.  

My friend and I ate a couple of platefuls of the buffet over the course of about 45 minutes, but we talked for at least 2 hours, and they kept refilling our water glasses and never once gave us the stink-eye.  This was even after the Indian Consulate had closed and they were doing brisk business.  Many of the Indian families I saw over at the Consulate were coming in to eat -- if that's not a yardstick for good authentic food, I don't know what is.
author: saudade s.

description:
The Chili Chicken House Special tasted great and spicy enough but the Tandoori chicken was a disappointment. 

I also wasn't crazy about the fact that it took almost an hour to get my food delivered. Oh well guess next time I won't order during lunch time.

I would try the other Indian place before I would reorder at this place.
author: arleen r.

description:
This is one of my favorite Indian restaurants in town. It has a great buffet for $10 which has a fantastic variety of vegetarian dishes.

I have also ordered apart from the buffet. I ordered aloo gobi, vegetable korma, and saag paneer. All have been very good. The aloo gobi was prepared especially well. The califlower was perfect, not over or under cooked, and the spices in the sauce were blended with care; very good, a solid four stars.  I also really enjoy their spicy mint sauce.

The staff is also kind and friendly, which always has made my dining experiences pleasant.
author: Christa B.

description:
I was told that this place was pretty good for Indian take out.  So I went to their web site an used their online ordering system.  the system told me that I should receive a confirmation  call in 10-15 minutes.....well after about 30 minutes I called them up, and they told me that they did not receive my order.. So I placed my order with the person on the phone.  

They then phoned me up 3 times to make ask me my address again and again (I am not sure what the issues was I live in a well known area of town).  

After about an hour of waiting for my food I call then (not including the 30 minutes  I was waiting for the initial online order that was lost).  They then told me the driver was around the corner and that he would be there in 5-10 minutes.  I waited for another 30 minutes (2 hours now since I first placed my order).  

I then called to see why my meal was so delayed.  The person on the phone told me once again they would only be 5-10 minutes.... at this point I said I was very dissatisfying with the service and wanted to make a complaint.  At this point the person on the phone hung up on me...

I then got a cal 20 minutes later asking me my address again, regardless to say I canceled my order...

I would say DO NOT ORDER FROM HERE!!!!!

There are tons of way better places in the city.
author: Andrew S.

description:
Wow, I am sad to give only one star to any place. The menu was there on the stairs (in front of our house) and I saw the Indian Pizza so I figured it was worth a shot. The food supply was low at home, and I wanted something warm. We ordered several items thinking we would have it for lunch and dinner. Big mistake. I barely got through it, any of it. The pizza was so bad. Bland, soggy, no flavor...like eating cardboard. Everything else was runny and unfortunately useless. Translation, barely edible.

Masala Indian on 9th, bet/Irving & Lincoln is good. No delivery, dine-in and take-out only.
author: Sarah B.

description:
I don't think I have ever been to a restaurant which is so indifferent to Indians than this place. The food is cold, and when you go to take the food from buffet, the waiter tells you, please don't take too much, we do not like to waste!!! Well I am here at this place to eat and am hungry AND am paying $9.95 per person for buffet, which has not many options, cold, and odd tasting. This place is NOT kid friendly. The waiters are really mean and don't care. Even if you are ready to spend money, they don't care. They are more interested in greeting others(I mean the whites), than taking orders. Stupid racist restaurant!!!! Shame on them. 
And the worse thing, the food tasted awful!!!!!! I had to keep reminding myself, I am eating Indian food!!!!
author: Smita P.

description: If you order from the menu the coconut curry is to die for. Also for a great desert try the mango yogurt drink!
author: Eric H.

description:
I was working at the Presidio Branch Library this past summer. 
For dinner, my coworkers recommended Star India. For $8, you get an all you can eat meal. The restaurant is quite small and the buffet selection is limited. I did enjoy the curry chicken while I was there. I didn't really like the chicken tandoori because there were only 3 pieces to choose from at the buffet table and they were looking dry.  The service there was pretty attentive which was good.

I recommend Star India if you have a few hours to dine. Its a nice place to go for a Saturday or Sunday afternoon food binge. I say take it slow, order a beer and take frequent trips to the buffet table.  And be sure to get the chicken curry over basmati rice.
author: Sam T.

description:
Very satisfied with the chicken tikka masala and naan (only dishes I have tried).

The chicken tikka masala is on par with most others I have tried in this price range in SF and the portions are generous (one serving for $10.95 could serve two people if you get rice or naan to go with). 

I haven't been to the actual restaurant but the online ordering/delivery system is very efficient.
author: Hunter P.

description:
So this place doesn't have the best Indian food. But for $10 per person for their buffet, the food is pretty damn good. The fried veggies are kind of cold and hard, but everything else is nice. The meat is well prepared, and unlike some places I've gone to, they don't use chicken breast (which is awesome because their chicken is not dry!!!). They give complementary naan, and you can get daal soup and chai as well (both by the buffet). 

The service is great too. Usually, when my husband and I go there, it's pretty empty. We receive attentive and quality service. 

For all of this, I give it 4 stars. 

If I can change a few things though I'd totally change the decor. I hate the carpet, and the table covers. It does seem very dark and gloomy because of them (maroon colored). I like the art though, and I like that they play Indian music. 

This is my go-to place in the inner-richmond area.
author: Katia T.

description:
So this is the 2nd time I order food from them. Last time was about 6 months ago and I have to say that their food was pretty decent. 

So this weekend, I decided to order from them again. . . I ordered online at 6pm. I called back at 630pm bc it says on the website that youre supposed to get a confirmation call. I did not. They said they received my order. 7pm rolls around, and I get another call that they did not receive my order. I tell them what I want again. 730pm- I get a call from the driver saying that he is lost- he is at ** and ***** which is my OLD address. I told him 10 times where I currently live and he says that he has to call his manager to confirm. I was not too happy. I FINALLY get my food at 815pm and it wasnt even that great. 

:(
spinach and cheese = too many cloves
chana masala= too many cloves, too oily
naan= soggy 
lentil soup= good
author: Alicia V.

description:
I'm appalled to come back three years later and see that this place still only gets 3.5 stars. It is FANTASTIC! I went here again for the first time in several years, and I was seriously questioning whether it would be as good as I remembered.  Maybe I was just young and easy to please back then, thought I. Maybe it was because in 2008 I was just beginning a new relationship and was starry-eyed and overly optimistic about life.  Maybe I saw it all with rose-colored glasses.  

But no. In 2011, this place stands out as hands down having the best Saag Paneer. EVER. ANYWHERE. Since 2008 I have lived in New York, Atlanta, San Francisco, and Berkeley, and a few other places. Hands down, best Saag Paneer. And best rice pudding. Ev-er. 

Advice to other reviewers: perhaps you should stop trying delivery. Come when it's fresh, around 5:30, and it will blow your mind. 

Other hints: vegetarians: it may seem that there are "not enough" vegetarian options because they have several meat dishes in the buffet. But come on dude, the options that are there are OUTSTANDING. Saag Paneer, mentioned above, is orgasmic. Vegetable korma comes a close second. You will also find samosas, salad, yummy naan, and, as mentioned before, amazing rice pudding. 

I wish I was all-powerful enough to independently raise this place's yelp star rating, because they deserve applause, and they truly deserve more customers to come and appreciate the gift of great food they give to the world every day.
author: Laura A.

description: This rating is for the lunch buffet, which is all that I've sampled. We've tried several Indian buffets in San Francisco and the East Bay, and this was by far the best. Every dish we tried was good, but the lamb and what was probably a vegetable curry were my top favorites. The naan, which wasn't quite as puffy as we're used to, was delicious and complemented the saucy dishes very well. My husband is a rice pudding fan, and he happily went back for seconds, even after stuffing himself with the main dishes.
