The people were really nice and accommodating, and the atmosphere was friendly and casual. We'll definitely be back.
author: Karen M.

description:
I have a delivery problem, and Star India is it.  

But I don't even know why I give them all my delivery love--the menu is juuuuust overpriced enough to leave me feeling cheap and used.  The tikka masala is juuuuuuuust greasy enough that I'm left groping for the pepto.  The sag paneer is juuuuuuust shy of having a decent number of paneer cubes.  

But when I see their menu rubber-banded to my doornob, I neeeeeeed the nan.  So, three stars for meeting the need, but more than that would be undeserved without a little extra ... something.
author: Ann M.

description:
This place is definitely okay.  Not amazing Indian food, but decent.  It's really 3 stars for the food + 1 more for the price.  The all you can eat dinner buffet is $10, and though the curries are a little runny they still have a decent amount of flavor.  

As someone else said, they have papadams in the buffet which was fantastic.  They also have samosa, pakora, and this fried fish nugget thing.  When I went they also had a great okra dish, a less exciting navratan korma, and a not very good at all vegetarian gluten cooked in curry.  The naan was a little chewy too, but probably because it had been sitting out for a bit.  For dessert, there was kheer and gulab jamun.  They also include chai with the buffet.

Overall for the price, I was quite impressed.
author: Joann C.

description: First of all Indian food is my favorite! So I will try not to be to bias! Overall the food is ok I've had better and worse. The service is decent. I like when they bring the naan bread when you first start your meal instead of in the middle or end of it! Good things to note about this restaurant is the free naan bread and free chai tea! The buffet is inexpensive too!
author: Jerad T.

description: We used to get delivery from here fairly often. I like all of the dishes fine, and the delivery is ok. My main problem was that any chicken dish had pretty large chunks of chicken that prohibited the sauce and seasoning from permeating much of the meat, so it often ended up kind of bland and dry. I've prefer Little Delhi partially because it's closer to us but also for its ease of ordering, and I think the food is consistently better.
author: Lisa K.

description: I hate to do this, but i got pretty bad food poisoning from the Chicken vindaloo here...such a shame, but they are officially on the "AVOID" list.
author: Dustin E.

description:
I have been eating at Star India for years. They are listed as one of my last meals. I always order the same thing "Saag Paneer" and Chili Cheese Naan. Creamy, Spicy ,Goodness....ah I can taste it now.  Wash it down with a Mango Lassi or a Taj Mahal and you are set.

My only negatives about this place....  parking can suck. Their hours during the weekdays are limited. I want lunch on a Wednesday Afternoon.

They do not deliver West of Twin Peaks. I hate schlepping over to Geary for food. It is worth it though.
author: Infodiva B.

description:
Maybe my 4 star rating has spawned from my distress that there really aren't a lot of Indian restaurants to choose from in my area. In fact, I walk about 8 blocks to get here (which is very strange for me, bc I am normally a very sedentary person. And by sedentary I mean lazy as all hell). 

But the reason I walk the 8 blocks is so that I don't feel bad when I get plate after plate of delicious Indian food. I have eaten so much here that after awhile I don't even enjoy it anymore, and I'm just sitting there, sad and overly full. 

And yes, I am a pescatarian, but it is here that I allow myself to be someone that PETA would hate: I indulge with the Chicken Tikka Masala. Yes, I said it: I'm a pescatarian, as well as a sometimes-pollotarian. And yes, I realize this isn't a word but whatev. 

The point is, you can have all you can eat Indian food for only $8+tax. That's amazing! And sure the service is nonexistent even if you order a drink and they never bring it bc they perhaps aren't used to anyone actually ordering anything, but hey... that's neither here nor there.

The Chicken Tiks is just that good. So think about that tender meaty goodness and give it a try. You won't regret the price, but you may regret the muffin top you get afterwards. But that's why you should walk from home, after all.
author: Bel P.

description:
I like (well, LIKED) Star India a lot until one of their waitors hit on me.  I was eating alone that night, enjoying the buffet.  The waitor seemed to think that a woman eating alone equals an invitation to perpetrate.  So he hovered over me and started asking questions beginning with what is my ethnic background and then progressing to where do I live and where does my boyfriend live?  I never said I had a boyfriend.  I am so creeped out now, I never want to eat there again.

This is the second time something like this has happened at an Indian restaurant.  I had to stop eating at Naan N Curry because this one particular waitor kept hitting on me.  He would send free food over to me and ask for my number.

Aside from the wait staff, the food is pretty good, esp. considering the price for an all-you-can-eat buffet.  They seem to have more choices than the other buffets I have been to.  I really like their benghan bartha (eggplant)--better than any other restaurant.  

I am so torn--I want to go back, but not if it means enduring being harassed by the wait staff.
author: Kandi K.

description: Nothing special here.  Bland. Try Indian Oven on Waller or Shalimar or Pakwan.
author: gary l.

description: Worst Indian I've had in SF, by far.  Saag paneer was green soup.  Chicken biryani was mediocre.  Service was almost nonexistent, and when it happened to pass by, listless.
author: Ari M.

description: This is a great inexpensive indian restaurant!  We got takeout and yelp won us a free mango ice cream and also a discount.  This place has huge takeout portions and lots of good spicy food for a decent price.  Great for takeout at least!
author: Akshai B.

description: My friends and I were craving for some Indian cuisine as we were driving down Geary and we saw the Star India buffet. Dinner buffet is $9.99 and offers a wide variety of dishes. The place is nice and cozy, service is good and the food is fresh. Curries are my favorite there and so is the flat crispy bread. Good place to go if your craving Indian in San Francisco.
author: Matthew L.

description:
Unlike most people I have not taken part in the Indian buffet. I usually order the chicken saagwala (mild), keema naan, and an order of white rice. MmmTasty! In fact, I'm going to go warm up that left over naan right now! 

The only thing I don't get is... are there ice rations or something? 
Why do I have to ask for more ice EVERYTIME?
author: D. Miguel G.

description:
No flavor, and the food was cold.
$10 for all you can eat IS a good deal, but you are really getting what you pay for at this place.  
Give it a miss.  
If you want to gorge on Indian Buffet, head across the park to Curry Village.
author: oliver b.

description: Two days before a Diwali party (Indian Festival of Lights), I ordered 30 samosas. I was given a price quote that was very competitive compared with that of other local Indian restaurants. I changed the pick up time twice and the restaurant staff was very accommodating. Even though I had to travel across the Bay Bridge, the samosas remained crispy on the outside. They were flavorful and delicious, and were devoured as soon as they were served!
author: Steve H.

description:
Cozy restaurant and at 10 bucks a pop for the buffet you won't break the bank trying a large variety from their menu. The quality of food is great and everything is fresh because they replenish often in small doses. Love love love everything on their table.

Service is attentive. Its always great when they can remember you from a few days ago. They were friendly and chatty at the beginning but once we got down to business and hit the food they gave us our space and let us run course. Our plates were cleared quickly and our waters were refilled in discretion - like ninjas had hit our table. Now THAT is what I call service ;)
author: Candy C.

description: Freshman 15? More like 30 thanks to Star of India's amazing all you can eat, cheap ass buffet. Damn sooo good but so fatty. I ate here way too often when I wanted Indian food but was too lazy to cook it myself (I'm Indian and I can cook some delish chicken curry). The service is shabby, there's shady people hanging out outside but the food is great for Indian-American food.
author: Naz A.

description:
One starving post-Academy of Sciences day, drawn in by the $9.99 buffet sign outside and smell of India from a block away my boyfriend and I ended up here, at Star India. The inside was dim and even though there was a good amount of people dining it was practically silent. During dinner I felt like I had to whisper across the table to talk, not the liveliest of environments that's for sure. 

The buffet selection was decent, I enjoyed the masala and endless amounts of naan, my fav. I could only manage to eat one plate, my bf, 2. Leaving the restaurant was difficult because our stomachs were so overly bloated and we didn't feel like we'd completely digested everything for the next couple hours. 

I think I'd probably venture out to this place again if I were in the neighborhood, but I don't know if I'd make plans to come here again. Not bad, but not great.
author: Nicole L.

description:
I went here on a Sunday afternoon with a group of 6 and I would definitely go there again.  

The food was absolutely delicious.  I tried their lamb kima (ground lamb with indian spices, their BEST dish), chicken tikka masala,  and Naan.  All were absolutely delicious.  The curry had a perfect level of spice and was not greasy.  We also ordered their home-made indian style mango and vanilla ice-cream, which was to die for.  
The atmosphere was nice as well,  they were playing some beautiful indian music to set the mood, but not too loud so you can have a nice conversation with whoever you're with.  Also, most of the plates are under $10 dollars, so very easy on the wallet.

This is going to be my go to indian place from now on.
author: V P.

description:
Good indian food.  Not great, but good.  Their marsala chicken was good, the curry lamb  was not that great.
Their Naan bread was delicious.

Come in here and get stuffed for only 7.97   (ok, it is 8.60 with tax), so about $10 with tip.

Peachy....
author: Ardit B.

description: Lunch buffet is a good deal. I only really ate the tikka masala, rice, and plain naan. All were good to me. Good place to just fill up and jet when you want something creamy and salty. Milk tea was good. Rice pudding with donut holes was awesome too haha I'd come back here again for lunch just for these things!
author: Timothy L.

description:
Went with a friend who raved about this place.  The quick and easy answer is that this place is 'okay' with wait staff that are friendly and good about clearing plates and refilling glasses.

Overall, for a buffet I would agree with most of the reviews that say that it's not bad. The chicken tikka masala, tandori chicken, lamb curry, and  were good but left me remembering other Indian places that had more spice and flavor. I loved the garlic flavored naan and didn't even try the offered regular naan or the crispy bread thingies.  Rice was offered but I didn't sample any.  Unlike other Indian buffets I have seen, this one had a spicy soup which was okay.  They also offer chai tea which was wonderful because they kept it quite hot.  My only complaint was my  same complaint for most buffets; I would prefer the food to be warmer and fresher but this is something that cannot be helped in this type of setting.

All of this said, I would go back again.  The $10 for all you can eat, really is a steal.
author: Jonnathan C.

description: Unfortunately yelp doesn't let 1/2 a star be set. The 1/2 star would be for the table and chair, & the oxygen to breath. If you don't want to be poisoned, don't go to this place. Their food looks and tastes synthetic. The waiters have no idea what they are talking and doing. We asked for recommendation & we were asked to select first! Just after we asked for the check, the waiter came to our table and blew out the candle before any more wax was "wasted" on us! We ordered dum aloo (it was a dangerously red curry of potato), which really didn't look like it had anything natural in it other than the potato (hopefully!). The desi style salad was a joke..we couldn't eat it when it looked like it was collected off of trash. It is a horrible place.
author: Shilpa H.

description:
i come to this place pretty regularly as its close to my office and convenient. the food is ok, and sometimes good. 

my gf's and i went to this place today and 2 of us 3 did not 'feel it'. dont ask us why but my gf and i felt as if the food had less kick today. 

my favorite is the chicken tikka masala, naan and gulab jamun. and of course the free tea. 

the staff is friendly and they know my family :)

one less star cos this place can also be a 'hit or miss' in taste.

TIP: want free parking? drive on Anza and u will find plenty of parking IF u go there on WEEKDAYS.
author: Elly G.

description:
Pretty good Indian food, especially for the price. They have a very cheap $8 buffet! Great naan, curries are pretty standard. Masalas, vindaloos, paneers. The papadams and samosa are pretty good. The tandoori chicken is delicious. Tender and full of flavor. I like the rice pudding dessert, and the fried dough dipped in sweet sauce.

I like to order for delivery too, for when I don't leave the house. They deliver within the hour, and is still reasonably priced, especially if you get one of their two set meals. (Vegetarian and non-vegetarian.)

Service is pretty good. They like to refill our water a lot. :P 

Their walls have painted pictures of boobular Indian women! You can't beat that!
author: Bekki J.

description:
DAMN. 

inexpensve (7.97 or something) for the buffet
quality food. all bomb diggities. hella selection up in here for the buffet.
paintings of hunnies with big tittes.

what more could a man want?
author: Victor B.

description:
I LOVE their buffet - it's fabulous, and it's cheap!  I also really love their chicken korma, lamb korma, mattar paneer.  Delivery is relatively quick - I've waited about 30-45 minutes, usually no more than that.

Today, I ordered (online) the above three dishes, plus 4 pieces of naan.  The owner called me and asked if I wanted rice with that order.  I declined, but he included rice in my order anyway, free of charge.  How sweet!
author: Dwigt S.

description:
$10 buffet?  Pretty good Indian food?  Well, there you go.

The chicken tika masala is really good, as well as this spinach thing they had at the buffet.  Great for a quick, casual meal.  

And since I live a block away, it's a no-brainer.
author: Sarah F.

description:
Not gourmet but pretty damn good!
We were enticed by the sumptuous scent that filled the area as we walked by.
I asked them "is it buffet everyday?" they said "yes" 
I said "DAMN!".... Tika Masala... That red sauce that tastes like spaghetti-Os, Naan, and Crispy Naan, MilkyRicie dessert, Sweet-ass Donut Holes... And a lot more, $9buck dinner buffet.. If you have a big appetite and want to spend little dough... come here
Free Milk Tea just like Tasty Curry.
author: JASON L.

description:
I kind of feel like I should give 2 reviews.  One for the first several times we got delivery from here, which would get around 4 stars, maybe 4 and a half.  Food was hot, fresh, mostly delicious.

The last time we ordered food from there, though.  Ugh.  I think the lamb was rotten.  We ended up ill.  Sad.  :(
author: GeekGirl X.

description:
Had I written this review before I received my delivery order tonight, I would have given 4 stars. I've never actually eaten in the restaurant, only ordered through delivery and my entire family used to love this place.  Tonight we ordered as we usually do, Nvratan Korma and Paneer Tikka Masala. OMG DISGUSTING. Not only did they raise their prices (understandable I suppose with the state of our economy), but the curry sauces were so extremely watered down I felt like I was eating vegetables in nothing more than mildly seasoned coconut milk. 

Did they change cooks? Normally their food is awesome, but I will NEVER order for delivery from there again. Indian food tends to be a bit on the expensive side. And I just wasted $40 on dinner for my mom and I. 

The only redeeming quality they have is a buffet for $8.95 That I MAY try in the future because not everything can be that bad and I'd rather potentially waste $8.95 than $40. Im in search of a new indian restaurant...
author: Risa R.

description: Do not eat there !   We are a party of 3, so the waiter came by with 3 glasses of water.  Then he asked if we want the special drink.  Then we asked if it is part of the buffet, he said yes.  He came back with 4 drinks.  We asked why 4 drinks, he said it is extra.  When the bill came, he charged for 4 drinks.  They will overcharge you when they can.
author: Hue M.

description:
For $9.50 (including tax) Star India let me feast on as much decent Indian food as I could fit in my ever expanding waist line.  I am by no means an expert on Indian food, so I won't pretend here to know the names of all the dishes or where they fall on the culinary spectrum.  

The Dal Soup was very enjoyable, as were the little fried dessert balls covered in syrup.  And, a little rice pudding always seems to hit the spot.  Most everything I had was enjoyable.

One of the dishes tasted a bit like dirt to me.  It was a pleasant trip back to my childhood with fond memories of exploring the back yard, but wasn't exactly what I was desiring for dinner.  Given it is a buffet I just skipped that option the second time around (and, I'll admit, third time) and focused on the other, in my opinion very good, dishes.

All you can eat for under ten bucks with a lot of solid options.  If you're in the mood for some serious eating and crave Indian check this place out.
author: Kyle J.

description:
This review is for their lunch buffet...

They get high marks for their their vegetable dishes which were flavorful and not cooked to an indistinct mush or saturated with oil like in some other places.

I particularly enjoyed the chick pea curry and the zucchini curry.  

However, their meat dishes left a lot to be desired (not to mention they only had 2 or 3).

They had a minced beef dish that tasted like, well, minced beef. Hardly any seasoning. I didn't get what the point of this dish was.

You could tell the tandoori chicken was not marinated. All the flavoring was on the outside and once you bit in to it, it was just plain chicken.

I might go back again just for the vegetable curries.
author: Gene G.

description:
Truly the only great debate is what curry to have first! The Naan is untouchable, and those fried potato things, although ridiculously filling, are phenomenal. I like to create little curry mountains set atop the other hardier dishes. Then dinner can be finished off with either real Tapioca, and Chai or atomically sweet "donut" balls. We are talking sweeter than anything I know of! Like liquid sugar soaked into dough.  The food  changes little. For most places this is not a big deal, but for an all you can eat, the same six entries no matter how amazing, tire eventually. It is a bit pricey for lunch, but great in the evening with friends.
     As to atmosphere, the employees are very nice. They even gave me tips on excellent Indian movie music to enjoy! All the painting of topless Indian women sure doesn't hurt the appetite either :)
author: Christian M.

description:
If I could give 3.5 stars, I would.

The food is the bomb.

Bengan Bhartha: A+++
Chicken Tikka Masala: A++++
Chicken Saagwala: A++++
Chicken Biryani: A++++
Coconut Chicken: A+++++
Naan: A++++
Basmati Rice: A++++

But the best part? The veggie pakora. I get this delivered with every order as they give you a ginormous portion and tons of delicious Raita with it. It's crispy, textured, and delicious. The potato slices are my favorite. I really do dig this place a lot.

The reason I wouldn't rate it higher is the fact that it IS pricey. Sure, the portions feed about 2 people if you ladle it over rice, but considering the delivery takes 45 minutes to an hour, I would expect naan to be less than $2 for one or the rice to be cheaper or something along those lines.

Great place, though!
author: Chris M.

description:
I liked this place a lot better when it was a few dollars less, but the price keeps going up every few months.

The best part is the free Chai tea, in my opinion.  Their dessert "balls" aren't too bad, either.  My friend likes them so much that he usually eats 6-10 balls.  "Princess," as we call him, will eat just about anything, though.

The Tikka Masala isn't bad when it's fresh, too.  I give them an extra star for not giving me the squirts (every time).
author: Jin D.

description: Star India is really great. My roommate and I order delivery every couple of weeks when we have girls night! Always tastes great. I've been into the restaurant once so far. The buffet was pretty excellent. My Indian lover thinks it's not too bad either, "best buffet I've been to in a while" is what he described it as, perhaps just not the best Indian restaurant in the city. Definitely suggest it if you live in the Richmond!
author: Jennifer P.

description:
the best indian food ive had in the city, nearly the most affordable 

the buffet food (which costs, what, $9 or something?) is just as good as the menu food at half the price. the tikka masala is spot-on. there's always a good variety of vegetarian options. the waiters are friendly when they see you come in often enough.
author: Alison T.

description:
I LOVE this place's buffet - Im giving it 4 stars becuase of the consistent quality - we do the lunch here on the weekends pretty regularly and all the dishes are great.    it is not the best indian I have ever had nbut it IS without a doubt the best naan in the city.   Guaranteed.  I challenge anyone to find lighhter crispier yet still chewey and crunchy  - all ata the same time !! - naan 

Yum yum
author: Rick R.

description:
Chicken Tiki Masala....YUM my favorite and the ground lamb was awesome with the masala curry...and rice.  Items were filled up as they emptied out, even when we came pretty late.  There always seemed to be a steady stream of people till 10pm.

The tandori chicken was DELISH, yum and perfectly cooked with the meat still moist inside.  Other than that, I didn't really try much of anything else as those were my favorites.

Had a bloaty feeling as i walked out, but after 3 plates and the HUGE samosas, that was to be expected.

YUM, full buffet = 10/person
author: Patrick C.

description:
Star has an enormous buffet, with so many dishes that it sort of scared me at first. I mean, how can a restaurant that only has two people eating in it maintain a buffet with 15 items and manage to keep everything fresh?!

That's a rhetorical question -- don't answer.

Everything was fresh enough, and I saw the waiters replacing dishes several times while I was eating. The vegetable korma was delicious, as were the lamb and the chicken masala. The buffet even included salad, samosas, pakoras, stuffed nan, and two kinds of dessert. Don't go if you're not freakin' hungry.

When I first walked in, mariachi music was playing, but the waiters quickly changed to hindi music as soon as I was seated. Personally, I like mariachi, but I thought it was a cute gesture.
author: Ben P.

description:
I call it troughing. 
The buffet in this place is like an addiction of mine. WHY? You just can't get that much yummyness for 8 bucks any where else that I know of. Their Chicken Tikka Massala should be illegal. I shouldn't even be eating dairy! I have recently cut it down to the Tandoori Chicken and rice, what ever the "chef special" is that has lentils..... O.M.G!!! I could SWIM in that. 
NOTE: the art. Too f-kn funny. Kama Sutra style. breasts falling out of little half shirts. jeez. 
Service: these guys will bring you the water until your digestive juices are cut so low you think you're going to die, but don't wait for the bill. stand up and do the sign language for "bill please" or you will just be sitting there until you get hungry again.
author: Roanna Z.

description:
Came here with my girlfriend around 9:30PM thinking we still had an hour to eat their buffet since posted in their website that they close everyday at 10:30PM. As soon as we walk in they tell us that they're closing in less than 30 minutes. Not a "hi", not a "hello, please come in"...but a warning. There was an employee sitting right by the buffet line on a high chair of whom I could only assume was some sort of buffet bouncer since he had on a really tight shirt and was watching the buffet with all focus. I told him I checked out their website and it actually said that they were suppose to close at 10:30PM everyday but he kind of just mumbled under his breath so I just walked away towards the buffet.
The 2 stars Im giving this place goes solely for the amazing  food they offered in the buffet. Everything tasted great, even when there were things I could not really tell if it was meat or vegetable, it still tasted really good. The missing 3 other stars of the five is because they really lacked customer service. They made you feel like you were in some sort of prison camp watching over you and making sure you follow the buffet rules.
author: Ren V.

description:
For the price, this is the best Indian lunch buffet around SF.  One thing I noticed is that the Indian Consulate is literally around the corner from this place, and there are always Indian men coming in and out during lunch.  It's not the greatest Indian food around, but it's hot and tasty.

The waitrons always keep my water filled and plates cleared, attentively.  That's pretty much what you want from a buffet server.
author: Paul B.

description:
Not impressed... but they deliver.

I just paid $31 + tip for dinner for two delivered.  I parted from Rotee because last time we ordered from them they gave us pieces of meat that seemed to be destined for the trash: lots of bones (really lots of bones) and almost no meat at all.

The food  from Star India was OK, could have had more flavor. The lamb meat itself was cooked well (we had the lamb curry, and the pieces of meat were nice, no bones), and the daal was dark (like a makhani) which is the kind I prefer. I won't order the naans again because they are definitely the worst I have ever had.

So for a night with an Indian craving this will do. I won't crave their food per say. Not like a Lahore Karahi, which unfortunately doesn't deliver.
author: Elsa T.

description:
Always in the mood for indian buffet... always.

Minimum criteria for a decent indian buffet:
1) Decent naan.  It better be crispy, hot, and plentiful.
2) Good selection.  If I see less than 5 entree selections, I'm walkin'.
3) Free chai.  Nuff' said.

Star India barely fulfills the criteria.
Ain't much in the way of indian buffets in SF, so I added an extra half-star.

Now stuff yourself silly, you bad boy!
author: Gracie-C Y.

description:
Truth be told I've never been to this restaurant.
But they recently left a menu rubber banded to a branch in front of my place.
I hate getting flyered as it is, but putting them on trees in front of houses and apartments?
I'm not particular liberal but there are certainly hundreds of others places that deserve my dining dollar.
author: Russell C.

description:
Buffets are frightening.

What is more frightening are buffets that no one frequents.

Like Star India.

I bet they just reuse their buffet left overs for weeks on end.
author: Stephanie L.

description:
After downing my last bits of Navratan Korma, I had to express my love for Star India. They have absolutely the best Navratan Korma ever! Every time I go somewhere else, I am just disappointed because no one compares. So creamy and flavorful.

I've gone to their buffet before and you can't get a better deal. I always stuff myself and everything I've had at Star India has been good. The staff is really nice and friendly as well.

The Saag Paneer is my other favorite from there. And people, believe me, I am NOT a vegetarian. If I could have a hunk of steak every night, I would. But everything is so flavorful there, I can actually eat veggie and not miss the meat. Believe me, that's saying a lot.
author: Bonnie H.

description:
I'll keep this short and sweet.  I give the "A-OK" 3 star review which is the average of the food & price and the setting & service.  4 stars goes to the hot and fresh tikka masala (my favorite dish on the entire planet) & naan, the lamb curry, and the samosas while 2 stars goes to the depressing and boldly un-inviting atmosphere.  

Outside of the delicious food, I'm not sure if there's anything else worth mentioning in a positive light, oh yeah - the all you can eat buffet is only $9.99, not bad at all.  I'm pretty sure I'd rather kick it here for the ten bucks rather than get 20 tacos at Jack, but this could change.
author: S M.

description:
Decent indian food at a good price. 7.95 for buffet. i order delivery from them too b/c it is affordable and fresher than the buffet. Online ordering is super easy and convenient. I have also been there for dinner buffet which is good. 
The lunch buffet was dissapointing becuase the trays looked old and there was no rice. Also the food was lukewarm. I would not return for the lunch buffet but will order delivery and maybe go back for dinner.
author: M K.

description:
Great buffet. The price, quality, and service (despite being a buffet) is excellent. I couldn't have asked for a better restaurant in my neighborhood. If you know nothing about indian food and have trouble ordering, give this place a go.

As of September 2007, it's closed for remodeling. Take out is still open. As of September 25, 2007, it's back in business!
author: Wil M.

description:
Great food and excellent value.  I love all the curry flavors.  And the cheese balls with rice pudding are a great way to end your meal, with chai tea that is served with the buffet.

Interior needs updating but adequate.
author: V B.

description: SO I wasn't impressed at all. I give it a two stars for the fact that they deliver for free. The curry was pretty watery and I wanted stuffed paratha not stuffed naan. I'm really familiar with authentic Pakistani and Indian cuisine and I was not at all happy. It took 40 45 minutes... I'm not sure what for the Pakora was cold by the time it got here. Pricey for the amount and taste. I'll go to Naan and Curry on VanNess Any day over this place even with the convenience of delivery. Sorry guys.
author: Jessie J.

description: I was so hungry that I had to load my stomach with whatever I could find. After filling up, I realized I had the worst Indian food ever.
author: Nirmal S.

description:
If you prefer quantity over quality  this is for you.

Most of the food was either bland or out for too long, especially the rubbery nann. It night be better during the weekdays when it sees more customers.

The restaurant itself was kind of run down and the waiter stared at me for the entire time which was off putting to say the least.

I won't be returning.
author: Greg C.

description:
I ordered online at 1:20 and the food arrived at 1:44. I was shocked. It's good food too. 

I've also tried their buffet which is AWESOME.
author: Paige B.

description:
My favorite Indian buffet place ever! 

Where else can you find lunch and dinner buffet, both for 8.95 (was 7.95) and you can pile on all the chicken tikka masala, samosas, and the dessert rice "milk" (I don't remember what it's called) that you want!

Every time I'm in San Francisco, I make it a thing to come to Star India at least once.
author: Cindy W.

description:
I've been to Star India a number of times. It's always been there for the dinner buffet. The selection is really good and the food there is great. Only thing is they don't seem to change it up much, they have the same selections which means it can get a little boring if you eat there too often. However, it would take a while to get boring as the food there is so good! You can smell the Indian Food wafting down Geary for quite a bit, a great aroma!

The ambiance at the restaurant is rather strange. I remember a while ago I was there and they were playing weird ambient music, I think it was a single song on repeat, that made my whole experience rather surreal. A customer complained that they had been playing the song over and over again and they put on some Indian dance music and he said "be careful what you wish for." It wouldn't hurt the staff to cheer up a bit more and be more friendly. Maybe they can take some inspiration from Daler Mehndi whose song "Tunak Tunak" they are fond of playing (check out the video on youtube). The servers there seem to want to provide you with as much water as possible by constantly refilling your glass so you don't eat as much food at the buffet. 

All in all the price and quality of the foods make up for all the Star India's shortcomings.
author: Wilson S.

description:
What the heck was I thinking giving this place only 3 stars???

Maybe it was the valium from my dentist appointment late this afternoon....
Or perhaps it was the 2 cocktails I indulged in at the Yelp Event.....

But Oh.My.Lordy. Their Tikki Masala hits the spot. And, the staff, is incredibly friendly. Love it.
author: Laura D.

description:
I went to Star India for dinner the other day and I really enjoyed the whole experience. We were promptly greeted as soon as we arrived and the wait staff was very attentive throughout the dinner service.

The food was excellent and the quality of ingredients used was top notch. We will be definitely be coming here again!
author: Aman S.

description: Good food, great service, great prices! Star India gets five stars for their all-you-can-eat buffet because its perfect for when you need a quick meal and you need it fast. Their buffet serves up immediate and delicious satisfaction, especially the chicken korma dish which is consistently good. Also, the new management has spruced up the place, with new tables and overall it just feels cleaner. The buffet seems more bountiful, with a few more choices now. We've been coming here for 7 years and will continue to come back when we crave our curries.
author: Brita M.

description: My cousins and I came here for the buffet.  It was pretty decent and had a "larger" spread than some of the other buffets I've tried.  (i.e. GGP).  I usually judge the food quality based on how they cook my favorite dishes:  chicken tikka masala and palak paneer.  Both dishes were ok, pretty average and nothing special.  I did like the fact that they had a few different curries such as the pumpkin curry and lamb curry.  They were both interesting to try and the buffet at $9.99 for dinner was worth the money.
author: Cheryl L.

description: My spouse and I used to come to this restaurant all the time when we lived temporarily in the inner Richmond.  Since then, the cost of the buffet has increased, while the sweet and kind waiter we liked has left.  He's been replaced by some surly waiters who seemed resentful of our business.  Based on the wait staff, and the fact that the food on the buffet looked less than fresh (even though we were there before 1 p.m.), I would have given this place just two stars.  However, their take out is fine.  So from now on, we'll stick to the delivery option.  My spouse loves the Indian pizza and says the spinach sauce on it is delicious.
author: Susan L.

description:
If you're in the mood for staying in, being comfy at home and going on a movie marathon,  then try Star India.  

It wasn't the best Indian cuisine I've ever had or anything but it was quick, decent, and satisfactory. The chicken tikka masala was pretty good, even the next day!

You can easily order online and they delivery in super speedy time!
author: Candice M.

description: We went for lunch dinner, I was very surprised to know that they wont accept restaurant.com coupons which was also disappointing.Secondly we were 6 people in the buffet and we were charged 18% gratuity for buffet and this is more surprising. Food was also not upto the mark. Not a good place.
author: Ashrith O.

description:
That picture's scary.

--The foods pretty good, but the guys on the phone act like assholes and make me never want to call in an order again.
author: yvette l.

description:
After I got my "Star India" flyer, I decided to give their delivery a try.  

I ordered the non-vegetarian dinner for 2 which included vegetable samosas, raita, lamb korma, tandoori chicken, garlic nan, and rice.  I also added chicken tikki masala, and an order of  saag allu (spinach with potatoes).

The cost wasn't bad (they take off $5 if you order the dinner for 2), and the food was fine, but not great.  I thought the samosa was a bit on the salty side.  The rest of the dishes were rather generic, nothing strikingly spectacular about them.

When hungry and looking for a affordable delivery, this could be the way to go.  The delivery was within the time stated, and the delivery person was friendly.

For really yummy Indian food, check out Great India Restaurant, a little further west on Geary.
author: Vicky M.

description:
Buffets are awesome!
I am a big fan of the all you can eat buffet.  That being said this is my favorite on in San Francisco.  Nine dollars and you can stuff your face with simosa, and tandori goodness.  
I do have a confession, I have yet to look at the menu at this place.  In fact I just realized after having lunch there the other day that they do in fact have a menu.  However, who cares the food is good, and the price is right.  The staff could be a little more friendly, but for nine bucks I am not complaining.
author: Eric M.

description:
Anyone who gives this a rating above 3 stars (I gave it 2, so i'm being generous with this comment) really has no idea what they're talking about.

It's not that I disagree with their taste-- it's that, at a certain point, you've exceeded the freedom of culinary opinion, and this is one such case.

They have a lunch buffet that's alright (indian buffets are usually atrocious).

If you order off the menu, or get it delivered, well, godspeed, but don't call me, cause i'll vomit through the headset.

They use basically the lowest quality of meat.  I think they feed their chickens other chickens, and then serve you their excrement.  Don't get me wrong, that still means you get a lot of chicken, but I wouldn't eat it.

The curry is a mess of heavy whipping cream and spice, and if you're considering getting the spinach, save yourself the trouble and eat out of the gutter.

It gets 2 stars because it delivers and has a buffet.
author: Michael P.

description:
I have ordered from Star India for many years, dating back to 1999 when I first moved to the city. Their lamb korma used to be wonderful. When that dish started to go downhill about three years ago I switched to the chicken tikka masala, which was terrific. Sadly, the last three times I've ordered takeout from Star India I've been very disappointed. The flavor just isn't there anymore. Their chana masala is bland and flavorless,  and the veggie samosas are epically oversalted. Their naan is still good, but what am I supposed to eat with it??

I'm bummed since there aren't many good Indian delivery options in the Upper Haight, and Star India always delivers in under 45 minutes.
author: Jenn S.

description:
here's the thing... i think the food is delicious. at least what i have had of it... meaning. garlic naan, chicken korma, mango lassi. only problem is that it isn't mind blowing good... and sometimes the price feels a little steep for that reason. i still order it though, almost once every two weeks. cause i am just that guy. i wish they'd spare me the trouble and just remember my voice and keep my credit card on file. 
ps - this is only regarding delivery as i have never set foot inside star india. for all i know there is no star india just a giant korma and lassi producing factory with about a 30 minute turn around time.
author: Ashley A.

description:
If you want FRESH and HEALTHY Indian food, this is the place to go.  Many Indian restaurants use heavy oils to cook their food and you can see this when the food is served, but not this place.  I am Indian and I know how Indian food is supposed to look and taste, and this place is the closest it gets to  a home cooked meal.  
Their buffet always has a variety of dishes and the waiters are alert and ready to make sure you have everything you need.  It is a clean place, and very comfortable to dine in.
author: rizz g.

description: I liked the chicken curry and their biryani a lot but everything else wasn't amazing.
author: No N.

description: I wanted to try some indian food and this one seemed okay, from reviews and from a distance. I came here one day and saw the place half full. I was greeted by a waiter asking me do I want the buffet or will I be ordering. I said the buffet. I went up the steps and saw only a few selections. I liked the chicken curry and the naan bread. I tried some papadams, some veggie pakora and samosa, and some others which I dont quite remember. The price was $9.99, plus tax is $10.94. This is a quiet little restuarant and whenever I want to have some indian food, this may be the place for me.
author: Jen M.

description: On a Wed evening, the buffet was open with about 8-10 entrees.  I don't remember how many since there was so much to choose from.  Personally, I prefer the food made to order so that it is extra extra spicy.  The entrees were delicious though just warm.  I have had Indian food from other places delivered to my residence hotter that what was served at this buffet.  Still, this is a place I would return to again.
author: Joe N.

description:
Good value Indian buffet in Richmond and the decor is okay.  Don't worry it's clean. (Way cleaner than Naan & Dirty on Irving).  A little cheaper than Tasty Curry on 9th but a place to revisit definitely.  Has tables that can handle a group of 8.

I haven't found a similar deal in the area - most other Indian places are much more expensive.
author: yohs m.

description:
Okay, so it's not the best Indian in the world but pretty damn good.  I was scared to try the buffet but it's actually really good, very fresh and great variety.  And it's $8.99.  Come on, that's pretty damn good.

For delivery, try one of their Indian Pizzas.  Oh my...very, very good.

Their delivery has always been fast and the orders have always been right - then again, we only live a few blocks away, just too lazy to walk over there sometimes.

My favorite dishes are the Chicken Tikka Masala, Fish Curry, Chicken Tikka Kabob, Beghan Bharta (sp?) and their saags (though they can sometimes be super spicy).  And their naan is awesome.

Lastly, they're pretty darn nice!
author: Suzanne L.

description:
Fast Delivery, makes this my top Indian place for order out.  I can usually get my order within 30 minutes - most other places take close to an hour.

I bike several times a week and each time on my way home, out of The Persidio Arguello Gate, I pass thru the sweet aroma coming out of Star India. I finally had to order and now I'm hooked. 

The chicken tikka masala is good and they even make it extra spicy, just the way I like.  The keema nan is also quite good.  Portion sizes are just right (enough to share or stuff yourself) and the prices are good.
author: Doug C.

description:
I came to the Richmond restaurant because the one on Polk street burned down.  The buffet looked crappy so I decided to order something from the menu.  The entrees come out in small bowls, but surprisingly I was pretty full by the end of it. 

The food was not bad, but the mood of the restaurant is pretty depressing.  The waiters look sad, there were so many random single men eatting by themselves, and it was just dead.  I don't foresee myself going back there again.
author: Annie S.

description:
Takeout review.

The place is definitely depressing inside. The 5 mins I spent inside waiting for my food was depressing enough, I can't imagine eating here.

CTM + Rice + Naan = $15. Expensive, to me. However, once I got home I happily realized it was easily enough for 2 meals, so that made me happy.

The CTM was really good, very creamy sauce. The Naan was a little chewier than I'm used to, but I didn't really mind.

The food was good, but I had to mark it down a bit for the environment and the price.
author: jared c.

description: Star India has some tasty food, and they keep all the buffet dishes fairly fresh.  But on recent visits, it doesn't seem to me that the food tastes as good as it did a few years back.  And the dirty men's room makes you feel a little anxious about how sanitary the food may be.
author: Jerry R.

description:
Excellent food. I am a big fan of the Chicken dishes!
 I have eaten in the restaurant many times and each time had a good experience. But what I think makes this place the best around is there fast and reliable delivery.
The Vegetable Jalfreezi is quite yummy!!!!
author: Sam M.

description: Love their buffet for $9.99. It's for dinner too (not just for lunch). I've only been to a handful of other Indian restaurants but the food here is delicious, and at the buffet price, a very good deal! I love their desserts and the people who work here are super nice.
author: Trish P.

description:
I am a frequent flyer at Star India - never been to the restaurant but get delivery every time. Normally I would give them 4 stars because the food is usually very good and tasty BUT in the last couple of months I have noticed that they have become very tight with their portions - you order coconut chicken and end up with a tub of sauce with 4 pieces of chicken! WTH?   plus around the same time it seemed as if they are watering down their sauce or something. The first time this happened I thought 1) This is unedible crap but 2) maybe they had a busy night and tried to stretch out the sauce by adding water ? It literally tasted like and had the consistency of water, it was so gross.   

Because I have been eating here for years I decided to try them a few more times and have been getting the same crap since then!   There is literally no flavor in the muck they serve you! And it's not cheap so I am really ticked off.
I seriously hope this business checks the reviews on Yelp and does something about this because as of right now I would never recommend this place to anyone or return myself. 

Naan n' Curry I am coming home!
author: J K.

description: This place was very good.  We didn't get the buffet this time since we used restaurant.com certificate and the food was delicious.  The service was great.  Very friendly people working here.  I enjoyed the massala and the potato naan was very good also.  Look forward to going back.
author: Harry E.

description:
I crave this place at least once a week. mmm.

When compared to other Indian restarants in the city the ingredients are obviously fresher! They deliver in Tupperware so you can eat it again the next day, and you have the choice of mild medium or hot. Good naan too. Not soggy or too crispy, just right.
author: Danielle G.

description:
I have ordered many times from this establishment and several times my food has turned up wrong cold or just bad quality.
Missing parts of the order.
The last time they refused to bring what they had missed and where rude on the phone when asked why.
I would stay away from this place its one thing to get bad food but to get ripped off !!!!! Well that is something else..........
author: Greg M.

description: Can I give a place 0 stars? This is the most depressing place ever. Do not come here. My boyfriend took me here once when we were starving and cranky for Indian food. I was so disappointed in his pick. This is where you go when you don't want to be seen with who you are with. No atmosphere, depressing people eating in here, even the food and buffet seem sad. Am I getting the message across? I was afraid to eat the buffet it just looked unappetizing and was flavorless. I think I ended up eating rice and salad and naan to be on the safe side. My boyfriend has since agreed that we will never ever go back there again.
author: Kristy H.

description: Satisfying buffet, lots of variety which included chicken pakoras- not a typical buffet item.  Food was flavorful and I got free mangos ice cream for checking in on yelp.
author: Sukhdeep H.

description:
Never been inside this place, keep in mind.  But the delivery was great!  Punctual, professional, proper temperature & packaging ... Pppperfect!

I am notoriously risk averse esp. concerning my beloved ethnic food selections, so I tend to order the standards (Palak Paneer, Lamb Curry, Saffron Rice/Basmati, Naan, all great)  ... once or twice it could have used more seasoning.  But  **when you order online** the "desired spiciness" is part of the menu option & never had that problem since.

Having said that, next time you crave Indian, expand your horizons by trying these:

* Indian Pizza (i hAte badly executed fusion, this was stellar)

* Chili Cheese Bread (if naan had a makeover it would be called)

* Mixed Appetizer Plate (+ a beer and dipping sauces, would have been its own meal, all fried to perfection & delivered in same condition, mMmm)

disclaimer: actually had to take a 15-20 min. bReak after eating the hot crispy assortment of appetizers -- just so i would be able to fully enjoy the main course. it. was. that. fn. good. oh yeah and the food was still hot.

epilogue: do you have aNy idea how good widmer's apricot hefewiezen is with spicy indian food?  ... goes down niiiiice!
author: Herb C.

description: I LOVE Indian food. And was very excited to have a restaurant in the neighborhood. And the food was actually good. But when I spent the next day attached to the bathroom with food poisoning, I made the decision to not go back.
author: Bill N.

description: Eh, it's alright. The food is average, which is what's to be expected. My friend's boyfriend loves this place for the all-you-can-eat buffet for $10. The food at the buffet is tasty enough. I liked the chicken tikka masala and the palak paneer out of all of the items. The flavors were actually a little on the bland side but I can see how it needs to appeal to non-spicy palates as well. Honestly, for the food and the quality, it is a pretty good deal.
author: Queenie C.

description:
Came here to have din din with some friends. I'd been ravenously, ravenously craving Indian food.  Unfortunately dinnertime Indian buffets seem to be a dying species... not too many to choose from. But this one proved to hit the spot just right.

The buffet takes up quite a small area but do not be fooled - quite a few flavors are featured. I especially enjoyed the syrup coated ghee balls (I don't remember what they are actually called), the two types of naan, and the tandoori chicken. 

If this wasn't so out of the way (I live in San Jose) I'd come here again and again. Really good value and good food.
author: Polly F.

description: I was excited to try this restaurant. Was really hoping to love the restaurant, it's right  next to the Indian Consulate. I had high hopes. The people working are very nice and that's why I gave them a 3 instead of a 2. The food was okay, but not very flavorful. I was hoping for bit more spices, but it was almost bland. Clean place, good location, nice people, not very flavorful.
author: Liborio M.

description:
The lunch buffet at Star India is a whopping good selection, and while $8.99 is a bit steep it was worth it. 

Most of the dishes I chose were sumptuous- tender veggies, good curries, delicious meat, fluffy rice, great naan. Service was quick and friendly, and though there were several people inside it wasn't crowded. 

A few quibbles- some of the buffet food was cold, and the lettuce in the salad was downright getting brown. The accompanying cucumbers were all delicious, though. Also, the signs atop the buffet were very confusing, so I was unclear what all was in each serving dish- could be a problem for those who eat one kind of meat and not another or have food allergies. 

Overall, I'd definitely go back to Star India- they have a few easily fixed problems, so I hope they repair that steamtable.
author: Steve M.

description:
After trying a number of places that deliver to my neighborhood, this is the only one that has made it onto my speed dial.  

If I was to choose one word to describe their delivery speed (which is totally acceptable), quality of food (I haven't been disappointed yet) and level of service (nice & efficient), it would be consistent.  That may sound a bit dull, but who wants a mystery when getting a good curry into your belly is at stake.
author: ohreleigh ..

description: I ordered from Star India via Waiters on Wheels for a work meeting. I ordered their 30-person platter. The portions were generous, but the saag paneer was the worst I've ever tasted. It was watered-down and bland. The channa masala and lamb curry were okay, but the flavors just didn't pop the way they should. I wonder if maybe they tone the spices down for the 30-person platter, but if I didn't want some spice, I wouldn't order Indian food!
author: Bethany T.

description:
If I could, I would give only half star for this restaurant.

My friend and I went for its buffet sometime ago, it was low quality even though it's only $9.99 per person.  Nothing positive I could actually comment on this place.  All I remember - the dishes they had were potatos with sauces, potatos inside puffs, potatos....they tried to make the dishes as cheap as possible.

Well, I understand the rent on Geary Blvd can be very expensive.  But, having tried the Kome Sushi buffet (with Chinese hot food served and all other variety of food choices) in the Daly City, there was nothing Star India buffet could compare to.  No comparison.  The owner of Star India probably should take the time-off and visit the Kome.
author: TG B.

description: Me and my husband came here one afternoon for their lunch buffet. The vegetarian selections were not good at all, but the chicken selections like th chicken tikka masala were good. The chai and gulab jamun were also good but the kheer was a disappointment. My favorite was the appetizer pakoras. For 9.99 i did not expect much, but I've had better buffets for that price. I would go again if i was in the area, but its not somehting i would travel far for.
author: Lovi K.

description: This place is amazing!!! I recommend it for those who crave for Indian Food like me! I brought my friends here one time during our class breaks (lunch time) and left very satisfied.  The buffet will not only gives you the variety of food, but it's warm and fast refill:) Service is excellent! It gets packed especially during lunch time but the server is very accommodating and patient. The Naan is always fresh and you may also request for a garlic one.  The chicken and lamb curry is DELICIOUS. Not too spicy but  spiced enough to taste a real Indian Curry=) The veggies are very good too. Start your meal with the Dahl Soup and end it with the hot Chai. Overall, I highly recommend this place!!! Price for the buffet is same for lunch and dinner which is $10.85! =)
author: Ronalyn S.

description: Is Star India under new management? Everything seemed improved, the dining room, the waiters, the food on the buffet. The $1.00 price increase is no big deal, down the street the Asian buffet is twice the price. There were some new selections on the buffet as well as all the original ones. The tandoori chicken was cut a bit different and was very tasty and flavorful but slightly dry. I like my tandoori chicken very moist and at home I soak the raw chicken parts in youghurt for 3 days before I put it on the firery hot coals. I love the green mint sauce and wish they could add a red onion sauce to the buffet. The lamb was quite good and the soup more flavorful and it was hot not warm like in the past, I like my soup hot as in temp. There is an Indian tea that is as strong as coffee, another item I would like to see added to the buffet in addition to the chai. All and all the improvements are considerable especially the new friendly waiters. In the past I always felt the waiters didn't like us and we didn't go as often as we might have. Now there is no reason not to go, I give this place 5 stars for the food, the restaurant and the waiters. Huge improvement over last visit.
author: Alan H.

description:
I ate here recently at the $8.95 all you can eat buffet. I enjoyed it immensely and would/will eat here or order delivery from them in the future.
I'm deducting a star however because my dinner companion that evening hated the experience, plus he said the food made him ill.
I don't blame the food as I don't exactly have a cast iron stomach and
had no problem digesting. Perhaps he was sucking on Altoids or Tic Tacs prior to the meal. I'll have to remember to ask him that....
author: angelique b.

description:
Generic, but decent, Indian buffet. They've raised the prices, I think. But whatever, I go here all the time after work sometimes because I am so ungodly hungry and they never look at me with judgment when I go up to the buffet table like five times. Yay!

The buffet is always fresh whenever I've been there. They're right by the Indian embassy and cater to that clientele, so yes, the food is "authentic," which clearly matters so much to some of you. More importantly for me, it's tasty.
author: M J.

description: We work 10+ hour days so when we do get home, we don't want to cook--so food places that deliver are our salvation.  Got a flyer in the door for Star India so let's try it.  Oh man, it was bad.  The yogurt and cucumber was bubbling (literally) and the yogurt smelled rancid so we just dumped it.  Everything else just...wasn't right.  All the sauces tasted like they had been heavily watered down.  Needless to say, we don't eat from there anymore.
author: Kai T.

description: Not too bad... just don't get the buffet. Order your food from the menu. I like the food... especially their lamb saag. They have it on different name, but it's lamb with spinach sauce.. it's GOOD. Although, I must say, their prices are a little bit too high for the portion they give us.
author: Daisy S.

description: I have been ordering delivery from this restaurant for about 3 years.  The food is better than average, and it is only mildly overpriced.  The delivery people are usually very friendly and prompt.  Overall, I do recommend this place
author: Maggie B.

description: I love this place for delivery!  The chicken tikka masala is white breast meat, the veggie korma is fresh and spicy (on request) and the samosas and mango lassi's hit the spot.  Usually takes less than an hour and always comes hot!
author: Dan D.

description: $10 for all you can eat, that is sucha steal! But I will have to say that I am not really a fan of Indian food, but may be I will give them a try, another time...Some dishes were too spicy! One of the buffet things was some kind of plastic disposable thing, which was kinda weird. I really like the orange chicken thing was yummmy!!! I wished they would clearly state the name of the dishes. The naan was delish!! The rice dessert was quite yummy.  Service was okay, the workers were kinda scary though..
author: Janet Z.

description: Hello! This place has an EVENING BUFFET, which in itself earns 4 stars! The naan wasn't the best, but everything else was pretty delicious. And given that I'm used to dining at Shalimar, the ambiance at Star India is certainly a notch up for basically the same price. They will charge a $5 corkage if you bring your own wine, though.
author: Michelle D.

description: Many of the buffet items (in conjunction with each other) are 100 percent more effective than a full-on colonic! And more delicious than a cold jet of water violating your anus at high speeds could ever be!
author: mark s.

description: The price is ok, $9.99 for the buffet at anytime any day. I'd rather they raise the price and improve food quality and offer more drinks like a mango lassi. Food was bland, even the chai tea! Curries tasted a little watered down, definitely not quality stuff. It's cheap.
author: David L.

description: I like to eat Indian but I no like this place.  Food smell funny. Taste is weird. And people say cheap. No cheap. And I order to go take long time. No on time.
author: Elizaveta C.

description: Ok so I love this play a whole bunch and with a $7.95 all you can eat buffet it's well worth the trip all the way from my part of the city. However keep in mind that although it says they will deliver for free anywhere it's not always true. Apparently they've only got one driver at a time serving the whole city and if its busy  ha. Often times when I call and ask for delivery alhough they'll deliver they've attempted to charge me delivery fees or took forever to delive, I've waited up to 2.5 hrs.  Most other times they just plain old told me they woldn't do it.  So the free delivery to anywhere is a bit of a stretch but their food is so good I'm willing to take the trip to dine in or take out.  Try the sag paneer it's delicious.
author: Marie B.

description: star india is hecka good. their buffet is top notch, and the place has a good vibe. you can't beat the prices. overall i would say this place is rated PG (pretty good!)
author: Ja A.

description: I've never actually been into the restaurant, but this is my place for delivery. The chicken korma is delicious - so delicious that I never end up ordering anything else... except of course naan. They even deliver wine, which is helpful on those nights that I'm particularly lazy or the weather is particularly shitty. And the delivery guy isn't even afraid of my dog.
author: Suge K.

description:
Fact is - I love this place enough to give it 5 stars but that's mainly because it's a all-you-can-eat (and I feel like I should consider the quality of the food rather than the quantity).  Their samosas need a little bit of work (less potato, more spice) and they need to bring them out more often in addition to the naan.

I've never really gone to an indian restaurant that wasn't tasty - this one gives you the opportunity to pig out.  Depending on how crazy you go, you might want to stay away from public areas for a while.
author: Ralph N.

description:
Most Saturdays, I go for a bike ride into Marin.  My route home brings along Arguello across Geary and many is the time in my post-ride hunger when my nose hairs have prickled at the tasty scents emanating from Star India.

Today, I finally got around to marrying those scents with tastes on my tongue and the experience was pretty good.

The buffet is in the back, well lit and well labeled so you know exactly what you're getting.  They had chicken tikka masalla, lamb curry, tandoori chicken, a few veggie dishes, daal soup, basic salad, plain rice, plain and herby looking naan and some kind of potato bread that reminded me of the bread you get at Ethiopian restaurants.  They also had samosas and some deep fried veggies and various sauces and dips.  For dessert, they had rice pudding and sweet doughy balls of goodness.

The samosa were pretty bland - tasty enough but hard to put your finger on exactly what it was you were getting.  Same goes for the potato bread things.  However, the curry dishes were actually pretty good.  I found the chicken tikka masalla to be mild and creamy, just like it should be, with big chunks of decent looking chicken and no bones.  The lamb curry was also very tasty - the lamb itself was quite fatty but for me that only added to the flavor.  Neither dish was particularly spicy but it certainly had enough going on to keep my mouth occupied.  In both cases, there was a high sauce to chicken ratio, but since you are serving yourself it is easy to use the spoon to cherry pick the best chunks of chicken and cut down on some of the sauce.

The tandoori chicken was a little boney - but I did get to the restaurant after the main lunch rush so perhaps I'd missed all the drumsticks and thighs.   The rice and naan were OK - rice was cooked decently, the naan a little chewy.

Just when I thought I'd eaten enough, I remembered that I'd seen some sweet stuff so I headed back with a little plate to scope it out.  The rice pudding was very good indeed - very creamy tasting and quite decadent.  The sweet doughy balls were also nice and made a good compliment to the rice.  I ended up going back for a little more.

The place seemed clean, had enough customers to keep the food moving even at 2pm on a weekday and best of all, the things that were supposed to be hot were actually hot - there are few things in this world that I like less than tepid buffet food (yes, I'm talking to you, Lee's Deli - would it kill you to turn up the temp on your food heaters?) and I can happily say that at Star India the temp was definitely hot enough.

For $8.65 including tax I'll definitely be inclined to stop off next time I am riding past.
author: Adam S.

description: Decent food for a buffet. Everything tasted pretty fresh but some of the dishes had that glazed over film on the sauce...nothing that can't be cured by stirring it around a bit. I used that as my guide in what buffet items were the most popular, hence the freshest. If you're going to eat here I recommend only doing the buffet. Otherwise you pay way too much for mediocre food. Delivery was quick but often arrived a little less than warm.
author: Jackie O.

description: $9 for lunch and dinner buffet.  Hot damn! Delicious and healthy Indian food in a quaint little venue.  Great service - they never fail to keep your water glass full, I can tell you this much.
author: Scott G.

description: Good buffet. The staff of an Indian restaurant was great. They actually spoke ENGLISH!!! That in it self should be good for an Indian place! Seriously their buffet was excellent, large selection and many vegetarian selections as well. Will definitely go back next time I am in SF.
author: Mack S.

description: Probably a 3-star place but for me this place has earned 5-stars for 6+ years of consistent delivery of basically the same order.  I gues that averages out to 4-stars.
author: Ryan P.

description: Terrific Indian delivery. Lamb Coconut Curry with zero vegables. Just the way I like it. The Naan is also just right and not burnt as it often is. I always order a Mango Lassi, sortof a mango milkshake, as well.
author: Rob H.

description: First place that I ever had Indian food.  From that point forward, I always ordered naan, samosas, and saag paneer and compared them with the ones from Star India.  Somehow they just didn't compare, at least not yet.  Maybe it's like what Sade said, "Never as good as the first time..."?
author: jen a.

description: My experience at Star India in SF was perfect!! I'm very particular about dining at Indian restaurants due to oily, bland, or lack of service I've encountered at Indian restaurants in the past. However, Star India was the exact opposite. The food I've eaten, whether buffet or al a carte has been absolutely delicious!! The service was magnificent as well. The establishment was clean, and the employees were very courteous and friendly. I'll be back...keep up the good work Star India!!
author: Mike J.

description: I totally agree with Kristy H. review. The place was aweful!  I wish there were 0 stars rating available here.
author: Sunshine H.

description:
I've given these guys so many shots.  At first, I thought, 'Wow, decent Indian food in SF, and they deliver,' but then after a string of screw-ups and food poisoning, I'll never order from them again.  The first few times I ordered, the food arrived quickly and tasted pretty good.  Portions were alright, and nothing was absurdly oily.  

The next week, they took my delivery order than called me 15 minutes later to say that I would need to pick up the food myself, since they didn't have a driver. Uhh...not the norm, but I went ahead and drove across town to get my lunch.  A few weeks later, my roommate placed a delivery order, which arrived on time, but then a duplicate of her order arrived 15 minutes later.  For some reason she agreed to pay for this extra food, but that kind of sloppy service rubbed me the wrong way.  Last Saturday, I decided that I'd give them one more shot.  

The food arrived on time and looked great, but there was one caveat: I felt sharp pains in my stomach immediately after eating it and then I experienced acute food poisoning, screwing up my plans for the evening.  Many thanks to chef for the fecal contamination of my dinner.  If you've ever seen the restaurant itself, you'd understand how that's entirely possible.  Really unkempt, unorganized, and unclean.  Fuck this place, they suck.
author: Karthi X.

description:
an all you can eat buffet with enough variation and quality.

i think i visited on a tuesday, and we were the only people eating in the restaurant.  a lady did come in, mentioning something about an internet online order, which they obviously didn't receive.  

the food was good, and the service was nice (but really how much service do you get at a buffet?)
author: Ameer N.

description: This isn't bad.  I was suprised on how cheap it was.  THe service is very nice and friendly and it is quiet.  I haven't tried anything but the buffet so far but ths is a great lunch spot and the buffet was kept very fresh.   I wish there were a few more options though.
author: Nikki W.

description: Believe it or not, I have never stepped foot in this place - I am basing my review solely on take-out (they deliver to my work). The chicken tikka marsala is a good contender to Naan'N'Curry's, but the items I love most are the saffron rice (a great change-up from traditional jasmine rice) and the appetizer sampler, which includes samosas, fried veggies and other goodness. Hopefully one day I will sit down for their all-you-can eat buffet during lunch time!
author: Jenz y.

description: This place is phenomenal.  By far the best deal for any Indian food in town, and probably the second best tasting Indian food I've ever had (New Delhi around Union Square is delicious).  Staff here is really friendly, and the buffet for the most part is always fresh.  A few times when I went near closing time the stuff was gettin kinda cold, but hey, that's life in the buffet biz i guess.  Awesome date place, something different in a cool neighborhood, and its quiet.   Some cool bars in the area too.
author: Matt S.

description: The insides were colorful, and there were a decent amount of people in the night we came. The servers were fairly attentive and kept our water glasses full.  The food was okay, definitely not the best Indian food I've ever had, but not the worst either.  They had a buffet which was pretty cheap, but  we ended up ordering off the menu so I can't comment too much on that.  The whole experience didn't leave me with much of a feeling, so I'll probably seek out another place for when I have a taste for Indian.
author: Kristine C.

description: I LOVE THIS PLACE!! The food and the customer service is amazing!! Being a local resident of SF I always come to this spot. The owner makes it a great atmosphere and is always welcoming new customers. The buffet prices are really cheap for the quality of food they give you. They also have a great menu outside of the buffet options. I highly recommend this place for anyone looking for cheap, quality Indian food that comes with great service!
author: H M.

description: I was incredibly disappointed with Star India. Let's face it, everyone who goes here goes for the $10 all-you-can-eat buffet. The food was ridiculously tasteless. The kheer was watery, the gulab jaman tasted like Entenmann's popems dipped in watered down honey. The chana masala was bland. As if that wasn't bad enough, 3/4 of the food was cold. On top of that, all 4 waiters stand there and stare you down while you eat. Save yourself the time and money and find another all-you-can-eat Indian buffet.
author: Lisa F.

description:
So, I've heard a lot of complaints about their delivery time. However, I guess I was lucky and they delivered in 30 minutes sharp. 

Unfortunately, that's where the luck runs out. I go back to my apartment and open the naan and guess what I find, a strand of hair! I called back and after saying the word hair and explaining that it's the stuff on your head for a few minutes they finally understood and send another one in about 20 minutes.

I'll admit their curry was good, but their paneer was horrible. Not the authentic soft kind, it was hard and seemed that it wasn't even cooked in the curry.

Lastly, their naan was flat out not acceptable, even for a quick and dirty place. Naan N Curry has better naan than this place. The garlic naan didn't even have real garlic, it was just garlic spread! 

Overall, I'm definitely unhappy and won't ever go back. If you still dare to try it out, good luck and hope God's on your side!
author: Karan M.

description:
eh....that picture of this dump on here is very misleading.  i was just there yesterday and even though it was bright and sunny outside, it was dark and gross inside.  anyway, besides that, if i could give this place a negative rating or no stars, i would.  there are flies hovering above you while you're eating, the condiments on the table probably haven't been checked or containers wiped down for months, the food in the buffet was barely room temperature.  last time i ate a meal, i thought food should be hot...but maybe that's just me.  after a plate of lukewarm food, my boyfriend and i got up quickly to pay so we can get the hell out of there and i was stunned to see that they scored a "96" (or 98...can't remember) on their inspection.

i looked into the opening to the kitchen after seeing that possibly fake inspection card and saw bits of food and greasy looking stuff on the floor....like seiorusly, this place is dirty besides giving indian food a bad name. 

oh yeah, i walk by this place almost daily on my way to work and on trash day, it sucks because i, and other innocent pedestrians, have to walk by their overflowing and sometimes spilled all over the sidewalk trash can and it reaks.

anyway, i don't know why i ate there last night.  i feel cheated.  i want my money back but hey, maybe they'll use that money towards something good....like cleaning.
author: Sally T.

description:
we ordered a dinner for two to be delivered on christmas night... the food was DELICIOUS and the service was incredible. 

We gave them kind of a complicated order and as a result one item was missing when it was delivered. I called back to tell them and they apologized, said give them 10 minutes, and in less time than that someone showed up at our door with said item. Not only did they not charge us for their mistake, they gave us a free coke :-)

incredible place, and I would definitely recommend it. 

...oh and almost forgot; they serve the best mango lassie I have EVER tasted! It arrived at our door tasting fresh, slightly creamy and very cold...
author: Sam S.

description: If I could give 0 star, I would. From my experience, it was one of the worst indian food I've tasted. The naan was limp and oily, the chicken tikka masala lacked spices, and the chicken tikka kabab reminded me of leftovers from a thanksgiving dinner (a pile of dried up chunks of chicken which I doubt they marinated or seasoned). I think the one star I'm crediting them for goes to the mango lassi, which was the only thing that I ended up consuming.
author: lisa m.

description: Last night: cold, hungry, tired, craving something spicy. I called Star India for delivery and ordered the veggie korma and the lamb biryani. Holy moly, I don't know if it was because it was the end of the night and they were trying to get everything out of the kitchen or what, but they sent me enough tasty, perfectly spiced lamb biryani for 3 dinners, with lots of large hunks of lamb. And the veggie korma, as someone else noted, was made with big chunks of real, never-seen-a-can vegetables and a goodly amount of coconut. Happy mouth, happy belly.
author: Fawn F.

description: Of all the Indian buffet restaurants nearby, this is one of the better ones. I was craving for some Indian food and had passed by a couple of times, so I thought about giving it a try. The interior was quite nice for a Sunday brunch. They had all the Indian buffet classics: chicken tikka masala, saag paneer, tandoori chicken, pakoras, etc. In the middle of eating, I realized that the food here was much more appetizing than many other Indian buffets, which caught me by surprised. I had a hard time not stuffing myself with Gulab Jamuns. I think the people were a bit annoyed that my friend and I chatted away for an hour, but in this kind of economic climate, they're lucky they even have patrons. Well, it won't bother me if they don't tell me.
author: Alex Y.

description: My last review was harsh but honest. Seems that Star India is back to preparing good food! While there was a period where the food was lacking flavor, things are looking up! I was back there about two weeks ago and it was excellent. The dessert, which I had never tried, is soooo good. For the first-timer, the buffet is a really great place to start. Because it is usually fairly busy, fresh food is constantly being brought out. Here you will find lots of vegetarian dishes aside the carnivore's paradise.
author: francez M.

description: This is your basic Curry Powder Express. The McD's of Indian hash houses. I've tried it a few times, delivery included, and do not like it. The food is quickly and carelessly cooked, with none of the rich aromas and layered spices associated with good Indian food. For $12.00, the lamb coconut I had was made from tough, undercooked stew meat that did not taste fresh.  The $12.00 prawn coconut was bad as well, with only 5 or 6 small, overcooked prawns that tasted frozen. That $10.00 buffet is pure slop  and the flavorless items don' t seem to change. The worst of them is lamb or goat neck bones floating in a mucky, brown sauce. Service is brusque and impersonal. This restaurant's main interest is obviously money, not good food.
author: Pam J.

description: Been here a few times to get a quick indian food fix.  At $9.99 for buffet dinner, its not bad at all.  Not the best indian food but good enough for the quick fix.
author: ed c.

description: Mediocre taste and meat quality. Meat kinna tough.
author: Robert S.

description: Not only did the food never arrive, (after a grueling two hour+ wait), but when we eventually gave up for some instant mac'n'cheese, Star India was not even appologetic. We will NOT be falling into that trap again... STAY AWAY. I'll be checking my bank records to make sure they don't charge me for the food that never came.
author: Isaac E.

description:
$10, all you can eat dinner buffet?
