sounds like a winner, but i would rather spend the extra money at Pakwan and get some real good stuff. The lamb curry was tasty, but other than that and the raisins in the rice, i was less than impressed.

if youre on a tight budget, but a heavy eater, then this could help with you dining dilemmas. otherwise, you could find much better. the quality is sub par.
author: Darrell L.

description: I love Indian Food buffets and I goto extreme lengths to find good ones. Star India makes the top of my list for sure. It is a $9.95 buffet with so many options including samosas, garlic naan, paneer, vindaloo, jaipur veggies, lamb, salad, dal, dessert and some super strong chai tea! Everything is replenished often as most people who come here to eat seem to get the buffet (at least every time I've been in that's how it has been). The quality of the food is really great and everything tastes just so yummy.
author: Elly S.

description: I came here again due to its convenient location and my craving for Indian food. But man, food is soo bland. And service, still awful. The 2 main guys who serve here are so arrogant and grumpy, its unbelieveable.. These guys have a chip on their shoulder and they are proud to let all their customers know. How this place stays in business blows my mind. Go to India Clay Oven, or have food delivered from them, They are sooooo much better.
author: Zach D.

description: If I want Indian food and don't want to leave the house, then Star India is the place to call. I dig their Aloo Gobi (the cauliflower is never over-cooked, the potatos are perfect and the spices are just right), and their Chili Chicken is very yummy. I try to love the Naan, but truth be told, through no fault of their own, it's just kind of soggy by the time it gets to my place, so I recommend that you stick with the saffron rice. Other than that, decent Indian delivery for a decent price.
author: Suepattra M.

description: I've only gotten delivery from here.  Who could blame me, they ticket our homes/apts like mad at least once a week.  When I order from here it is usually their pizza, which is nice but could use a little more flavor. There are closer, comparable Indian food restuarants that deliver quicker if I just want something hot, spicy and quick.  The nan is kinda thing and chewy.  I like FAT NAN.  They have a few things I can't get around North Beach(besides the pizza) like Dum Alo Vindaloo.  I'll have to say I've never gotten a dish that was truly spicy though. I like to sweat when I eat Indian food.   Only 3 stars b/c they've never blown me away or anything.
author: Jeremy P.

description: All you can eat Indian food for $9.99? Need I say more? I really like their samosas, chicken tikka, saag paneer and chicken tikka masala. Oh and they serve chai tea at the buffet as well as rice pudding and daal soup. Great Indian buffet place.
author: Helena H.

description: All Indian food gets a one-star handicap in my book just because it's so delicious.  This place isn't the most stunning or original, but they have a decent and affordable lunch buffet and there's never a wait for a table, which sometimes can be a bad omen but not in this case.
author: Deb T.

description: I ordered delivery and was very happy with my food : )  I liked their online menu- after I placed my order they called and confirmed within 5 minutes.  Delivery took a while, about an hour, but the food was good, spicy, and satisfying.
author: Sky B.

description: I've tried lots of different Indian restaurants for delivery but I always keep coming back to this one. I wouldn't go out of my way to visit the place, but for delivery with online ordering they're my favorite. Delicious samosas, good tikka masala, and reliably tasty food overall.
author: Molly O.

description:
The food here is OK.  The chicken tikka masala is fairly bland, the ground lamb curry is good, the "spicy" lentil soup fair, though definitely not spicy.  I added chili paste to nearly everything to "kick it up a notch."

When the naan first comes out of the kitchen it is good, but as it sits under the lamps, it becomes progressively tougher, until--at last--it resembles a rawhide chew.

I've definitely had better Indian food.  I would probably give it a slightly higher rating for the quality of the food, but it is served (In what seems an Indian buffet tradition.) lukewarm.  I'm surprised these Indian buffets manage to pass health department tests.  Oh, wait, this is San Francisco, the health-department inspector probably only gets out on even years.
author: Richard C.

description:
Dishes here seem to be hit or miss.  

In my experience (about 6 orders), the lamb dishes  and lenti/bean dishes dishes are the best.

(Lamb Vindaloo is excellent, Lamb Rogan Josh is very good)
(dahl and channa masala both pretty good) 

I would steer away from the chicken  and vegetarian dishes (and I love vegetables).

(chicken tikka masala & tandori not great - chicken not well seasoned),
(saag paneer, alou ghobi, lacking flavor, a bit oily, and mushy).

They have great naan and great rice.  

I have only ordered takeout and it seems to be a bit expensive also -- the buffet may be the way to go but I live a few blocks away so I'd rather eat at home.

(My favorite meal is spicy lamb curry and some hot nann -- get home fast and have it with a cold beer).
author: david s.

description: Star India has a great all-you-can-eat buffet section.  For just $8, I recommend going to this place for your first time when trying Indian cuisine.  You wouldn't have to fork over the $8 and only get one dish when you can try them all.  One of my fewest times trying Indian cuisine, I've got to say you're getting a deal.  The food is not bad, a bit spicy.  The serving staff is great.  The buffet section wasn't as large as I expected, but there's a good variety.
author: Christi S.

description: Although this place doesn't have the largest buffet selection in the world, their masala is tasty. I like the okra and samosas too. Low price to pay for a good buffet. There are usually lots of Indian people eating here which is always a good sign, right?
author: Jen Y.

description: Me and my boyfriend so happened to give this place a try. And it was good, we have never been to their all you can eat buffet, but we've gotten take out several times. Their lamb is great, chicken is always dry, but its because its the white meat off the chicken breast. The sauces are always prepared delicately, and the Naan is so soft and warm. We love this place, its our go to take out indian cuisine place...(mouth full of words)
author: yana Z.

description: Are you in a rush for a quick lunch?  Run over to Star India, hop in the buffet line, and grab some tasty grub.  You'll be in and out of there in 15 minutes!
author: Tim G.

description:
Ok- first of all---the picture posted for this restaurant is not correct...I've been there many many many times and it is nothing like that- Seriously--- I don't see the buffet area (place is actually smaller than picture posted). 

Anyway, if I am craving for keer (dessert) this where I usually go and also for fast dinner with no wait...Since they always serve the same food all the time, it gets tiring. I do however like their BBQ chicken, lamb curry, the one with spinach (can't remember the name) and of course the keer (rice dessert) and sugar balls...If you mix these two, aleluiah! (but watch out for the calories though but who cares ;) ) 

The guys as usual are always friendly, place is clean and the interior design is ok. If you want fast indian buffet food- go to this place. It's about $8.99 per person for dinner + tax of course...
author: JM M.

description: My partner and I went all the time -- like, way too often, multiple times a week -- for a while, until a waiter started hitting on us on behalf of another patron who went every day and saw us and wanted to get to know us.  EEEW.  So then we stopped.  We've started going again and its yummy yummy yummy, but there's that one star's worth of nervousness.  So, nothing wrong with the food, but bad boundaries that someone else noted too.   I probably wouldn't go eat here by myself.
author: Nora B.

description: The economy sucks:  they raised their prices from $8.99 to $9.99 for lunch or dinner buffet.  I used to come here a lot and pile on the food on my plate and go back for seconds with my greediness.  Now before you judge, everyone does it!  That's what buffets are for!  I used to leave a whole plate behind because my eyes are bigger than my stomach.  When I came here last night, I did it again and one of the workers or owner or whoever he was came up to me and said, "You didn't finish your plate.  The next time don't take more than you can eat."  Look asshole, I've done this about 10 times here, that's pretty freakin' tactless to come up to a customer to do that and the next time I come here I will pile on 4 plates and only eat one just to piss you off.
author: Nezza F.

description: This place is a good value, but the food could be better. It all tends to be rather heavy. If you go here, I would steer clear of the buffet. I won't go so far as to accuse Star India of giving me food poisoning on multiple occasions, but I have noticed that the buffet items aren't maintained at safe temperatures. Curry Village in the Sunset is a much better choice if you're looking for a buffet.
author: Aaron L.

description:
food is okay- 3.5 stars. 
 
service, at least for delivery, is not good- more like 1 star.  the guy is not nice, never remembers your name, and generally gets your address wrong.  i have to repeat it at least 2x for him to get my address right, and I order regularly.
author: Nushie N.

description: This place is now in my speed dial when I need indian delievered.  I haven't really had a bad meal from this place.  Their ground lamb kebabs are pretty good as well as the eggplant and other usual suspects.
author: Bruce B.

description: It's all about the Chicken Tikka Masala... This was my first introduction to indian cuisine. Although I've had fresher and better quality ingredients at other restaurants (very few, I can only recall Breads of India by name), the CTM is amazing. Not as consistent as I'd like, but never a disappointment. And now with CTM as a staple of their $8 buffet (lunch AND dinner), I am a devoted follower. I eat here or order delivery at least three times a month. If I could eat only one dish for the rest of my life, it would be Star India's Chicken Tikka Masala.
author: Vanessa L.

description:
this place was recommend by a friend's friend--so they absolutely told us we had to try the tandoori chicken pizza.

so we ordered take out--the pizza was really really good!  it almost tasted like a healthy pizza because there wasn't a gang of cheese on it that adds to the greasiness like other pizzas do. we didn't order anything else.  

Food: really good--but i'm only basing it on the tandoori pizza.

oh, btw--reading the previous yelper Doble V. i am very picky about eating in certain restaurants due to possible health risks that may be encountered (i.e. are the cooks notwashing their hands as frequently as they should?--most common food borne illness) i know first hand, so i guess i'll wait and hope for the best...
author: Aleli L.

description:
i owe star of india an apology.

 we were entertaining and needed food to satisfy a group of very hungry and slightly aggressive people. after perusing their website and yelp reviews, we placed a phone order. 

 the staff was friendly, and allowed us to make a substitution on our delivery order (vegetarian dinner for 2, and non-vegetarian dinner for 2). the restaurant and driver were very efficient and delivered a hulking bag of food in less than a half an hour.

 i began removing items from the bag and mistakenly miscounted. i called the restaurant, and they sent the driver back out and delivered a piping hot container of coconut chicken in less than 10 minutes. i am sorry star india restaurant, for my mistake, and promise to not drink any wine before my next order (the original order was correct)!

 the food was spicy, according to taste. please note, the coconut chicken is not very coconutty, but was so good, i almost cried. again, i could chalk that up to the wine, but i am pretty sure the food was made with magic.

 the food is great, the staff is kind, prices are reasonable, and delivery was F-A-S-T. i should also add; upon his second trip to my apartment, the driver was just as nice.
author: Andy P.

description: this place is awesome! they have great service and the food is amazing! i recommend the chicken pakoras, they are wayy yum!!!
author: Pragya S.

description:
there is a decided dearth of good indian restaurants around, but i gave this one a try due to a serious craving for naan. and it wasn't bad; even better it's close to my house. ordered take out from the on-line form. minus points for being reprimanded when i arrived- apparently they are charged for everyone who orders on-line. hmm, so why offer it? it was suggested that i call next time. and there might be a next time- the samosas were good, the aloo gobi was tasty; the garlic naan seemed to be missing the garlic, but was nice and chewy. 

next time i might try the buffet- it's offered for lunch and dinner for $10.
author: jean k.

description: This is my favorite Indian take-out, hands down. Their chicken korma is the best and their chicken karahi is a fiery taste sensation. Great veggie pakora and garlic naan, too. The bonus is that when you order delivery, they say they will be there is 45 mintues, but what they really mean is 4 to 5 minutes. They're speedy!
author: A Y.

description: I come here regularly for the brunch buffet which is tasty and quick - parking is easy and there is never a wait for a table.  I agree with Deb T on all points - a good basic place.  I like that they serve dosas at the lucnh buffet - not a lot of indian places have that, so that's cool!
author: Sue U.

description: Prices are good for buffet.  When I went, the food was a bit soggy-looking Some items had been out for a while I guess.  Definitely heavy on the ghee and spices.  It gave me some indigestion later.  I fell asleep for an hour afterwards because my body was so overwhelmed by all the food.  Maybe just me overeating?  Overall worth trying if you love Indian food and have a strong stomach and digestion.  Cheap eats for the low-budget crowd.
author: Ed M.

description: This place is awesome. $8.95 is a really great price for this buffet, especially because the food is great, with a really large vegetarian selection. My roommate and walk here from our house whenever anyone mentions Indian food, because once this restaurant is in our heads, the only way to get it out is to EAT EAT EAT. Also, the service there is awesome. Once, they ran out of naan (about 20 minutes before closing), we asked if there was more, and 5 minutes later, they brought a few steaming pieces right to our table.
author: Jordan S.

description: I grew up coming here so when I moved back to the city a year and a half ago, this was def a destination. The buffet cannot be beat. All the offerings are yummy and there's always great vegitarian dishes to choose from. Love.this.place.
author: A S.

description: It isn't all that great. The lunch buffet is $9.99 which I think is a decent price but not so much when the food is cold. The owner didn't even bother to heat anything up which I thought was kind of rude. Sorry but I'm not coming back here again.
author: Jasleen K.

description: Love it, love it, love it.  Buffet for dinner not just lunch and the Tandoori Chicken pizza is amazing.  If you love Indian food you will love this place.
author: Rick R.

description: New owners, food bland and old, it looked and tasted like it had been on the buffet cart for days.  Naan was not naan but more like a tortilla.
author: cathleen m.

description: Always order delivery from here. Very nice drivers and yummy food, plus they give me enough for 3 meals!!
author: Kate B.

description: I have been dining at and getting delivery from Star India for 10 years. They were by far my favorite Indian place in the city, but for some reason the quality of delivery food has gone way down. The buffet is still good, but my last two deliveries were simply awful.  The Chicken Tikka Masala was not spicy at all...it was abnormally sweet like they used a lot of sugar.  I will give delivery one more chance before I find a new place. HOWEVER, their Chicken Tandoori pizza rocks - both dine-in and delivery. Best Tandoori pizza around.
author: Erica G.

description: I ate here yesterday for my grandmother's birthday lunch.  I've been here in the past and the food tasted the same as i remembered.  Nothing special but hits the spot if your craving some indian food.  The food could be a bit warmer though.  The naan bread and curry are decent.  For the 9.99 lunch price you can't go wrong.  Also as others have said, i noticed other indians/pakistani people grubbing here which means it can't be that bad.
author: Stephen C.

description: We eat here a lot, and we eat a LOT here.  The only thing is to keep from going back over and over again until you are sick.  Lots of good vegetarian choices.  The only thing is the price keeps creeping up for the buffet and at some point I'll decide it's not worth it.  Try Suraj in Redwood City for a huge buffet if you're going to pay close to 9 bucks.
author: JV K.

description: I'm clueless when it comes to this cuisine and the waiter did a wonderful job helping us make entree selections.  The food was great and the prices were reasonable.  :)
author: a e.

description: Not the best Indian food I've had, and not the worst.  I have only used Star India for delivery.  They arrived within the stated time frame (which is ALWAYS great when you're starving) and the portions were... decent.  Honestly, I expected the portions to be a tad larger.  bottom Line:  If I was jonesin' for Indian food and had no better delivery option, then I would order from them again.
author: Mrs. Morty N.

description: I went here last Thursday.  The food was very good. The flavoring of the various curries was excellent.  The host was very friendly and attentive.  I recommend this place to everyone.  The all day buffet is a great deal  because it lets you try a variety of food.  The restaurant recently changed management and is on the upswing.
author: Anant R.

description: Came here with my old professor from USF.  Used to live 1/2 block down on 2nd Ave.  The buffet was decent, especially for only 10 bucks.  I managed to wolf down 3 helpings of things, mostly the tikka masala.  I know, I know...tikka masala is to Indian food what the burrito is to Mexican food :)
author: Poutine G.

description:
I can smell this place about half a block away and it drives me mad with passion. I have tried a couple times to eat at one of the japanese places on the same block but when we walk nearby, my brain screams "INDIAN NOW!"
Do the buffet. Trust me. It is the best deal in town: $8 for unlimited quantities of half a dozen delectable Indian favorites. Of particular star quality is the Vegetable Korma, and the varying veggie specials are also usually really tasty. I also love the chicken tikka masala, the tikka barbequed chicken, the rice, the saag paneer (which is a strangely dificult dish to find done well in SF for some reason) and the little fried battered veggie appetizer thingy which I cannot remember the name of.  Pakora? Also, order a mango lassi. Very good here: thick and tasty.
I always leave this place STUFFED because I have no self control when it comes to good Indian food and I always end up eating another plateful after I'm already basically full because it is so good.
However, I give it a 4 star rather than 5 star (although it's 5 star if you count in the bang for your buck) because the samosas are only average and they don't refill the damn barbequed chicken often enough.
author: Melly B.

description:
My first review for Yelp, wooooo hoooooo. Okay not really, I could care less. Anyhow, I live around the corner from this place and have never taken the time to stop by. I brought my wife, aunt, and mom. All three people aren't ones to try new and adventurous stuff. So I thought there affordable buffett would be good. Wow, did this place deliver. My family LOVED IT. In fact we ended up ordering two side dishes to take home for some friends comming over later that night. If your going to order single dishes I wouldn't give it one star for the price..but so what its still well worth it...Thanks Star will be back for sure.

Side note: To the Chick and her boyfriend who attempted to eat (Friday night 11/09) and make excuses not to pay GET A LIFE! You guys looked like morons, even my 65 year old mom booed you on your way out. Loosers!
author: Tony H.

description: Indian curries delivered - Yippee Horray!  Star India rocks for their fast delivery and wide delivery range.  The food isn't the best Indian food I have ever had, but it's never been bad either.  The convenience factor more than makes up for that.  My favorite dishes are the Lamb Korma,  Chicken Tikki Marsala and Nan.  In total I have enjoyed the deliver service more than 15 times.  I have actually never set foot in the actual restaurant.
author: Melissa S.

description:
Went on a thurs night aniticipating awesome hot indian food. As we walked in, the ambiance is your typical restaurant, dimly lit and generic decorations.  
  I was pretty hungry, so i was looking foward to getting my grub on.  Went up to the buffet stand...number 1...plates were dirty.  number 2....food was cold.  The hot entress were warm at best, and the pakora and samosas were all cold.  Needless to say, not very impressive at all.  Their choices are about the same as other indian buffets, with your standard lamb/goat curry, basmati rice, chicken makhini, saag and other lentils and beans.  
Dessert was pretty unimpressive with freezing cold galub jamun and tasteless kheer.  The only thing I sort of liked was the mint chutney sauce to dip my cold samosas in.  
If you want great indian buffet..with hot food and awesome service..goto Kabila in Union City or Bombay Garden in downtown san mateo.   Prices are 1 dollar less there..and the food is piping hot and fresh all the time.
author: B A.

description: good stop for a lunch buffet, includes chai which is a bit watered down. good overall value. fresh naan brought to your table.
author: Eloy T.

description:
I've only been here for the lunch/dinner buffet, but it keeps me coming back for more.  The place may not look visually appealing initally, but once you get to the food, you will be satisfied.

Most buffets sacrifice quality over quantity, but this is not the case for Star India.  If you're looking for good Indian food, and lots of it, Star India is the place to go.  The chicken tikka masala is definitely one of my favorites; it is rich in flavor and contains tender pieces of chicken.  They also serve two kinds of Naan, which always tastes warm and fresh.

The service is friendly, and they respond to your needs.  They constantly refill your water and clear away your empty plates.
author: Edward L.

description:
I meant 3.5 stars. Good chicken and tandorri.

4 stars if more choices of desserts and dip.
author: Amy C.

description:
Definitely a great deal for the price you pay for.. curry is okay.. not TOO wide of a selection, but more than most indian buffets.
my favorite is still naan n curry. got to love their naans and chicken masala!
author: Dianne I.

description:
Great place for take out if you live in the inner richmond. Veggie samosas are bomb as is the chicken curry and vegetable biryanti. 

I have yet to try the buffet which seems to be why most people would be interested in eating in the restaurant.

They give you a ton of food. I usually am able to eat leftovers for three days, The people that work their have always been nice. 

I definitely recommend giving Star India a try.
author: Ronnie M.

description: We love star India:  If you need ambiance and people waiting on you this is not your place as their really is no service, because you go for the buffet which is all of ten bucks. Put your game face on, because you should go hungry or go home.  Get some naan bread and don't miss the soup near the plates which changes day to day.  If they have lentils give them a try, because it is hard to cook them that well at home. When your done with one plate, go get another, yes it is a buffet or do I need to back up.  Totally worth it.
author: Niko P.

description: I actually would rate this restaurant even lower if the scale permitted it....  Both my roommate and I got extremely sick after eating the meat option #2.  It was OK going in and terrible coming out... i won't say more but we were both up all night with PAIN.  I do recommend this place if you are into masochistic...
author: Katie g.

description: came in this restuarant at the spur of the moment, suppose to eat korean food in the richmond area but there was not a single person inside so we picked the one that had the most people inside and this place came on top along the two-block area... the food was fine, not too impressive... the naan was pretty good, the chicken was a bit dry and had to wait for a little for them to replenish the food but their lamb was really good... the place was packed, it was on a sunday... will come back again...
author: Surfer S.

description: pretty good and cheap. all you can eat for $10 bucks. in the buffet area doesn't have much choices but all the known indian foods anyways. so yea great place to eat indian food.
author: Tasha L.

description: i'm almost afraid to share our little secret with you in fear of them selling out fast but you have to try their tandoori indian pizza!  it's AMAZING and better than raja's in lower haight.  the vegetarian is even better that the one with chicken.  the eat-in buffet is not bad either if you get a hankering for indian food.  we haven't had any problems there and we're not broke college students either.
author: Cyn B.

description:
never knew this place existed until my buddy and i hit up the driving range and then were driving home, starving and deciding what to shove down our throats. he suggested star india because of the cheap dinner buffet and the fact that it probably wouldnt be crowded at that time (9ish on a thursday night). so i went along with it because, well, he's gary g. and he supposedly knows his shit. 
star india isn't all streamlined and fancy shmancy as the india clay oven on clement, but it is cozy and pretty clean. the staff doesn't really question you as to what you would like because they pretty much know that everyone is going to head for the cheap ass buffett of goodness. the buffet was neatly arranged and clean (thank god), with a pretty decent amount of choices. their tikka masala was decent and their saag paneer was a little weird (it had garbonzo beans in it) but enjoyable. their naan was pretty top notch and the waiter even brought some fresh garlic naan to our table while we were stuffing our faces.
although not overly friendly, the wait staff was efficient and ninja like, filling up our water glasses the minute they got low. 
overall a pretty good experience and definitely a must if i'm on geary and craving some cheap indian food. come hungry and with some elastic waist pants :) you'll thank me later.
author: Aly L.

description: Hubby and I love this place for one reason only, dinner buffet for under $20 for two! That's an A+ for us since we are the poor married couple still trying to save to buy an over priced condo int he city. Their buffet selection is your typical Indian fare with Naan, Tandori chicken, chicken tikka masala, and an assortment of delicious and fresh curry. They also have salad to help cool your mouth down from the spicy curry. The only thing that bugs me about this place is that the Naan tray is always empty!! I always have to wait at least 5-10 minutes for the next batch of fresh Naan to come out of the kitchen. Also, if I'm not quick on my feet, the Naan tray will be empty again within the minute. I swear people are total Naan whores!!! I see people take at least 4-5 Naan  and they don't even finish it at the end of their meal. Yes, I like to spy on the Naan whore tables. But, I guess I would be a Naan whore if I can make it to the buffet table fast enough...
author: Annie L.

description: so i order from this place constantly because im a lazy fatty.  i was a bit weary about ordering from an indian place just cause take out is not normally the best of quality.  but this place packaged everything above par.  it was neat and clean and delicious.  i will be ordering from you soon star india.  you are my savior.  so far i've loved everything ive tried.
author: Tiffany L.

description: We really like indian food, and Star India is always a great choice for good northern Indian cuisine.  The diced lamb in particular is awesome.  Very friendly staff, and we generally leave the place stuffed for a very reasonable price.
author: Larry M.

description: It's not amazing, but it's the best Indian take out in the area. I like their online ordering system and they have good takeout containers that don't leak. Reasonably priced too.
author: Sarah M.

description: the buffet at Star India is the freshest I've found in the Bay Area.  the Tandoori chicken is moist, not dry.  the saag paneer is thick and rich as is the veggie korma.  I love their vegetable samosa the spicing is incredible, same for their lentils or chickpeas (they vary the selection daily).  I especially like it when they have eggplant or okra as one of the several veggie dishes.  My friend likes the cabbage best and the ground lamb.  I like the lamb curry, papadums and chai.  I really appreciate the chai being unsweetened so I can sweeten it to my taste.  The staff is very friendly as well.
author: Ron A.

description: I have yet to actually try the food, although I am sure it is good.  I am writing because I ordered for delivery, which was supposed to arrive in 45 minutes to 1 hour, approximately 2 hours and 15 minutes ago.  At 1.5 hours I called, and they said the driver was on his way, had two orders prior to mine but would be there in 15 minutes.  And time continues to tick away.  If it ever does arrive, I don't see any way that it will be warm.  Next time, they need to more accurately predict their delivery time.  If I'd known it would take so long, I would have just picked it up.
author: F G.

description: I liked Star India.  The delivery took about 30 minutes, just as quoted.  The food was good and portion size was large.  The chicken curry had lots of chicken and portion sizes were generous.  The soup also had plenty of vegetables.  The order of samosa came with two large sized samosas.
author: M R.

description: it's Indian so they obviously have plenty of vegetarian options. i tend to order from them late-nite on the weekends and they get to my place very fast. i love their Dal!! the other food is good as well. the only reason they get 4 instead of 5 stars is that the food can be a little heavy. i think they use ghee, which is common among Indian restaurants, but isn't to my taste. i like to eat a meal and not feel like a sloth afterwards.
author: Daniel N.

description: I've only ever ordered takeout, but both times, I've been seriously happy with it. They're fast, not too greasy, and all five dishes I've tried have been excellent. So many places have majorly bland lamb vindaloo, but Star India's is SPICY! LOVE IT! The Non-Vegetarian Meal for Two (on the front of their takeout menu) is a great deal! 2 samosas, raita, lamb korma (delish), tandoori chicken, naan and rice for $23. Not bad! The mint chutney that comes with the samosas is to die for...quite spicy and flavorful.
author: Sarah Y.

description: Delivery is prompt, food is above average- chicken tikka masala is pretty good. A little pricey for the portions.
author: Lynn W.

description: pretty decent indian delivery food and  you can order online. favorite dishes: chicken tikka masala, saag paneer, bengun bertha (or however you spell it), garlic naan.  i take off a star because their navratan korma is not the tastiest i've had and they don't have malai kofta on the menu.
author: tasha h.

description: I have  only had the buffet here, but you can't get much better of a deal than it! They offer several authentic dishes and everything is very fresh which at a buffet isn't always the case. The service is also great and the wait staff always fills up the water so you never have to wait (a big plus to me cause I drink a lot of water).  The bottom line is that it is a wonderful value and great food! A tip on the desert : put the sugary dough balls in the rice pudding and let them soak a little...they are SO good!
author: william w.

description: We have them on our speed dial for delivery and it is excellent.  Delicious chicken tikka masala, karahi is fantastic, great garlic naan, and wonderful vege samosas.  yum.  Stopped in once for the buffet which was a great deal.  The place is a bit of a dive, but the food is excellent.
author: Jon B.

description: Super fast delivery and the food is pretty good but not great, but for the price this is a great deal, we order from here all the time.
author: R T.

description: Went there for the first time and it was awesome. I went for the buffett which had a lot of options (especially for vegetarians!). This is a great place to go if you've never eaten indian food before or always order the same thing. There are lots of different currys to try and deserts as well. The somosas and fried potatoes were my favorite! Only bad thing was the chai--stuck to my water all night. The ambiance of the place is great too.
author: Bena L.

description: good indian food for fair price and its a buffet. you cant really go wrong. its clean ok service for a buffet and they got enough food to fill you up and keep u satisfied. try it out.
author: Wats C.

description: If I could have done so, I would have given this place ZERO stars.This food is so bad that anyone who thinks it's edible clearly has never had good/real Indian food. There is one other Indian restaurant in the city that has food this bad...it's called India Palace. The menus are identical. I'm guessing that they cook the nasty food in the same kitchen and ship it to both restaurants to be reheated. That's the only explanation for why two Indian restaurants could BOTH be so HORRIBLE. We ordered from Star India for the first time after having many of their menus dropped at our door. Big Mistake. I took a bite of the naan and thought. "Hmmm. this kinda tastes like cardboard. Well, maybe it's not their forte." Well, every item we tasted was worse than the one before. It seems completely impossible to me that EVERY dish could be so bad! We ended up dumping everything in garbage. YUK. We actually keep the Star India and India Palace menus in our kitchen drawer with "BAD" scrawled on the front in black marker....so we never accidentally order from either of these places again. If you want good Indian food try Indian Oven or Roti.
author: Pam H.
